original: @100b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @100b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:üîΩHetubindu·π≠ƒ´kƒÅ

original: he tu bindu d'i ka / bod skad du /
analyzed: he tu bindu d'i ka / bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: gtan tshigs kyi thigs pa rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi thigs pa rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on the Drop of Reasons

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha.

original: gang zhig yon tan mchog rab tshogs can rigs pa'i rgyal po'i skye ba'i gtan tshigs la //
analyzed: gang zhig yon tan mchog rab tshogs can rigs pa'i rgyal po'i skye ba'i gtan tshigs la //
translated: To him who, with the reasoning of the king of reasons, the collection of supreme qualities,

original: rtags 'bad shes bya kun la mun pa chen po 'thab tshogs rtsa nas med par byas pa yang //
analyzed: rtags 'bad shes bya kun la mun pa chen po 'thab tshogs rtsa nas med par byas pa yang //
translated: Has made the great darkness of ignorance in all objects of knowledge disappear from the root,

original: stong pa srid gsum 'jigs spangs skye bo'o chu bo pha rol rgal ba de la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: stong pa srid gsum 'jigs spangs skye bo'o chu bo pha rol rgal ba de la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I pay homage to that one who has crossed the river of the three worlds, abandoned fear, and become free.

original: blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis bsngags bya gtan tshigs thigs pa rab gsal lugs rgyas rnam par dbye //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis bsngags bya gtan tshigs thigs pa rab gsal lugs rgyas rnam par dbye //
translated: The wise ones praise the Drop of Reasons, which is clear and has an extensive system, and is analyzed.

original: don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa'i rten rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa rnams ston par byed do ;
analyzed: don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa'i rten rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa rnams ston par byed do ;
translated: The words ‚Äúbecause it is just the inference that is the basis for establishing the hidden object‚Äù indicate the connection, the subject matter, the purpose, and the ultimate purpose of this treatise.

original: / gang gi phyir 'brel pa med pa dang / brjod par bya ba med pa dang / dgos pa med pa'i rab tu byed pa ni rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams khas mi len te /üîΩ'di ltar ji srid du /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir 'brel pa med pa dang / brjod par bya ba med pa dang / dgos pa med pa'i rab tu byed pa ni rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams khas mi len te / 'di ltar ji srid du /
translated: Those who are inclined to think do not accept a treatise that has no connection, no subject matter, and no purpose.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ba ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ma gtogs pa dang / de bzhin du ji srid du 'di'i dgos pa ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ba ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ma gtogs pa dang / de bzhin du ji srid du 'di'i dgos pa ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Therefore, as long as one does not know what the subject matter of a treatise is, one will not know what the purpose of the treatise is.üîΩAnd as long as one does not know what the purpose of a treatise is, one will not know what the ultimate purpose of the treatise is.

original: 'di'i 'brel pa ni gang zhig yin zhes bya ba yang dag par ma rig pa de srid du rab tu byed pa la dga' ba yang skyed par mi byed na mnyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa ni gang zhig yin zhes bya ba yang dag par ma rig pa de srid du rab tu byed pa la dga' ba yang skyed par mi byed na mnyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: And when one is not even interested in the treatise because of the question, What is the connection here? how much less would one engage in listening and reflection?

original: de lta bas na @101a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na @101a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: nyan pa'i skye bo spro bar bya ba'i phyir 'grel pa la sogs pa gsum brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: nyan pa'i skye bo spro bar bya ba'i phyir 'grel pa la sogs pa gsum brjod par bya ste /
translated: in order to encourage the audience to listen, the three, the commentary, etc., should be stated.

original: brjod par bya ba bsnyad pas ni 'di la brjod par bya ba ni ci zhig yin snyam du brjod par bya ba la brten pa'i rmongs pa de lta bu zlog par byed do //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba bsnyad pas ni 'di la brjod par bya ba ni ci zhig yin snyam du brjod par bya ba la brten pa'i rmongs pa de lta bu zlog par byed do //
translated: By stating the subject matter, one should stop the confusion about the subject matter, thinking, What is the subject matter here?

original: dgos pa brjod pa ni 'bras bu med par dogs pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: dgos pa brjod pa ni 'bras bu med par dogs pa zlog par byed do //
translated: By stating the purpose, one should stop the doubt that it is fruitless.

original: 'brel pa bsnyad pas ni thabs ma yin par dogs pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'brel pa bsnyad pas ni thabs ma yin par dogs pa sel bar byed do //
translated: By stating the connection, one should remove the doubt that it is not a means.

original: de 'dir de bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni brjod par bya ba dang dgos pa dngos su bstan to //
analyzed: de 'dir de bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni brjod par bya ba dang dgos pa dngos su bstan to //
translated: Here, the words in order to understand the particular directly indicate the subject matter and the purpose.

original: 'di brtsam mo zhes bya ba 'dis ni shugs kyis na rab tu byed pa thabs nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di brtsam mo zhes bya ba 'dis ni shugs kyis na rab tu byed pa thabs nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: The words I shall compose indirectly indicate that the treatise is a means to that end.

original: de la shugs ni 'di yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de la shugs ni 'di yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The indirect indication is to be understood as follows.

original: rjes su dpag pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa rtsom na rab tu byed pa ni don gyis na thabs nyid yin par ston par byed de /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa rtsom na rab tu byed pa ni don gyis na thabs nyid yin par ston par byed de /
translated: If one composes a treatise in order to understand the particular through inference, the treatise itself is indirectly indicated as a means to that end.

original: 'di ltar thabs ma yin pa la ni rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di ltar thabs ma yin pa la ni rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams mi 'jug go //
translated: For those who are concerned with the means do not engage in what is not a means.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the connection is indirectly indicated.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba 'di ni brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba 'di ni brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, the words in order to understand the particular indicate the subject matter.

original: rjes su dpag pa bye brag tu rtogs pa ni dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bye brag tu rtogs pa ni dgos pa yin no //
translated: The understanding of the particular through inference is the purpose.

original: rjes su dpag pa bye brag tu rtogs pa yid ches pa'i rang bzhin de ni rab tu byed pa 'dis byed pas rab tu byed pa 'di ni dgos pa 'di'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bye brag tu rtogs pa yid ches pa'i rang bzhin de ni rab tu byed pa 'dis byed pas rab tu byed pa 'di ni dgos pa 'di'i thabs yin no //
translated: The means of achieving that is this chapter, because it is this chapter that causes the ascertainment of the nature of inference.

original: de lta bas na rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa gnyis ni thabs dang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rab tu byed pa dang dgos pa gnyis ni thabs dang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the chapter and the purpose are related as means and goal.

original: 'di ltar rab tu byed pa ni thos pa las rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log par shes par 'gyur bas de'i phyir rab tu byed pa ni thabs yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rab tu byed pa ni thos pa las rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log par shes par 'gyur bas de'i phyir rab tu byed pa ni thabs yin la /
translated: The chapter is the means because the nature of inference is understood without error through study of the chapter.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin par grub bo //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dang / bya ba dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'brel pa yang 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin par grub bo // bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dang / bya ba dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'brel pa yang 'di kho na yin te /
translated: Inference is the goal to be achieved by the means.

original: 'di ltar sgrub pa ni rab tu byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgrub pa ni rab tu byed pa yin no //
translated: The goal, the means of achieving it, the action, the nature of the action, and the relation are all established in this way.üîΩThe means of achieving the goal is the chapter.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The goal to be achieved is the result.

original: byed pa ni rab tu byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa ni rab tu byed pa yin no //
translated: The performance is the composition.

original: bya ba ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: bya ba ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The purpose is the result.

original: bya ba'i mjug thogs dang / bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa'i 'brel pa la sogs pa ni rab tu byed pa la 'jug pa @101b la yan lag tu gyur pa dag pa yin pas 'brel pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i mjug thogs dang / bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa'i 'brel pa la sogs pa ni rab tu byed pa la 'jug pa @101b la yan lag tu gyur pa dag pa yin pas 'brel pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: The connection, the sequence of the lineage of teachers, etc., are not the connection because they are subordinate to the composition.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig don du gnyer ba de ni de'i thabs la 'jug gi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig don du gnyer ba de ni de'i thabs la 'jug gi /
translated: Thus, one who is interested in something engages in the means to that.

original: 'di ni bla ma brgyud de 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / rgyas par bya ba'i mjug thogs su bstan pa yin zhes bya ba de tsam gyis ni don du gnyer ba rnams thabs ma yin pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni bla ma brgyud de 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / rgyas par bya ba'i mjug thogs su bstan pa yin zhes bya ba de tsam gyis ni don du gnyer ba rnams thabs ma yin pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not the case that those who are interested in something engage in the means to that merely by the statement, ‚ÄúThis comes from the lineage of teachers‚Äù or ‚ÄúIt is taught immediately after the elaboration.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam mo zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su dpag par bya ba yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam mo zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the composition is undertaken for the sake of understanding the object of inference.

original: de ltar gnas pa la brgya la 'ga' zhig rjes su dpag pa yongs su shes pas ci zhig bya de ni gang du'ang dgos pa med pas bya rog gi so brtag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa la brgya la 'ga' zhig rjes su dpag pa yongs su shes pas ci zhig bya de ni gang du'ang dgos pa med pas bya rog gi so brtag pa bzhin no //
translated: In this way, someone might say, What is the use of fully understanding inference? It is useless anywhere, like the examination of a crow's teeth.

original: 'di ni gnas ma yin pa la yongs su ngal ba yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni gnas ma yin pa la yongs su ngal ba yin no zhes smra bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: This is an exhaustive effort in an impossible task. Therefore, he says,

original: don lkog tu gyur ba sgrub pa'i rten rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas zhes bya ba 'di smos so //
analyzed: don lkog tu gyur ba sgrub pa'i rten rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas zhes bya ba 'di smos so //
translated: Because inference is the basis for establishing a hidden object,üîΩ and so on.

original: 'dis ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the purpose of the purpose.

original: des na 'di skad du gang gi phyir don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa'i rten rjes su dpag pa yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'bad de yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'di skad du gang gi phyir don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa'i rten rjes su dpag pa yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'bad de yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said like this: Because inference is the basis for establishing a hidden object, therefore inference should be diligently understood.

original: yongs su shes pa de yang rab tu byed pa 'di las 'gyur bas de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dgos par gyur pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa de yang rab tu byed pa 'di las 'gyur bas de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dgos par gyur pa yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Since that understanding is accomplished through this treatise, therefore, in order to understand the necessity of inference, this treatise is begun.

original: re zhig 'di ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: This, in brief, is the meaning of the treatise.

original: yan lag gi don ni /
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni /
translated: The meaning of the parts

original: don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa las /
analyzed: don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa las /
translated: is stated in the words ‚Äúthe proof of a hidden object,‚Äù etc.

original: dbang po rnams las log pa ni lkog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnams las log pa ni lkog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHidden‚Äù means beyond the senses.

original: dbang po'i yul las 'das zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul las 'das zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means beyond the range of the senses.

original: de ni don yang yin la lkog tu gyur pa'ang yin pas don lkog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de ni don yang yin la lkog tu gyur pa'ang yin pas don lkog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: That is an object and it is hidden, so it is a hidden object.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúObject‚Äù means a phenomenon to be evaluated.

original: de yang blang bar bya ba dang / dor bar bya ba dang / btang snyoms su bya ba yin pas rnam pa gsum du 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang blang bar bya ba dang / dor bar bya ba dang / btang snyoms su bya ba yin pas rnam pa gsum du 'dod do //
translated: It is also asserted to be threefold, because it is to be accepted, rejected, or disregarded.

original: de la 'dir don zhes smos pas ni gzhal bya spyir bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'dir don zhes smos pas ni gzhal bya spyir bstan to //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúobject‚Äù generally indicates a phenomenon to be evaluated.

original: lkog tu gyur pa zhes smos pas ni de nyid khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa zhes smos pas ni de nyid khyad par du byas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúindirect‚Äù is used to distinguish it.

original: gang dag blang ba dang dor ba dang btang snyoms kyi yul nyid kyis don du gnyer bar bya ba dang / don du gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis yin la /üîΩdon gyi sgras ni don du gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa rnam par gcod par byed pa de dag gi ltar na ni dor bar bya ba dang / btang @102a * //
analyzed: gang dag blang ba dang dor ba dang btang snyoms kyi yul nyid kyis don du gnyer bar bya ba dang / don du gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis yin la / don gyi sgras ni don du gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa rnam par gcod par byed pa de dag gi ltar na ni dor bar bya ba dang / btang @102a * //
translated: Those who maintain that the object of acceptance, rejection, and indifference is twofold, i.e., that which is sought and that which is not sought,

original: snyoms su bya ba rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyoms su bya ba rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and that the word ‚Äúobject‚Äù excludes that which is not sought, would not infer that which is to be rejected and that which is to be taken as indifferent.

original: don lkog tu gyur pa la sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: don lkog tu gyur pa la sgrub pa ste /
translated: The proof of the indirect object is as follows.

original: sgrub par zhes bya ba'i sgra ni len pa dang 'dor ba dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub pa la bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub par zhes bya ba'i sgra ni len pa dang 'dor ba dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub pa la bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúproof‚Äù refers to the proof characterized by acceptance, rejection, and indifference.

original: gang gi rten rjes su dpag pa yin pa de ni rten rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi rten rjes su dpag pa yin pa de ni rten rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: That which is inferred in dependence on something is the dependent inference.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
translated: Its nature is that itself.

original: rten rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the dependent inference.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa'i sgra ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul can gyi shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa'i sgra ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul can gyi shes pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúinference‚Äù is a consciousness that has as its object an inferred object.

original: rten gyi sgra ni rgyu la bya'o //
analyzed: rten gyi sgra ni rgyu la bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúbasis‚Äù is a cause.

original: des na 'di skad du 'di ltar don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa'i rgyu ni rjes su dpag pa yin pas zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di skad du 'di ltar don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa'i rgyu ni rjes su dpag pa yin pas zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this is saying that the cause for establishing a hidden object is inference.

original: mdor bsdus nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsdus pa la 'gal ba'i srog chags rnams mgu bar bya ba'i phyir dngos po mngon par bsdus par brjod par bzhed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsdus pa la 'gal ba'i srog chags rnams mgu bar bya ba'i phyir dngos po mngon par bsdus par brjod par bzhed pa yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúIn brief‚Äù means that here, in order to please those who are fond of a concise collection, he intends to state a collection of things.

original: gzhung bsdus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhung bsdus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a concise text.

original: 'di ltar 'di la gzhung ni mang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la gzhung ni mang la /
translated: Thus, the text is extensive,

original: dngos po ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa tsam dpyod par zad de /
analyzed: dngos po ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa tsam dpyod par zad de /
translated: and it is merely an analysis of inference for oneself.

original: mngon sum yang mi dpyod /
analyzed: mngon sum yang mi dpyod /
translated: It does not analyze direct perception.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yang mi dpyod la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yang mi dpyod la /
translated: It does not analyze inference for another.

original: de bzhin du gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang dpe yang mi dpyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang dpe yang mi dpyod do //
translated: Similarly, it does not analyze fallacious reasons and examples.

original: de lta bas na 'di mdor bsdus pa'i sgra ni dngos po bsdus pa brjod par bzhed pa yin no //üîΩde la bye brag tu rtogs pa ni bye brag tu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di mdor bsdus pa'i sgra ni dngos po bsdus pa brjod par bzhed pa yin no // de la bye brag tu rtogs pa ni bye brag tu rtogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúin brief‚Äù is intended to express the concise meaning.üîΩThe word ‚Äúunderstanding‚Äù is a noun formed from the verbal root budh, which means ‚Äúto understand.‚Äù

original: 'dir de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rjes su dpag pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rjes su dpag pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected with the word ‚Äúinference.‚Äù

original: de bye brag tu rtogs pa ni so sor nges pa'i rang gi ngo bo yid ches pa ste /
analyzed: de bye brag tu rtogs pa ni so sor nges pa'i rang gi ngo bo yid ches pa ste /
translated: The understanding of that is the ascertainment of the specific nature of an object.

original: de bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the object of understanding.

original: 'di brtsam mo zhes bya ba ni blo la rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di brtsam mo zhes bya ba ni blo la rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúcomposing‚Äù indicates the mental activity of the author.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa mtha' dag la snyegs so //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa mtha' dag la snyegs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to the entire treatise.

original: brtsam zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i gzhung gi bdag nyid du brtsam par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: brtsam zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i gzhung gi bdag nyid du brtsam par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúcomposing‚Äù indicates the activity of composing the treatise.

original: de lta bas na 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, the concise meaning of this treatise is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa len pa dang 'dor ba dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni rjes su dpag pa yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed paüîΩ'di brtsam mo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa len pa dang 'dor ba dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ni rjes su dpag pa yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsam mo //
translated: Because the cause of the establishment of a hidden object, which is characterized by acceptance, rejection, and indifference, is inference, therefore, in order to understand the nature of inference, this chapter is composed.

original: yang na don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul can gyi shes pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na don lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul can gyi shes pa yin la /
translated: Or, the establishment of a hidden object is a cognition that has an object to be inferred.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags yin te /
translated: Inference is a reason having the trimodal mark,

original: 'dis rjes su dpog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis rjes su dpog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it infers.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: des na 'di skad du /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, this is said:

original: @102b gang gi phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba bsgrub pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags la rag lus pa de'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid rjes su dpag pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di tsam mo zhes bshadüîΩpar 'gyur ro //üîΩde la gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pa rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul can gyi shes pa yin par gzung ba de'i tshe de bye brag tu rtogs pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags la rag lus pa yin pas tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid bsgrub par bya
analyzed: @102b gang gi phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba bsgrub pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags la rag lus pa de'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid rjes su dpag pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di tsam mo zhes bshad par 'gyur ro // de la gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pa rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul can gyi shes pa yin par gzung ba de'i tshe de bye brag tu rtogs pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags la rag lus pa yin pas tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid bsgrub par bya
translated: Because the proof of the object of inference depends on the sign having the trimodal conditions, therefore, this chapter is just for the sake of specifically understanding the definition of the sign having the trimodal conditions and inference.

original: ba'i phyir / phyogs chos de'i chas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ba'i phyir / phyogs chos de'i chas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: When inference is taken to be the consciousness that has as its object the object of inference, then its specific understanding depends on the sign having the trimodal conditions. Therefore, in order to prove the sign having the trimodal conditions, he says, ‚ÄúThe property of the subject that is pervaded by it,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe tshul gsum pa'i rtags rjes su dpag pa'i sgrar brjod pa de'i tshe yang dngos su rtags nyid bye brag tu rtogs par bya bar rigs par gyur pas de nyid bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir phyogs chos de'i chas zhes bya ba la sogsüîΩpa smos so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshul gsum pa'i rtags rjes su dpag pa'i sgrar brjod pa de'i tshe yang dngos su rtags nyid bye brag tu rtogs par bya bar rigs par gyur pas de nyid bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir phyogs chos de'i chas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, in order to understand that, the root text says, ‚ÄúThe property of the subject and the pervasion.‚Äù

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis rab tu byed pa'i lus mtha' dag bsdus nas ston par byed do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis rab tu byed pa'i lus mtha' dag bsdus nas ston par byed do //
translated: This verse presents the entire body of the treatise.

original: yan lag gi don ni 'brel pa las bdag nyid kyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni 'brel pa las bdag nyid kyis ston par byed do //
translated: The meaning of the branches is presented by the author himself through the connections.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the summary should be stated.

original: gang zhig phyogs kyi chos yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig phyogs kyi chos yin la /
translated: The property of the subject

original: de'i chas khyab pa de ni gtan tshigs yin no //üîΩde yang med na mi 'byung ba ma gtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i chas khyab pa de ni gtan tshigs yin no // de yang med na mi 'byung ba ma gtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: and the pervasion by that part are the reason.

original: rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / mi dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum kho na yin no ;
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / mi dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum kho na yin no ;
translated: Moreover, because there is no other, it is only the three types: the natural reason, the effect reason, and the nonobservation reason.

original: / gtan tshigs gsum po la ma gtogs pa gzhan ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dag yin no //
analyzed: / gtan tshigs gsum po la ma gtogs pa gzhan ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dag yin no //
translated: The other [reasons] which are not included in the three reasons are fallacious reasons.

original: mdo las phyogs kyi chos ni gtan tshigs so zhes bshad pa de la /üîΩgal te spyi phyogs yin par gzung na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: mdo las phyogs kyi chos ni gtan tshigs so zhes bshad pa de la / gal te spyi phyogs yin par gzung na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: In the s≈´tra, the property of the subject is explained as the reason.üîΩIf one grasps the universal as the subject, then the reason is not established.

original: grub na yang rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: grub na yang rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Or, if it is established, the inference is meaningless.

original: phyogs ni chos can te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyogs ni chos can te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: [Dharmakƒ´rti] says, The subject is the subject.

original: 'dir chos can phyogs kyis grar bshad kyis spyi ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dir chos can phyogs kyis grar bshad kyis spyi ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs so //
translated: He thinks that here the subject is explained as the subject, not the universal.

original: de'i phyir chos can gyi chos gtan tshigs yin par bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can gyi chos gtan tshigs yin par bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the property of the subject is explained as the reason.

original: ci'i phyir chos can 'ga' zhig la phyogs zhes bya snyam pa la de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos can 'ga' zhig la phyogs zhes bya snyam pa la de'i phyir /
translated: Why is a certain subject called the subject? Therefore, [Dharmakƒ´rti] says,

original: yan lag la spyi'i nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yan lag la spyi'i nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the universal is metaphorically applied to the part.

original: phyogs zhes bya ba spyi la yan lag gnyis yod de /
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba spyi la yan lag gnyis yod de /
translated: The universal called the subject has two parts.

original: chos dang chos can no //
analyzed: chos dang chos can no //
translated: The subject and the predicate.

original: de bas na 'dir chos can tsam 'ba' zhig la spyi nye bar btags nas chos can la phyogs kyi sgrar bshad do //üîΩklan ka'i bsam pas dgos pa @103a * //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir chos can tsam 'ba' zhig la spyi nye bar btags nas chos can la phyogs kyi sgrar bshad do // klan ka'i bsam pas dgos pa @103a * //
translated: Therefore, here, the subject alone is designated as the universal, and the subject is explained as the term for the position.

original: med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With the intention of refuting, he says, ‚ÄúBecause there is no purpose in the designation,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos su bstan du rung ba la ni dgos pa med par nye bar gdags su mi rung ste /
analyzed: dngos su bstan du rung ba la ni dgos pa med par nye bar gdags su mi rung ste /
translated: In what is suitable to be directly taught, it is not suitable to designate without purpose.

original: de bas na chos can 'ba' zhig la phyogs zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na chos can 'ba' zhig la phyogs zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, one should not say that the subject alone is called the position.

original: nye bar gdags par bya ba'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar gdags par bya ba'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: In order to show the purpose of the designation, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not for the sake of teaching the purpose of the designation,‚Äù and so on.

original: nye bar gdags pa ni chos can gyi chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nye bar gdags pa ni chos can gyi chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The designation is for the sake of all the properties of the subject, and so on.

original: chos can gyi chos gtan tshigs su brjod pa na chos can gang yang rung ba thams cad kyi chos kyang gtan tshigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos can gyi chos gtan tshigs su brjod pa na chos can gang yang rung ba thams cad kyi chos kyang gtan tshigs su 'gyur te /
translated: When the property of the subject is stated as the reason, any property of any subject becomes the reason.

original: de'i phyir chos can mi 'dod pa'i phyir chos gang yin pa de gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur du 'ongs pas nye bar gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can mi 'dod pa'i phyir chos gang yin pa de gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur du 'ongs pas nye bar gdags par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the subject is not accepted, it is to be designated as the reason.

original: nye bar btags pa byas nas nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can gang yin pa de'i gtan tshigs nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa byas nas nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can gang yin pa de'i gtan tshigs nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And when it is designated, then whatever is the subject that is suitable to be designated is the reason.

original: nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yang spyi'i phyogs gcig tu gyur ba gang yin pa de 'di ltar phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir nye bar gdags pa byas na thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yang spyi'i phyogs gcig tu gyur ba gang yin pa de 'di ltar phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir nye bar gdags pa byas na thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the subject that is suitable to be designated is a part of the universal, and since it is like that, it is a part. Therefore, when it is designated, there is no fallacy.

original: de'i tshe mig gis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gal ba'i gzhis ma grub pa rnams kyang rgyu nyid du bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe mig gis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gal ba'i gzhis ma grub pa rnams kyang rgyu nyid du bkag pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the unestablished reasons that are contradictory subjects, such as ‚Äúbecause it is apprehended by the eye,‚Äù are also refuted as causes.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni khva'i nag po nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni khva'i nag po nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes ‚Äúthe blackness of crows‚Äù and so on.

original: nye bar gdags pa gsal bar bya ba'i bsam pas gal te chos ni gzhan la brten pa yin pas chos brjod pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nye bar gdags pa gsal bar bya ba'i bsam pas gal te chos ni gzhan la brten pa yin pas chos brjod pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to clarify the presentation of the property of the subject, the text says, ‚ÄúIf the property is dependent on another, then by stating the property, the subject is also stated.‚Äù

original: gal te chos can gyi chos yin par brjod na chos can thams cad kyi chos gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur bas de'i tshe chos can kho na smos par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te chos can gyi chos yin par brjod na chos can thams cad kyi chos gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur bas de'i tshe chos can kho na smos par mi bya'o //
translated: If the property of the subject is stated, then the property of all subjects would be the reason. In that case, the subject should not be stated.

original: chos brjod pa kho nas ni chos can du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos brjod pa kho nas ni chos can du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: By stating the property alone, the subject is also stated.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos can du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi chos smos pas kyang 'gyur ro zhes de skad du ston par byed de /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos can du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi chos smos pas kyang 'gyur ro zhes de skad du ston par byed de /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that not only is the subject stated, but the property is also stated.

original: 'di ltar chos gzhan la brten pa gzhan la rag lus pa'i khyad par du gyur pa de yod pa na chad gdon mi za bar chos can 'phen par byed pa de la chos can smos pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gzhan la brten pa gzhan la rag lus pa'i khyad par du gyur pa de yod pa na chad gdon mi za bar chos can 'phen par byed pa de la chos can smos pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Thus, when the property that is dependent on another is stated, the subject is necessarily implied. In that case, what is the point of stating the subject?

original: brten par bya ba ni rten te /
analyzed: brten par bya ba ni rten te /
translated: That which is to be supported is supported.

original: chos can brten par bya ba ni rten chos can no //
analyzed: chos can brten par bya ba ni rten chos can no //
translated: The basis of the property-possessor is the property-possessor as the basis.

original: de 'grub pa ni rten chos can 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de 'grub pa ni rten chos can 'grub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of that is the establishment of the property-possessor as the basis.

original: yang na rten du gyur pa chos can 'grub pa ni rten chos can 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rten du gyur pa chos can 'grub pa ni rten chos can 'grub pa'o //
translated: Or, the establishment of the property-possessor as the basis is the establishment of the property-possessor as the basis.

original: de ltar chos can grub pa dang chos can zhes smos par bya ba gang yin pa des ni @103b bsgrub pa'i chos can yongs su bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos can grub pa dang chos can zhes smos par bya ba gang yin pa des ni @103b bsgrub pa'i chos can yongs su bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when the property-possessor is established, whatever is to be stated as the property-possessor includes the property-possessor of the probandum.

original: de lta bas na nye bar gdags pa ni don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nye bar gdags pa ni don med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the designation is meaningless.

original: de la gal te bshad pa'i tshul gyis na chos can smos pa'i shugs kyis chos can thams cad sel du zin kyang chos can gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig yongs su bsdus par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la gal te bshad pa'i tshul gyis na chos can smos pa'i shugs kyis chos can thams cad sel du zin kyang chos can gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig yongs su bsdus par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that regard, if by the method of explanation, although all property-possessors are excluded by the mere mention of the property-possessor, some particular property-possessor is included,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'grub par 'gyur ba la 'di go ga las shes de snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir nye ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'grub par 'gyur ba la 'di go ga las shes de snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir nye ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: how is it known that the probandum is established? Thinking this, the phrase because of proximity is stated.

original: nye ba dang lhan cig pa'i chos can smos pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yongs su bsdus pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba dang lhan cig pa'i chos can smos pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yongs su bsdus pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The phrase the subject that is proximate or concomitant is meant to include the probandum's subject matter.

original: 'dir nye ba ni blo la snang ba'am yang na bsgrub par bya dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir nye ba ni blo la snang ba'am yang na bsgrub par bya dgos pa'o //
translated: Here, proximate means that which appears to the mind or that which must be established.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nye bar gdags pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can 'grub par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nye bar gdags pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can 'grub par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The word also indicates that the probandum's subject matter is established not only by the designation of the proximate,

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩchos can smos pas kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes de skad du ston par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na / chos can smos pas kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes de skad du ston par byed pa'am /
translated: but also in what way?üîΩ It is also established by the statement of the subject matter.üîΩOr, the meaning of the word also is that the probandum's subject matter is established not only by the statement of the subject matter,

original: yang na kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni chos can smos pas 'grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi nye ba dang lhan cig pa'i chos smos pas kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni chos can smos pas 'grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi nye ba dang lhan cig pa'i chos smos pas kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //
translated: but also by the statement of the proximate and concomitant subject matter. This is the opponent's position.

original: de la re zhig 'dir chos can smos pa gzhan dag 'khrul par 'gyur bar bsgrub pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' smra bas kyang nye bar 'khrul par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dir chos can smos pa gzhan dag 'khrul par 'gyur bar bsgrub pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' smra bas kyang nye bar 'khrul par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, some say that the subject is mentioned here in order to prove that the other is mistaken, and in order to demonstrate that the proponent of tenets is mistaken.

original: dpe'i chos can yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpe'i chos can yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, the text says, ‚ÄúThe example subject is also nearby,‚Äù and so on.

original: dpe'i chos can yang nye ba yin te /
analyzed: dpe'i chos can yang nye ba yin te /
translated: The example subject is also nearby.

original: de yang blo la bsgrub par bya ba nyid du snang la /
analyzed: de yang blo la bsgrub par bya ba nyid du snang la /
translated: Moreover, it appears to the mind as if it were the predicate.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i skabs kyang yin pas de'i phyir the tshom du 'gyur ba gcig tu bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par lta ga la zhig 'grub /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i skabs kyang yin pas de'i phyir the tshom du 'gyur ba gcig tu bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par lta ga la zhig 'grub /
translated: Since it is also the context of the predicate, how could it be established as the predicate that is the object of ascertainment?

original: yang pha rol pos de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang pha rol pos de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Again, the opponent says, ‚ÄúThe pervasion by that property,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te 'dir dpe'i chos can yin par 'dod par gyur na ni de'i tshe chos can gyi chos zhes smos pa'i don dpe'i chos can la yod pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na dpe'i chos can la gtan tshigs
analyzed: gal te 'dir dpe'i chos can yin par 'dod par gyur na ni de'i tshe chos can gyi chos zhes smos pa'i don dpe'i chos can la yod pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na dpe'i chos can la gtan tshigs
translated: If it is the case that the example is asserted to be the subject here, then at that time, the meaning of the statement ‚Äúa property of the subject‚Äù would be that the reason is whatever exists in the example subject.

original: yod pa de yang de'i chas khyab pa zhes smos pa kho nas grub bo //
analyzed: yod pa de yang de'i chas khyab pa zhes smos pa kho nas grub bo //
translated: But the reason exists in the example subject, and that is established by the statement ‚Äúpervasion by that part‚Äù alone.

original: de'i phyir lhag mas ni chos can gyi chos zhes smos pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yongs su bsdu ba'i don yin @104a * //üîΩpar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhag mas ni chos can gyi chos zhes smos pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yongs su bsdu ba'i don yin @104a * // par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the remainder of the statement ‚Äúa property of the subject‚Äù has the purpose of including the subject of the proposition.

original: khyab pa yid ches par bya ba'i phyir de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya ba yang gdon mi za bar brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: khyab pa yid ches par bya ba'i phyir de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya ba yang gdon mi za bar brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Because the pervasion must be believed, the statement ‚Äúpervasion by that part‚Äù must be stated without doubt.

original: de brjod na de kho nas yod par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de brjod na de kho nas yod par 'grub ste /
translated: When that is stated, it is established that the reason exists there.

original: dpe la gtan tshigs byed na de'i chas khyab pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dpe la gtan tshigs byed na de'i chas khyab pa mi 'thad de /
translated: If the reason is made in the example, pervasion by that part is not tenable.

original: gal te chos can zhes bya ba ma smos na /
analyzed: gal te chos can zhes bya ba ma smos na /
translated: If the word ‚Äúsubject‚Äù is not stated,

original: de'i tshe de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya ba 'di la de zhes bya ba'i sgra gang la snyegs she na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya ba 'di la de zhes bya ba'i sgra gang la snyegs she na /
translated: At that time, what does the word that in the expression pervasion by that refer to?

original: de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: sngar chos smos kyang chos can kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: sngar chos smos kyang chos can kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Although the property is mentioned first, it is still the subject alone.

original: de lta bas na de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chos smos pas nye bar gzhag pa'i chos la snyegs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no //üîΩgrub pa'i mtha' smra bas grub kyang nges par bya ba'i phyir yang smos su dogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chos smos pas nye bar gzhag pa'i chos la snyegs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yin no // grub pa'i mtha' smra bas grub kyang nges par bya ba'i phyir yang smos su dogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus the word that refers to the property that is posited by the mention of the property. This is the opponent‚Äôs position.üîΩThe proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúEven though it is established, it is mentioned again in order to ascertain it.‚Äù

original: grub kyang nges par bya ba'i phyir yang smos pa yang mthong bas de gcig tu bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par ltag la zhig 'grub nges pa yin par dogs pa de nyid dpe dang bcas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grub kyang nges par bya ba'i phyir yang smos pa yang mthong bas de gcig tu bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par ltag la zhig 'grub nges pa yin par dogs pa de nyid dpe dang bcas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is seen that even though something is established, it is mentioned again in order to ascertain it, it is suspected that the subject is established as the property to be proven in one way and ascertained in another way. In order to demonstrate that with an example, he says:

original: mthun pa la yod pa kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthun pa la yod pa kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúOnly by existing in the similar class, etc.‚Äù

original: dper na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod ces bya ba'i tshig 'di nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs log par grub bo //
analyzed: dper na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod ces bya ba'i tshig 'di nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs log par grub bo //
translated: For example, by the very words ‚Äúexisting in the similar class,‚Äù the opposite of the reason in the dissimilar class is established.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs log par grub mod kyi /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs log par grub mod kyi /
translated: Although the opposite of the reason in the dissimilar class is established,

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs med do zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni 'di ltar gtan tshigs ni med pa kho na las log pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs med do zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni 'di ltar gtan tshigs ni med pa kho na las log pa yin gyi /
translated: the statement ‚Äúwhere the object of affirmation does not exist, the reason does not exist‚Äù is explained in this way: the reason is only the opposite of nonexistence.

original: gzhan pa las kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan pa las kyang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the opposite of anything else.üîΩAnd it is not the opposite of contradiction.

original: 'gal ba las kyang ma yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir rnam par bshad pa yin par de bzhin du 'dir yang de'i chas khyab pa smos pas dpe'i chos can la gtan tshigs yod par grub mod kyi /
analyzed: 'gal ba las kyang ma yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir rnam par bshad pa yin par de bzhin du 'dir yang de'i chas khyab pa smos pas dpe'i chos can la gtan tshigs yod par grub mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, here, although the existence of the reason in the example subject is established by stating ‚Äúpervasion by that part,‚Äù

original: chos can gyi chos zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni dpe'i chos can gyi chos gang yin pa de ni gtan tshigs kho na yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i ched yin no snyam du dogs pa 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can gyi chos zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni dpe'i chos can gyi chos gang yin pa de ni gtan tshigs kho na yin no zhes nges par bya ba'i ched yin no snyam du dogs pa 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase the property of the subject is meant to determine that the property of the example is the reason alone.

original: de bas na de ltar nges par bya ba yin par dgos par bzlog pa'i phyir nye bar gdags par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar nges par bya ba yin par dgos par bzlog pa'i phyir nye bar gdags par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, in order to refute the purpose of such a determination, it is said it should be designated.

original: 'di nyid la gtan tshigs de lta bas na shugs kyis zhes bya ba la sos pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid la gtan tshigs de lta bas na shugs kyis zhes bya ba la sos pa smos te /
translated: In this very context, the word therefore is used to indicate the implication, saying because of that reason.

original: nye ba'i mtshan nyid kyis shus bshad pa gang yin pa'i shugs des bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par rtogs par 'gyur mos kyi /
analyzed: nye ba'i mtshan nyid kyis shus bshad pa gang yin pa'i shugs des bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par rtogs par 'gyur mos kyi /
translated: The implication by which the property of the subject to be established is understood is as follows:

original: 'on @104b kyang bsgrub dka' bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on @104b kyang bsgrub dka' bar 'gyur la /
translated: However, it would be difficult to establish.

original: de yang nye bar gdags pa tsam yi ge mnyam pa yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang nye bar gdags pa tsam yi ge mnyam pa yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: And that is merely a designation, avoiding the equality of letters.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'thad pa gzhan bsdu ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'thad pa gzhan bsdu ba'i don te /
translated: The word also is for the purpose of including another possibility, saying:

original: nges par bya ba yin par dogs pa yongs su spangs pa yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: nges par bya ba yin par dogs pa yongs su spangs pa yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the doubt completely abandoned,

original: bsgrub dka' ba yang yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgrub dka' ba yang yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but also the difficult to establish is completely abandoned.

original: yang na 'dir gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / sems la gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / nges par bya ba gnyi ga srid pa las bsgrub par bya ba stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can kho na yongs su bsdus par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yang na 'dir gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / sems la gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / nges par bya ba gnyi ga srid pa las bsgrub par bya ba stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can kho na yongs su bsdus par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Or, since it is the principal object here, since it is placed in the mind, and since both the probandum and the object of ascertainment are possible, the probandum is more powerful, and thus only the probandum is included.

original: dpe'i chos can ni yongs su mi sdud pa yin nam /üîΩde lta bas na nye bar gdags pa mi bya'o zhes bya ba yin la dogs par bya ste /
analyzed: dpe'i chos can ni yongs su mi sdud pa yin nam / de lta bas na nye bar gdags pa mi bya'o zhes bya ba yin la dogs par bya ste /
translated: Is the example not included?üîΩTherefore, it should not be imputed.

original: de'i phyir / de lta bas na shugs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de lta bas na shugs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, by implication,‚Äù and so on.

original: gtso bo yin pa la sogs pa'i shugs bshad pa gang yin pa'i shugs des bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi mtshan nyid kyi don yin par rtogs par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gtso bo yin pa la sogs pa'i shugs bshad pa gang yin pa'i shugs des bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi mtshan nyid kyi don yin par rtogs par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: The meaning of the definition of the subject to be established is understood by the force of the statement that it is the principal one, and so on.

original: 'on kyang shus 'dis sgrub pa bsgrub dka' bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on kyang shus 'dis sgrub pa bsgrub dka' bar 'gyur la /
translated: But it is difficult to establish by that force.

original: de'i nye bar gdags pa tsam yi ge mnyam pas yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i nye bar gdags pa tsam yi ge mnyam pas yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: And the mere designation of that is avoided by the equality of the letters.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni sgrub par byed pa'i dka' ba yang yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni sgrub par byed pa'i dka' ba yang yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is that the difficulty of establishing is also avoided.üîΩIn this examination of the property of the subject, it is said that the treatise was composed in response to an objection raised by a certain Ishvarasena, who was not a proponent of the opponent's position, by this impartial author.

original: phyogs kyi chos dpyad pa 'dir dbang phyug sde zhes bya ba phyogs sngar ma smra bas des slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la klan ka bcal ba la bstan bcos mdzad pa gzu bor gyur pa 'dis lan btab bo zhes grag go / de lta bas na phyogs
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos dpyad pa 'dir dbang phyug sde zhes bya ba phyogs sngar ma smra bas des slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la klan ka bcal ba la bstan bcos mdzad pa gzu bor gyur pa 'dis lan btab bo zhes grag go / de lta bas na phyogs
translated: Therefore, the author of the treatise is DignƒÅga.

original: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir nye bar btags pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is a specification here.

original: phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba 'di la bsdu ba du ma'i dgos pa yod pas 'dod pa'i bsdu ba brjod par 'dod pa la klan ka'i bsam pas /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba 'di la bsdu ba du ma'i dgos pa yod pas 'dod pa'i bsdu ba brjod par 'dod pa la klan ka'i bsam pas /
translated: The word ‚Äúproperty of the subject‚Äù has many different meanings.  In order to indicate the intended meaning, the opponent objects:

original: gal te phyogs kyi chos nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te phyogs kyi chos nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is the property of the subject, then why is it not stated in the form ‚ÄúThe subject, sound, is impermanent because of being a product‚Äù?

original: phyogs kyi chos yin pas phyogs kyi chos so zhes drug pa'i bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos yin pas phyogs kyi chos so zhes drug pa'i bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is in the sixth case because it is the property of the subject.

original: 'dir phyogs kyi sgras ni chos khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: 'dir phyogs kyi sgras ni chos khyad par du byed do //
translated: Here the word ‚Äúsubject‚Äù specifies the property.

original: de lta bas na phyogs kyi khyad par la ltos pa'i chos lta zhig gzhan du 'jug par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bas na phyogs kyi khyad par la ltos pa'i chos lta zhig gzhan du 'jug par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the property, which depends on the subject, be stated separately?

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir phyogs dang sbyar ro //üîΩphyogs de'i khyad par @105a * //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir phyogs dang sbyar ro // phyogs de'i khyad par @105a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúsubject.‚ÄùüîΩThat subject is the subject that is qualified by the property.

original: la ltos pas na de'i khyad par la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: la ltos pas na de'i khyad par la ltos pa ste /
translated: That which depends on the property of that subject is ‚Äúdependent on the property of that subject.‚Äù

original: gang zhig phyogs kyi khyad par du byed pa de ni phyogs kho na la yod kyi gzhan la ni med do //
analyzed: gang zhig phyogs kyi khyad par du byed pa de ni phyogs kho na la yod kyi gzhan la ni med do //
translated: That which is distinguished as a part exists only in the part and not elsewhere.

original: de lta bas na de gzhan du 'jug par ltag la 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bas na de gzhan du 'jug par ltag la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, it is absurd to say that it occurs elsewhere.üîΩMoreover, since it has the property of a part, it is called a part-possessor.üîΩIf the compound is analyzed as a bahuvrƒ´hi, it is a part and it is a property, so it is a part-property.üîΩIf it is analyzed as a dvandva compound, it is a part and it is a property, so it is a part-property.

original: yang 'di la phyogs kyi chos yod pas phyogs kyi chos so zhes 'bru mang po pa dang de ni phyogs yang yin la chos kyang yin pas phyogs kyi chos so zhes las kyi gzhi dang / phyogs dang chos yin pas phyogs kyi chos so zhes zlas dbye ba dang bsdu ba du ma zhig 'thad na /
analyzed: yang 'di la phyogs kyi chos yod pas phyogs kyi chos so zhes 'bru mang po pa dang de ni phyogs yang yin la chos kyang yin pas phyogs kyi chos so zhes las kyi gzhi dang / phyogs dang chos yin pas phyogs kyi chos so zhes zlas dbye ba dang bsdu ba du ma zhig 'thad na /
translated: If it is analyzed as a copulative compound, it is a part and it is a property, so it is a part-property.

original: 'dir ji ltar na drug pa'i bsdu ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar na drug pa'i bsdu ba yin zhe na /
translated: Since many analyses are possible, how is it analyzed as a genitive tatpuru·π£a compound?

original: smras pa / phyogs zhes bya ba'i sga ni 'dir chos can yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: smras pa / phyogs zhes bya ba'i sga ni 'dir chos can yin par bzhed do //
translated: We say: The term part is asserted here to be the property possessor.üîΩMoreover, if the property possessor does not completely abandon its own nature, it does not become the property of anything.

original: de yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma bor na gang gi chos su yang mi 'gyur bas 'bru mang po ba gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma bor na gang gi chos su yang mi 'gyur bas 'bru mang po ba gsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the bahuvrƒ´hi compound is clear.

original: de nyid kyi las kyi gzhi yang med de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi las kyi gzhi yang med de /
translated: It also does not have a basis of action.

original: chos can gyi ngo bo yongs su ma bor na chos su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can gyi ngo bo yongs su ma bor na chos su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of the subject is not completely abandoned, then it is not a property.

original: zlas dbye ba yang gal te phan tshun ldan pa yin na ni de'i tshe gnyis kyi tshig tu bya dgos so //
analyzed: zlas dbye ba yang gal te phan tshun ldan pa yin na ni de'i tshe gnyis kyi tshig tu bya dgos so //
translated: If the distinction is mutual possession, then it must be expressed in the dual.

original: 'on te gcig tu bsdu ba yin na ni de'i tshe phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba ma ning gi rtags su bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'on te gcig tu bsdu ba yin na ni de'i tshe phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba ma ning gi rtags su bya dgos so //
translated: But if it is a collection of one, then it must be expressed by the neuter suffix -tva.

original: de dag la ma gtogs pa ni drug pa'i bsdu ba yin na /
analyzed: de dag la ma gtogs pa ni drug pa'i bsdu ba yin na /
translated: If it is a collection of six, which is not included in those,

original: de la yang klan ka yod pas phyogs snga ma'i 'dogs pas grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang klan ka yod pas phyogs snga ma'i 'dogs pas grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te /
translated: then there is also a fault in that, so it is not the case that the proponents of the tenets of the former position are established.

original: ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is distinguished by the exclusion of non-connection.

original: 'dir ni ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod par byed pa yin te /
translated: Here, it is the exclusion of non-connection.

original: de lta bas na ma 'brel pa rnam par gcad pa bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i nye bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma 'brel pa rnam par gcad pa bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i nye bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is distinguished by the exclusion of non-connection, the previously mentioned consequence does not apply.

original: 'dir ma 'brel pa'i sgra ni mi srid pa yin par bshad do//
analyzed: 'dir ma 'brel pa'i sgra ni mi srid pa yin par bshad do//
translated: Here, it is explained that the term ‚Äúnon-connection‚Äù is impossible.

original: des na 'di skad du sgra la byas pa nyid yod kyi /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du sgra la byas pa nyid yod kyi /
translated: Therefore, this is what is being said: ‚ÄúThe state of being produced exists in sound.

original: sgra'i chos byas pa nyid kho na med pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: sgra'i chos byas pa nyid kho na med pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that the property of sound, namely, the state of being produced, does not exist.

original: chos ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nor is it the case that it is not a property.‚Äù

original: 'dir dper / dper na nag pa gzhu thogs so zhes bya ba lta bu yin gyi zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩ'dir nag pa gzhu thogs pa kho na'o zhes gzhu thogs pa ma yin pa nyid 'gog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir dper / dper na nag pa gzhu thogs so zhes bya ba lta bu yin gyi zhes bya ba smos so // 'dir nag pa gzhu thogs pa kho na'o zhes gzhu thogs pa ma yin pa nyid 'gog pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, for example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúNƒÅgƒÅrjuna holds a bow.‚ÄùüîΩHere, it is the state of not holding a bow that is being refuted, not the state of NƒÅgƒÅrjuna holding a bow.

original: nag pa kho na gzhu thogs so zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nag pa kho na gzhu thogs so zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the state of NƒÅgƒÅrjuna alone holding a bow.

original: re zhig de ltar 'dod pa'i nges par gzung ba bstan pa yin no //üîΩmi 'dod pa'i nges par gzung ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig de ltar 'dod pa'i nges par gzung ba bstan pa yin no // mi 'dod pa'i nges par gzung ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This is the presentation of the assertion.

original: gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas ni ma yin no zhes @105b bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas ni ma yin no zhes @105b bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to eliminate the assertion of non-assertion, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the connection with another is eliminated,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan dag la 'brel pa ni gzhan dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag la 'brel pa ni gzhan dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: The connection with another is a connection with something else.

original: phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba 'dir ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba 'dir ma 'brel pa rnam par gcod par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The term ‚Äúproperty of the subject‚Äù excludes what is unrelated;

original: gzhan dang 'brel pa gcod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel pa gcod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it does not exclude what is related to something else.

original: de lta bas na tshig gi don ni phyogs kyi chos kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshig gi don ni phyogs kyi chos kho na yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the words is that the property of the subject is the reason,

original: phyogs kho na'i chos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kho na'i chos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: not that the property of the subject alone is the reason.

original: dper ni brgya byin gyi bu gzhu thogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper ni brgya byin gyi bu gzhu thogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The example is ‚Äúlike the son of a hundred-year-old man holding a bow.‚Äù

original: 'dir brgya byin gyi bu kho na gzhu thogs so zhes gzhu thogs pa phul du byung ba gzhan dag sel bar byed pa yin no //üîΩgang gis na la lar ni ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas nges par gzung bar 'dod la /
analyzed: 'dir brgya byin gyi bu kho na gzhu thogs so zhes gzhu thogs pa phul du byung ba gzhan dag sel bar byed pa yin no // gang gis na la lar ni ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas nges par gzung bar 'dod la /
translated: Here, the son of a hundred-year-old man alone holds a bow, excluding other excellent bow-holders.üîΩWhy do you want to exclude what is unrelated in some cases,

original: la lar ni gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par gcad pa nges par gzung bar 'dod pa'i 'dod rgyal 'di ga las smras pa /
analyzed: la lar ni gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par gcad pa nges par gzung bar 'dod pa'i 'dod rgyal 'di ga las smras pa /
translated: and in other cases exclude what is related to something else? Where is this whimsy of yours stated?

original: gang du ci yod dam med ces chos kyi rang gi ngo bo la the tshom za ba der gang gi tshe yod par sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe med pa rnam par bcad pa rigs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du ci yod dam med ces chos kyi rang gi ngo bo la the tshom za ba der gang gi tshe yod par sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe med pa rnam par bcad pa rigs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: When one is in doubt about the intrinsic reality of something, wondering whether it exists or not, then when one affirms that it exists, it is reasonable that one is also refuting that it does not exist.

original: de nyid ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad bzhes bya ste /üîΩ'di ltar ci nag pa gzhu thogs sam /
analyzed: de nyid ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad bzhes bya ste / 'di ltar ci nag pa gzhu thogs sam /
translated: This is called the exclusion of nonconnection.

original: 'on te mi thogs zhes nag pa gzhu thogs pa nyid la the tshom za ba der nag pa gzhu thogs so zhes smras na /
analyzed: 'on te mi thogs zhes nag pa gzhu thogs pa nyid la the tshom za ba der nag pa gzhu thogs so zhes smras na /
translated: For example, when one is in doubt about whether a dark person holds a bow, then if one says, ‚ÄúA dark person holds a bow,‚Äù

original: gzhu thogs pa nyid mi srid pa nyid rnam par gcod pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhu thogs pa nyid mi srid pa nyid rnam par gcod pa yin la /
translated: one is excluding the possibility that he does not hold a bow.

original: gang du chos kyi rang gi ngo bo grub la /
analyzed: gang du chos kyi rang gi ngo bo grub la /
translated: When the intrinsic reality of a phenomenon is established,

original: gzhan la phul du byung ba yod dam med pa the tshom zos nas med pa sgrub par byed pa'i sgra sbyor bar byed pa der ni gzhan dag dang 'brel pa rnam par gcod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la phul du byung ba yod dam med pa the tshom zos nas med pa sgrub par byed pa'i sgra sbyor bar byed pa der ni gzhan dag dang 'brel pa rnam par gcod par byed pa yin te /
translated: but one is in doubt about whether it is superior to others or not, and one uses a term to affirm that it is not, then one is excluding its connection to others.

original: 'di ltar brgya byin gyi bu gzhu thogs pa kho nar 'grub la /
analyzed: 'di ltar brgya byin gyi bu gzhu thogs pa kho nar 'grub la /
translated: For example, it is established that the son of ≈öakra holds a bow.

original: ci de dang 'dra ba gzhan la yod dam /
analyzed: ci de dang 'dra ba gzhan la yod dam /
translated: Does it exist in another similar to it, or does it not exist?

original: 'on te med ces the tshom za ba la brgya byin gyi bu gzhu thogs so zhes smos na /
analyzed: 'on te med ces the tshom za ba la brgya byin gyi bu gzhu thogs so zhes smos na /
translated: When one says, ‚ÄúThe son of Indra holds the bow,‚Äù

original: gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par gcod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par gcod par byed pa yin no //
translated: it excludes the connection with another.

original: de bzhin du gang ti tshe sgra la sogs pa chas can la byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos ci yod dam med ces tha tshom za ba de'i tshe phyogs kyi chos sgrub par byed pa'i sgras ma 'brel pa kho na rnam par gcad par bya ba yin
analyzed: de bzhin du gang ti tshe sgra la sogs pa chas can la byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos ci yod dam med ces tha tshom za ba de'i tshe phyogs kyi chos sgrub par byed pa'i sgras ma 'brel pa kho na rnam par gcad par bya ba yin
translated: In the same way, when one doubts whether the property of the subject, such as being produced, exists or does not exist in sound, etc., at that time, the word that establishes the property of the subject only excludes the non-connection,

original: gyi / gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par gcad par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gyi / gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par gcad par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but it does not exclude the connection with another.

original: re zhig de ltar phyogs kyi chos skyon mtha' dag spangs te gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar phyogs kyi chos skyon mtha' dag spangs te gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the property of the subject, free from all faults, has been established in this way.

original: yan lag gzhan bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: yan lag gzhan bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to explain the other members,

original: de'i cha ni de'i chos so zhes bya ba smos te de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni phyogs yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: de'i cha ni de'i chos so zhes bya ba smos te de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni phyogs yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat part is its property.‚Äù The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù completely includes the subject.

original: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / 'das ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir chos la snyegs par rigs mod kyi @106a * //
analyzed: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / 'das ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir chos la snyegs par rigs mod kyi @106a * //
translated: It is proper to apply the term ‚Äúpart‚Äù to the dharma, because it is the principal and because it is the most recent.

original: 'on kyang mi srid pa'i phyir phyogs kho na sbyar te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi srid pa'i phyir phyogs kho na sbyar te /
translated: However, because it is impossible, the term is applied only to the direction.

original: 'di ltar chos la ni chos gzhan yod ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos la ni chos gzhan yod ba ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the dharma does not have another dharma.

original: cha zhes bya ba'i tshig ni chos kyi tshig tu brjod de /
analyzed: cha zhes bya ba'i tshig ni chos kyi tshig tu brjod de /
translated: The term ‚Äúpart‚Äù is used for the term ‚Äúdharma.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir chos can kho na yin par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir chos can kho na yin par brjod do //
translated: In this way, the term ‚Äúdirection‚Äù is used here only for the subject.

original: de lta bas na cha zhes bya ba'i sgra yan lag gi tshig tu ga la 'gyur /üîΩkhyab pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na cha zhes bya ba'i sgra yan lag gi tshig tu ga la 'gyur / khyab pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Therefore, how could the term ‚Äúpart‚Äù be a subordinate term?

original: khyab pa ni de la khyab par byed pa yod pa kho na'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyab pa ni de la khyab par byed pa yod pa kho na'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the nature of pervasion, he says, ‚ÄúPervasion is only when the pervader exists there,‚Äù and so on.

original: chub pa ni khyab pa ste /
analyzed: chub pa ni khyab pa ste /
translated: Pervasion is pervasion.

original: zin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It has the same meaning as ‚Äúis occupied.‚Äù

original: de yang res 'ga' ni khyab par byed pa'i chos yin par brjod par bzhed la /
analyzed: de yang res 'ga' ni khyab par byed pa'i chos yin par brjod par bzhed la /
translated: Sometimes it is asserted that the pervader is the pervading dharma.

original: res 'ga' ni khyab par bya ba'i chos yin par brjod par bzhed de /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni khyab par bya ba'i chos yin par brjod par bzhed de /
translated: Sometimes he asserts that it is the predicate of the probandum.

original: gang gi tshe khyab par byed pa'i chos yin pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa kho na khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyab par byed pa'i chos yin pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa kho na khyab pa yin te /
translated: When it is the pervader, then the reason is pervaded only by the presence of the predicate of the probandum.

original: gdon mi za bar de yod pa khyab pa'i sgrar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar de yod pa khyab pa'i sgrar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that the word ‚Äúpervasion‚Äù must be taken to mean that the pervader is necessarily present there.

original: de lta ma yin na 'dod pa'i khyab pa kho na mi srid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dod pa'i khyab pa kho na mi srid do //
translated: Otherwise, the desired pervasion would be impossible.

original: gal te da la khyab par byed pa kho na yod do zhes de skad du nges par gzung na /
analyzed: gal te da la khyab par byed pa kho na yod do zhes de skad du nges par gzung na /
translated: If one were to hold that the pervader alone is present,

original: de'i tshe mi srid pa can gyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi srid pa can gyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then it would have the characteristic of impossibility.

original: gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'ba' zhig gis khyab par de lta bu'i chos de ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'ba' zhig gis khyab par de lta bu'i chos de ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no such thing as a predicate that is pervaded only by the predicate of the probandum.üîΩBut if one holds that the pervader is present there alone,

original: 'on te de kho na la khyab par byed pa yod do zhes nges par gzung ngo zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'on te de kho na la khyab par byed pa yod do zhes nges par gzung ngo zhe na ni /
translated: then the reason would be contradictory.

original: de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la 'jug pa brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la 'jug pa brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the reason would not be the mere presence of the property of the subject, because the mere presence of the property of the subject is not the reason.

original: mi rtag pa ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba dag kho na la yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba dag kho na la yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, impermanence is not present only in things that arise immediately after effort,

original: glog la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glog la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is also present in lightning.

original: gzhal bya la sogs pa thun mong ba yang gtan tshigs nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhal bya la sogs pa thun mong ba yang gtan tshigs nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And it would follow that the common properties of being an object of knowledge and so on would be the reason,

original: 'di ltar rtag pa nyid ni gzhal bya kho na dag la yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa nyid ni gzhal bya kho na dag la yod do //
translated: because permanence exists only in objects of knowledge.üîΩWhen it is asserted that the reason is the property of the subject, then the reason is only present in the subject, because the pervader is only present where there is the pervaded.

original: gang gi tshe khyab par bya ba'i chos yin par brjod par bzhed pa de'i tshe ni de la khyab par bya ba yod pa kho na la khyab pa yin pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa dag la gtan tshigs yod pa kho na khyab pa yin
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyab par bya ba'i chos yin par brjod par bzhed pa de'i tshe ni de la khyab par bya ba yod pa kho na la khyab pa yin pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa dag la gtan tshigs yod pa kho na khyab pa yin
translated: The reason is only present where the property of the thesis is present.

original: no // bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med pa'i gtan tshigs ni med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: no // bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med pa'i gtan tshigs ni med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no reason where the property of the thesis is absent.

original: de lta ma yin na 'dod pa'i khyab pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dod pa'i khyab pa mi srid do //
translated: Otherwise, there could be no pervasion in the desire realm.

original: 'dir yang gal te de la @106b khyab par bya ba kho na yod do zhes nges par gzung na ni de'i tshe mi srid pa can gyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
