analyzed: 'dir yang gal te de la @106b khyab par bya ba kho na yod do zhes nges par gzung na ni de'i tshe mi srid pa can gyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Here, if one were to hold that the pervasion is only in that, then it would have the characteristic of impossibility,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa gang dag la gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig yod pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa gang dag la gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig yod pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: because there is nothing that has only the reason in those that possess the property to be proven.

original: 'on te de kho na la khyab par bya ba yod dam zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'on te de kho na la khyab par bya ba yod dam zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o zhe na ni /
translated: But if one were to hold that the pervasion is only in that,

original: de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la 'jug pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la 'jug pa gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the reason would not engage in just one concordant example,

original: mi rtag pa dag la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yod par gdon mi za ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dag la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yod par gdon mi za ba ma yin te /
translated: because the existence of that which arises immediately after exertion is not necessarily in impermanent things,

original: glog la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glog la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist in lightning.

original: thun mong yang gtan tshigs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: thun mong yang gtan tshigs su 'gyur te /
translated: And it would be a common reason,

original: 'di ltar rtag pa dag la ni gzhal bya nyid yod par gdon mi za ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa dag la ni gzhal bya nyid yod par gdon mi za ba yin no //
translated: because in that case, the existence of being an object of comprehension is necessarily in permanent things.

original: khyab pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo'i chos su brjod pa ni ldan pa bzhin du gnyi ga'i rnam pa gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur du 'ong ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyab pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo'i chos su brjod pa ni ldan pa bzhin du gnyi ga'i rnam pa gcig tu rtogs par 'gyur du 'ong ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe property of the pervader and the pervaded‚Äù is used to indicate that it would be possible to understand both as a single aspect, just as in the case of inherence.

original: 'di ltar gang dag ldan pa la sogs pa'i 'brel pa bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa de dag ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dag gi 'brel pa ldan pa rten nyid du tha mi dad cing rnam pa gcig par rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag ldan pa la sogs pa'i 'brel pa bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa de dag ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dag gi 'brel pa ldan pa rten nyid du tha mi dad cing rnam pa gcig par rtogs so //
translated: Thus, those who assert that the relation of inherence and so on is the reason for establishing the probandum understand the relation of the probandum and the proof to be nondifferent and a single aspect in terms of the basis of inherence.

original: 'dir ni khyab par byed pa la ltos na ni ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ni khyab par byed pa la ltos na ni ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: Here, in terms of the pervader, it is the pervader because it excludes nonrelation.

original: khyab par bya ba la ltos na ni gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas 'brel pa yin pas 'brel pa rnam pa tha dad par rtogs so //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba la ltos na ni gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas 'brel pa yin pas 'brel pa rnam pa tha dad par rtogs so //
translated: In terms of the pervaded, it is the relation because it excludes relation to another. Thus, the relation is understood to be a different aspect.

original: re zhig de ltar khyab pa gnyi gar bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar khyab pa gnyi gar bstan to //
translated: Thus, the two types of pervasion have been taught.

original: de la 'di snyam du khyab pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa la rag lus pa yin pas /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du khyab pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa la rag lus pa yin pas /
translated: In this regard, one might think that pervasion depends on ascertaining the positive and negative concomitance.

original: de'i phyir dang por de gnyis kho na gtan la dbab pa brjod par bya dgos so zhes sems par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por de gnyis kho na gtan la dbab pa brjod par bya dgos so zhes sems par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to first state the ascertainment of those two.

original: 'dis rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩkhyab pa gtan la dbab pa brjod pa kho nas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag rang gi tshad ma ji lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / khyab pa gtan la dbab pa brjod pa kho nas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag rang gi tshad ma ji lta ba ste /
translated: In response to that, Dharmakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúThis ascertainment of pervasion . . .‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyi tshad ma ji lta bus nges par bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi tshad ma ji lta bus nges par bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the ascertainment of pervasion alone explains the positive and negative concomitance by means of one‚Äôs own valid knowledge, that is, by means of one‚Äôs own valid cognition.

original: 'am zhes bya ba'i sga ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las gcig gis kyang khyab pa yang dag par ston nus par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩphyogs kyi chos nges pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges @107a * //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba'i sga ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las gcig gis kyang khyab pa yang dag par ston nus par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro // phyogs kyi chos nges pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges @107a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù is used to indicate that one should understand that either positive or negative concomitance alone is able to demonstrate a correct pervasion.

original: pa'i skabs kyis blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: pa'i skabs kyis blta bar bya'i /
translated: Ascertainment of the property of the subject should be understood in terms of the ascertainment of positive and negative concomitance.

original: khyab pa smos pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa smos pas ni ma yin no //
translated: not by mentioning the pervasion.

original: phyogs kyi chos kyi smos pa ni sbyor ba'i rim pa gtso bo ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos kyi smos pa ni sbyor ba'i rim pa gtso bo ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the property of the subject is not the principal step in the syllogism.

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúincluding.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges par khyab pa 'phen par byed snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges par khyab pa 'phen par byed snyam pa la /
translated: How is it that the pervasion is indicated by the positive and negative concomitance?

original: gtan tshigs thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn all cases of a reason,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te gtan tshigs thams cad la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par gyur na de'i tshe khyab pa yang mi srid pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs thams cad la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par gyur na de'i tshe khyab pa yang mi srid pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If the property to be established were absent in all cases of the reason, then the pervasion would be impossible.

original: de lta bas na khyab pa ni rjes su 'gro ba la rag lus pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na khyab pa ni rjes su 'gro ba la rag lus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the pervasion depends on the positive concomitance.

original: khyab par byed pa log na yang ldog par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa log na yang ldog par nges pa yin no //
translated: And the negative concomitance is ascertained when the pervader is absent.

original: de lta bas na gang zhig log na nges par ldog par 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang zhig log na nges par ldog par 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: Therefore, that which is ascertained to be absent when the reason is absent is the property to be established.

original: de'i khyab par byed pa yin par 'grub par khyab pa ni ldog pa la rag lus pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyab par byed pa yin par 'grub par khyab pa ni ldog pa la rag lus pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of the pervasion is dependent on the contrapositive.

original: mjug bsdus te bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdus te bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize and teach this, he says:

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the ascertainment of the positive and negative concomitance, the pervasion is ascertained.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag yod na khyab pa srid pa de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag gis khyab pa nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag yod na khyab pa srid pa de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag gis khyab pa nges pa yin gyi /
translated: Because it is as explained above, if the positive and negative concomitance exist, then the pervasion is possible. Therefore, by the ascertainment of the positive and negative concomitance, the pervasion is ascertained.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir de ltar de dag nges pa'i khyab pa nges pa la rag lus pa de'i phyir gang du khyab pa bstan pa der de gnyis nges pa yang 'phangs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no // gang gi phyir de ltar de dag nges pa'i khyab pa nges pa la rag lus pa de'i phyir gang du khyab pa bstan pa der de gnyis nges pa yang 'phangs par rig par bya ste /
translated: But not otherwise.üîΩBecause in that way, the ascertainment of the pervasion is dependent on the ascertainment of the positive and negative concomitance, therefore, wherever the pervasion is taught, the ascertainment of those two is also implied.

original: de ltar na khyab pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khyab pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by the pervasion, the ascertainment of the positive and negative concomitance is implied.

original: de gnyis ji ltar nges pa ni 'og nas bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ji ltar nges pa ni 'og nas bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: The proof of the ascertainment of those two will be given later.

original: de lta na ni 'phen pa 'ba' zhig sgrub par zad do //üîΩde la phyogs kyi chos nges pa bsgrub par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'phen pa 'ba' zhig sgrub par zad do // de la phyogs kyi chos nges pa bsgrub par bzhed nas /
translated: In that case, the projection would be established alone.üîΩIn that regard, wishing to establish the property of the subject, he says,

original: de la bsgrub pa bya ba'i chos can la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la bsgrub pa bya ba'i chos can la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe property of the subject in the probandum,‚Äù and so on.

original: chos can la phyogs kyi chos mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas rab tu grub pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i nges pa yin te /
analyzed: chos can la phyogs kyi chos mngon sum ma ma rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas rab tu grub pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i nges pa yin te /
translated: That very ascertainment is the establishment of the property of the subject by means of direct perception or inference in the subject.

original: rab tu grub pa dang shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: rab tu grub pa dang shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúEstablishment‚Äù and ‚Äúknowledge‚Äù are synonyms.

original: mngon sum gyi sgo nas rab tu grub pa bstan pa'i phyir dper na phyogs na du ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi sgo nas rab tu grub pa bstan pa'i phyir dper na phyogs na du ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate establishment by means of direct perception, he says, ‚ÄúFor example, smoke on the mountain,‚Äù and so on.

original: phyogs na ni du ba mngon sum gyi sgo nas grub bo //
analyzed: phyogs na ni du ba mngon sum gyi sgo nas grub bo //
translated: Smoke is established by means of direct perception on the mountain.

original: gang zhig du ba dang 'brel pa can gyi phyogs mngon sum du 'gyur ba kho @107b na ma yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig du ba dang 'brel pa can gyi phyogs mngon sum du 'gyur ba kho @107b na ma yin na /
translated: If one does not directly perceive the mountain that is related to the smoke,

original: ji ltar de na mngon sum gyi sgo nas du ba 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de na mngon sum gyi sgo nas du ba 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could smoke be established there by means of direct perception?

original: de lta bas na snang ba dus kho na chos can yin par rigs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na snang ba dus kho na chos can yin par rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the subject is the appearance itself at the time of the reason.

original: de la ni mngon sum gyis 'dzin par srid do //
analyzed: de la ni mngon sum gyis 'dzin par srid do //
translated: For that, it is possible to apprehend it by direct perception.

original: de lta bas na sbyor ba ni du ba las du ba 'di ni me dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'i rgol ba de la /
analyzed: de lta bas na sbyor ba ni du ba las du ba 'di ni me dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'i rgol ba de la /
translated: Therefore, the syllogism would be: ‚ÄúRegarding this smoke, it is associated with fire.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du khyod kyi ltar na yang du ba'i rtsa ba me dang 'brel pa can gyi yan lag gang yin pa de nyid mi snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di skad du khyod kyi ltar na yang du ba'i rtsa ba me dang 'brel pa can gyi yan lag gang yin pa de nyid mi snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: To the opponent who thinks this, we would respond: ‚ÄúIn your view, is not the part of the smoke that is related to the fire not visible?

original: de lta bas na nyes pa mtshungs so zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na nyes pa mtshungs so zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the fault is the same.‚Äù

original: de la 'di snyam du ba'i yan lag can de yod pas des na nyes pa 'ga' yang med do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du ba'i yan lag can de yod pas des na nyes pa 'ga' yang med do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that because the possessor of the parts exists, there is no fault,

original: 'o na ni 'di na yang phyogs kyi yan lag can yod par 'gyur bas mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'di na yang phyogs kyi yan lag can yod par 'gyur bas mtshungs so //
translated: then in this case as well, the possessor of the parts would exist. Therefore, it is the same.

original: phyogs kho na chos can nyid du rigs te /
analyzed: phyogs kho na chos can nyid du rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable that the place alone is the subject.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na phyogs na me yod do zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na phyogs na me yod do zhes brjod kyi /
translated: For in the world, one says, ‚ÄúThere is fire in the place,‚Äù

original: du ba la yod do zhes ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: du ba la yod do zhes ni mi zer ro //
translated: but one does not say, ‚ÄúThere is smoke in the place.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas rab tu grub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas rab tu grub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is established by inference, he says,

original: sgra las byas pa nyid lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgra las byas pa nyid lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, like the fact that sound is a product.‚Äù

original: sgra la ni rkyen tha dad pas tha dad pa'i byas pa nyid rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas grub bo //
analyzed: sgra la ni rkyen tha dad pas tha dad pa'i byas pa nyid rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas grub bo //
translated: The fact that sound is a product is established by inference through the difference of its conditions.

original: mngon sum rtogs pa med pa nyid yin na ji ltar des phyogs na du ba 'dzin /
analyzed: mngon sum rtogs pa med pa nyid yin na ji ltar des phyogs na du ba 'dzin /
translated: If it is indeed non-conceptual cognition, how does it apprehend smoke in the place?

original: 'di ltar phyogs 'di na du ba yod do zhes phyogs dang 'brel pa can du du ba gzung bar bya dgos na /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs 'di na du ba yod do zhes phyogs dang 'brel pa can du du ba gzung bar bya dgos na /
translated: For in this way, smoke must be apprehended as connected with the place, thinking ‚ÄúSmoke exists in this place.‚Äù

original: mngon sum rnam par rtog pa med pa ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po mi 'dzin na /
analyzed: mngon sum rnam par rtog pa med pa ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po mi 'dzin na /
translated: But non-conceptual perception does not apprehend the relation of support and supported.

original: de ji ltar na phyogs na du ba mngon sum gyi sgo nas rab tu grub snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ji ltar na phyogs na du ba mngon sum gyi sgo nas rab tu grub snyam pa la /
translated: So how is it that smoke is established by perception in the place?

original: du ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: du ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúAlong with smoke‚Äù and so on.

original: du ba dang lhan cig 'jug pa ni du ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: du ba dang lhan cig 'jug pa ni du ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlong with smoke‚Äù means ‚Äútogether with smoke.‚Äù

original: du ba dang lhan cig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: du ba dang lhan cig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúalong with smoke.‚Äù

original: don gzhan gyis dben pa'i ngo bo can zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i phyogs las gzhan pa'i phyogs ni don gzhan no //
analyzed: don gzhan gyis dben pa'i ngo bo can zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i phyogs las gzhan pa'i phyogs ni don gzhan no //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving an essence that is devoid of other objects‚Äù means that the place that is the opposite of the place that is illuminated is devoid of other objects.

original: gang la das dben zhing bral ba'i ngo bo yod pa de ni don gzhan gyis dben pa'i ngo bo can te /
analyzed: gang la das dben zhing bral ba'i ngo bo yod pa de ni don gzhan gyis dben pa'i ngo bo can te /
translated: That which has an essence that is devoid of, or free from, that is ‚Äúhaving an essence that is devoid of other objects.‚Äù

original: du ba med pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i rang gi ngo bo can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩthun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni du ba med pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i du @108a * //
analyzed: du ba med pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba'i rang gi ngo bo can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // thun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni du ba med pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i du @108a * //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúhaving an essence that is free from the essence of the absence of smoke and so on.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúHaving a unique nature‚Äù means that it is different from the absence of smoke and from the place that is associated with smoke.

original: ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs dag las tha dad pa bdag nyid so sor nges pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs dag las tha dad pa bdag nyid so sor nges pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúhaving an essence that is individually determined.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang gi ngo bo de lta bu mngon sum du mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang gi ngo bo de lta bu mngon sum du mthong ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is seen by direct perception‚Äù means that the nature of a person is seen by direct perception.

original: mngon sum du mthong ba de la'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du mthong ba de la'o //
translated: It is in regard to that which is seen by direct perception.

original: ji ltar mthong ba tha dad pa'i yul can zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthong ba'i don du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs don gzhan las tha dad pa la log pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba tha dad pa'i yul can zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthong ba'i don du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs don gzhan las tha dad pa la log pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe subject that sees the difference‚Äù means that the subject that sees the object with its smoke is different from the other object, and that is the definition of the opposite.

original: shes pa gang la yul de yod pa de ni ji ltar mthong ba tha dad pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: shes pa gang la yul de yod pa de ni ji ltar mthong ba tha dad pa'i yul can no //
translated: The cognition in which that object exists is the subject that sees the difference.

original: dran pa rtags shes pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyid dran pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa rtags shes pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyid dran pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of memory is the sign‚Äù means that memory is itself the memory.

original: rtags 'dzin pa'i shas pa ni rtags shes pa'o //
analyzed: rtags 'dzin pa'i shas pa ni rtags shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition that apprehends the sign is the cognition of the sign.

original: des na 'di skad du mngon sum gyis mdun na bla 'og tu rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po gnyis ji ltar gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam de'i rnam pa skyes pas shes la /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du mngon sum gyis mdun na bla 'og tu rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po gnyis ji ltar gnas pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam de'i rnam pa skyes pas shes la /
translated: Therefore, this is what is being said: by the direct perception of the two things that are in front, arranged one above the other, the mere intrinsic nature of those things as they are arranged is produced in the aspect of that cognition.

original: de'i 'og tu bla 'og gi dngos po gnyis rtogs par byed pa na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bla 'og gi dngos po gnyis rtogs par byed pa na /
translated: Then, when one understands the two things, the upper and the lower,

original: gang gi phyogs na du ba yod do zhes bya ba de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba bzung zin pa de mngon par brjod pa yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyogs na du ba yod do zhes bya ba de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba bzung zin pa de mngon par brjod pa yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the conceptual thought that has as its object the expression ‚Äúthere is smoke‚Äù arises in the form of the apprehension of what has been grasped.

original: de nyid kyi stobs kyis de'i ngo bo ma yin pa sel bar byed pa na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi stobs kyis de'i ngo bo ma yin pa sel bar byed pa na /
translated: By the power of that, when one eliminates what is not its nature,

original: gang gi 'di na du ba med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba dgag pa'i rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi 'di na du ba med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba dgag pa'i rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: the conceptual thought of negation arises in the form of the understanding ‚Äúthere is no absence of smoke here.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na de ltar mngon sum ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi rgyu yang yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar mngon sum ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi rgyu yang yin la /
translated: Thus, perception is the cause of the two conceptual thoughts.

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang de'i rnam pa skyes bas de'i rag gi ngo bo yongs su 'dzin na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang de'i rnam pa skyes bas de'i rag gi ngo bo yongs su 'dzin na /
translated: And since it itself arises in the form of that, it apprehends the nature of that.

original: de ji ltar phyogs na du ba yod pa'i 'brel pa yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ji ltar phyogs na du ba yod pa'i 'brel pa yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: So how could it not determine the relation of the presence of smoke to the place?

original: 'di ltar 'brel pa 'dzin pa ni 'di na 'di yod do zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel pa 'dzin pa ni 'di na 'di yod do zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Thus, the apprehension of a connection is ‚ÄúThis exists here.‚Äù

original: 'di 'di'i yin no zhes bya bar yid ches pa gang yin pa de lta bu yin la /
analyzed: 'di 'di'i yin no zhes bya bar yid ches pa gang yin pa de lta bu yin la /
translated: Thus, the apprehension of a relation is the confidence that ‚Äúthis exists‚Äù or ‚Äúthis is that.‚Äù

original: de yang rnam par mi rtog bzhin du mngon sum la srid na ji ltar mi 'dzin ces bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de yang rnam par mi rtog bzhin du mngon sum la srid na ji ltar mi 'dzin ces bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: And if that is possible in a nonconceptual perception, why wouldn‚Äôt it apprehend it? This is the condensed meaning.

original: de ltar shes pa'i tshogs skyes pa la tshad ma nyid dpyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa'i tshogs skyes pa la tshad ma nyid dpyad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to examine the validity of the arising of the collection of consciousnesses in that way,

original: de la dang po yul thun mong ma yin pa mthong ba gang yin pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la dang po yul thun mong ma yin pa mthong ba gang yin pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat which sees the uncommon object alone is valid cognition.‚Äù

original: dang por yul thun mong ma yin @108b pa mthong ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de kho na 'dir tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: dang por yul thun mong ma yin @108b pa mthong ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de kho na 'dir tshad ma yin te /
translated: That which sees the uncommon object alone is valid cognition here.

original: 'di ltar de ni dngos po dang dngos su 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni dngos po dang dngos su 'brel pa yin la /
translated: Because it is directly related to the thing,

original: de'i stobs kho nas rnam par rtog pa skye'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs kho nas rnam par rtog pa skye'o //
translated: only on the strength of that is there the arising of conceptual thought.

original: de lta bas na rtsa bar gyur pa'i phyir dang / dngos po dang dngos su 'brel pa'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin no /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtsa bar gyur pa'i phyir dang / dngos po dang dngos su 'brel pa'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin no /
translated: Therefore, because it is the root and because it is directly related to the thing, it alone is the valid cognition.

original: dran pa tshad ma nyid du dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa tshad ma nyid du dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the validity of memory, he says:

original: de de ltar mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de de ltar mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving seen it in that way,‚Äù etc.

original: du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs de thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bor mthong nas so //
analyzed: du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs de thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bor mthong nas so //
translated: Having seen the place with the smoke as a unique entity.

original: de lta bu'i phyogs de rnam pa gang dang gang gis thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyogs de rnam pa gang dang gang gis thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: That place is unique in some way or other.

original: du ba snang ba dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: du ba snang ba dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Either it is endowed with the appearance of smoke,

original: yang na 'dod pa'i phyogs dang 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i phyogs dang 'brel pa'am /
translated: or it is related to the place that is desired,

original: yang na gzhan gang yang rung ba'i rnam pas thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gang yang rung ba'i rnam pas thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: or it is unique in some other way.

original: du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs de'i thun mong ma yin pa nyid don gzhan las log pa'i ngo bo mngon par brjod pa ni yang mngon sum du byed pa ste /
analyzed: du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs de'i thun mong ma yin pa nyid don gzhan las log pa'i ngo bo mngon par brjod pa ni yang mngon sum du byed pa ste /
translated: The unique nature of the place with the smoke, which is the opposite of other things, is again made evident by the expression.

original: mngon sum gyi stobs kyi don gzhan las log pa'i yul can gyi dran pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi stobs kyi don gzhan las log pa'i yul can gyi dran pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The memory that has as its object the exclusion of other things is produced by the power of perception.

original: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'dod do //
translated: But it is not accepted as valid knowledge, because it apprehends the object in the form in which it was previously perceived.

original: de'i thun mong ma yin pa ni de'i thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thun mong ma yin pa ni de'i thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: The uncommon is the uncommon.

original: de las tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From that, different.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni don gzhan yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni don gzhan yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to another object.

original: tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni log pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni log pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù refers to the opposite.

original: de las tha dad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid kho na ston to //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid kho na ston to //
translated: This ‚Äúfrom that, different‚Äù shows only the uncommonness.

original: de ma yin pa las log pa'i yul can zhes bya ba ni du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs de nyid la de zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: de ma yin pa las log pa'i yul can zhes bya ba ni du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs de nyid la de zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The subject that has as its object the exclusion of what is not that is that very place where there is smoke, expressed by the word ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: de ma yin pa ni de ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ma yin pa ni de ma yin pa ste /
translated: What is not that is not that.

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúanother object.‚Äù

original: de las log pa ni de ma yin pa las log pa'o //
analyzed: de las log pa ni de ma yin pa las log pa'o //
translated: The exclusion of what is not that is the exclusion of what is not that.

original: gang la yul de ma yin pa las log pa yod pa de ni ma yin pa la log pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: gang la yul de ma yin pa las log pa yod pa de ni ma yin pa la log pa'i yul can no //
translated: That which has the object that is the opposite of what is not that is the subject that has the object that is the opposite of what is not.

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: That which is the aspect seen by direct perception is the aspect of what is seen.

original: de lta bas na bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that it is not a valid cognition because it apprehends what has already been apprehended.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam pa la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam pa la /
translated: From where is it known that conceptual cognition apprehends the aspect of what is seen?

original: sngar thun mong ma yin pa mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngar thun mong ma yin pa mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, it is said, ‚ÄúHaving previously seen the uncommon . . .‚Äù

original: mngon sum kho nas du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs de thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bor yongs su bzung ba @109a * //
analyzed: mngon sum kho nas du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs de thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bor yongs su bzung ba @109a * //
translated: By direct perception alone, that place with smoke is taken to be an uncommon entity.

original: yin la / mngon sum gyi gzung ba thun mong ma yin pa de nyid la de'i ngo bor brjod pas yang mngon sum du byed pa'i sngon ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par bya ba med pas rnam par rtog pa ni ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i don 'dzin par byed pa
analyzed: yin la / mngon sum gyi gzung ba thun mong ma yin pa de nyid la de'i ngo bor brjod pas yang mngon sum du byed pa'i sngon ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par bya ba med pas rnam par rtog pa ni ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i don 'dzin par byed pa
translated: But it is not, because that uncommon object of direct perception is called its entity, and so it is not the case that the object previously not understood that is to be understood by the direct perception is nonexistent.

original: yin te / de lta bas na de ltar dran pa yin na ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i don 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du dgag go //
analyzed: yin te / de lta bas na de ltar dran pa yin na ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i don 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du dgag go //
translated: Therefore, since it is memory in that way, it is refuted as valid knowledge because it apprehends the object as it was seen.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù has the meaning of a collection.

original: spyi med na rnam par rtog pas phyogs kyi chos ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rnam pa'i rnam pas 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: spyi med na rnam par rtog pas phyogs kyi chos ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rnam pa'i rnam pas 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: If there is no universal, it is not only that conceptual cognition is not valid knowledge because it apprehends the aspect of the property of the position as it was seen by direct perception.

original: spyi yod du chug na yang don byed ba bsgrub pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyi yod du chug na yang don byed ba bsgrub pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: Even if there is a universal, it is not valid knowledge because it does not understand the accomplishment of the function of the object. This is the meaning of the collection.

original: da ni pha rol du spyi nyams su myong ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dran pa nyid du mi 'dod bzhin du tshad ma nyid dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni pha rol du spyi nyams su myong ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dran pa nyid du mi 'dod bzhin du tshad ma nyid dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute the validity of memory, which is a subjective experience of a universal that is experienced in a different place,

original: don byed pa bsgrub pa mthong zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don byed pa bsgrub pa mthong zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause the accomplishment of a function has already been seen, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di la don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni mngon sum kho nas mthong zin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni mngon sum kho nas mthong zin pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, that which is a functional thing has already been seen by direct perception.

original: de mthong nas phyis rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ma mthong ba cung zad kyang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: de mthong nas phyis rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ma mthong ba cung zad kyang rtogs pa med do //
translated: Having seen that, later, any conceptualization that occurs does not at all understand a functional thing that has not been seen.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te /
translated: Here, the example is dissimilar to the probandum.

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pas don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ma mthong ba rtogs pa ltar rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pas don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ma mthong ba rtogs pa ltar rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: Just as inference understands a functional thing that has not been seen, conceptualization is not like that.

original: de lta ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa ni don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ma mthong ba rtog pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa ni don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ma mthong ba rtog pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, conceptual thought is not a valid cognition, because it does not see the thing that performs a function, since it is devoid of conceptual thought.üîΩThe performance of the function of the object.

original: don gyi bya ba ni byed pa'o //üîΩdon ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba ni byed pa'o // don ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The object is the purpose.

original: byed pa ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: The performance is the accomplishment.

original: don byed pa'i sgrub pa ni don byed sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: don byed pa'i sgrub pa ni don byed sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the performance of the function of the object is the performance of the function of the object.

original: de sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir /
analyzed: de sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir /
translated: The accomplishment of that is called ‚Äúhere.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don byed pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don byed pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected with the performance of the function of the object.

original: yang zhes pa'i don ni phyis zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang zhes pa'i don ni phyis zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúlater.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the establishment of the non-apprehension of the object is the establishment of the apprehension of the object.

original: de bas na don ma rtogs pa rtogs par byed pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na don ma rtogs pa rtogs par byed pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: If you think that in this case, the determination of the object, apart from the performance of the function of the object, is a valid cognition,üîΩbut the universal is not, this is merely the statement of your own system.üîΩTherefore, the determination of the object, apart from the performance of the function of the object, is a valid cognition,üîΩbut the universal is not, this is merely the statement of your own system.üîΩTherefore, the determination of the object, apart from the performance of the function of the object, is a valid cognition,üîΩbut the universal is not, this is merely the statement of your own system.üîΩTherefore, the determination of the object, apart from the performance of the function of the object, is a valid cognition,üîΩbut the universal is not, this is merely the statement of your own system.üîΩTherefore, the determination of the object, apart from the performance of the function of the object, is a valid cognition,üîΩbut the universal is not, this is merely the statement of your own system.üîΩTherefore, the determination of the object, apart from the performance of the function of the object, is a valid cognition,üîΩbut the universal is not, this is merely the statement of your own system.

original: de la 'di snyam du don byed pa ma gtogs pa yongs su gcod pa tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du don byed pa ma gtogs pa yongs su gcod pa tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the determination of the object, apart from the performance of the function of the object, is a valid cognition,üîΩbut the universal is not, this is merely the statement of your own system.üîΩTherefore, the determination of the object, apart from the performance of the function of the object, is a valid cognition,üîΩbut the universal is not, this is merely the statement of your own system.üîΩTherefore, the determination of the object, apart from the performance of the function of the object, is a valid cognition,

original: spyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rang gi lugs brjod par zad do snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rang gi lugs brjod par zad do snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: but the universal is not,

original: don byed pa don du gnyer ba rtogs pa dang ldan pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don byed pa don du gnyer ba rtogs pa dang ldan pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúAll those who are rational, who seek to be effective, etc.‚Äù

original: gang la la rtogs pa sngon du gtong ba la de thams cad ni don byed pa don du gnyer ba ni tshad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin pa tshol te /
analyzed: gang la la rtogs pa sngon du gtong ba la de thams cad ni don byed pa don du gnyer ba ni tshad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin pa tshol te /
translated: Those who are rational, who seek to be effective, who seek valid cognition or invalid cognition, etc.

original: rtogs pa sngon du @109b gtong ba rnams ni bslus par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas tshad ma ma yin pa yang tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: rtogs pa sngon du @109b gtong ba rnams ni bslus par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas tshad ma ma yin pa yang tshol bar byed do //
translated: Those who are rational seek to be effective, because they think, ‚ÄúIt is not right to be deceived.‚Äù

original: yang na 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i tshig gi lugs dang mthun par brjod par zad do //üîΩ'jig rten ni phal cher rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas lhas byin gyis byas so //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i tshig gi lugs dang mthun par brjod par zad do // 'jig rten ni phal cher rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas lhas byin gyis byas so //
translated: Or, this is said in accordance with the way of speaking in the world.

original: yang na gzhan gyis byas so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa smra'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis byas so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa smra'o //
translated: The world says, ‚ÄúDevadatta did it,‚Äù or ‚ÄúSomeone else did it,‚Äù etc.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du gtong ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du gtong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRational‚Äù means having intelligence.

original: de la 'di snyam du spyi yang don bya ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du spyi yang don bya ba byed pa yin no //
translated: If you think that a universal also performs the function of the object, then it follows, absurdly, that a universal is a thing.

original: de bas na spyi de 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa yang tshad ma ma yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na spyi de 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa yang tshad ma ma yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that apprehends that universal is not a valid cognition.

original: spyi ni don byed cung zad kyang mi nus te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: spyi ni don byed cung zad kyang mi nus te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, he says, ‚ÄúA universal cannot perform even the slightest function.‚Äù

original: spyi ni don bya ba byed cung zad kyang mi nus na ji ltar de'i yul can gyis shes pa tshad ma nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: spyi ni don bya ba byed cung zad kyang mi nus na ji ltar de'i yul can gyis shes pa tshad ma nyid du 'gyur /
translated: If a universal cannot perform the function of an object, how can the consciousness that has it as its object be a valid cognition?üîΩHow is a universal not able to perform the function of an object?

original: spyi ji lta bu zhig don bya ba byed pa ma yin zhe na de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyi ji lta bu zhig don bya ba byed pa ma yin zhe na de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúAfter the perception of a particular . . .‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa ni mngon sum gyi rkyen no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa ni mngon sum gyi rkyen no //
translated: The condition of perception of a particular is direct perception.

original: de'i stobs kyis phyis rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa des gzung ba'i spyi gang yin pa de ni cung zad kyang mi byed do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis phyis rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa des gzung ba'i spyi gang yin pa de ni cung zad kyang mi byed do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The universal that is apprehended by the conceptual consciousness that arises later through the power of that is not able to perform even the slightest function.üîΩThis is what he means.

original: 'di nyid la dper /
analyzed: 'di nyid la dper /
translated: An example of this is as follows.

original: dper na sngon po mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na sngon po mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, when one sees blue, etc.

original: dper na mngon sum gyis sngon po mthong na phyis 'di snyam du 'di ni sngon po'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de la snang ba'i spyi gang yin pa des ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na mngon sum gyis sngon po mthong na phyis 'di snyam du 'di ni sngon po'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de la snang ba'i spyi gang yin pa des ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa yin no //
translated: For example, when one sees blue by means of direct perception, later on, the conceptual consciousness that arises, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is blue,‚Äù does not in the least perform a function with respect to the universal that appears to it.üîΩThe universal that is the object of the conceptual consciousness does not perform a function.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba spyi don bya ba byed ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam pa la /üîΩsngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba spyi don bya ba byed ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam pa la / sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: How do we know this?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩsngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de kho nas sngon pos bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba byed kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de kho nas sngon pos bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba byed kyi /
translated: The essence of the unique particular of blue, etc.

original: spyis ni ma yin no //üîΩde lta bus bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spyis ni ma yin no // de lta bus bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The essence of the unique particular of blue performs the function of the object to be established by blue, but not by a universal.üîΩThat which is to be established by that

original: 'di ni de lta bus bsgrub par bya ba yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bus bsgrub par bya ba yang yin la /
translated: is established by that.

original: don bya ba yang yin pas de bsdu'o //
analyzed: don bya ba yang yin pas de bsdu'o //
translated: and it is also a meaning-generality, so it is included in that.

original: 'di ni de byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ni de byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas /
translated: This is the mode of being of that,

original: de lta bus bsgrub par bya ba don bya ba byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bus bsgrub par bya ba don bya ba byed pa yin te /
translated: and that which is established by such a mode is a meaning-generality.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is its definition.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sngon po la bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sngon po la bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúsuch‚Äù refers to blue.

original: de la 'di snyam du sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma mthong ba de nyid rnam par rtog pas shes par 'gyur ro snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma mthong ba de nyid rnam par rtog pas shes par 'gyur ro snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: Since one might think that the non-seeing of the definition of blue is itself known by conceptual consciousness, he says,

original: de yang de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩsngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid de yang sngon @110a * //
analyzed: de yang de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid de yang sngon @110a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is also of the nature of that . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe definition of blue is also of the nature of the object of the function of blue.

original: po'i don bya ba byed pa'i bdag nyid du mngon sum kho nas mthong na /
analyzed: po'i don bya ba byed pa'i bdag nyid du mngon sum kho nas mthong na /
translated: If one sees it by means of perception,

original: de la rnam par rtog pas ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pas ci zhig byed par 'gyur /
translated: what would a conceptual consciousness do with regard to it?

original: de la 'di snyam du sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang don gyi bya ba byed la sngon po'i spyi yang bya ba byed par gyur na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang don gyi bya ba byed la sngon po'i spyi yang bya ba byed par gyur na /
translated: But if you think that the particular of blue performs the function of the object and the universal of blue also performs the function of the object,üîΩthen what is the problem?üîΩTo respond:

original: yang gnod pa ci yod snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /üîΩde'i rang gi mtshan nyid gzung pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang gnod pa ci yod snyam du sems par 'gyur bas de'i phyir / de'i rang gi mtshan nyid gzung pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: After the apprehension of its particular,üîΩThe apprehension of the universal does not perform the function of the object.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyi rkyen no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyi rkyen no //
translated: The condition of direct perception is the apprehension of the particular.

original: de'i 'og tu 'byung ba sngon por rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de'i yul gyis ni sngon pos bsgrub par bya ba gos kha dog bsgyur ba la sogs pa'i don bya bsgrub par mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'byung ba sngon por rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de'i yul gyis ni sngon pos bsgrub par bya ba gos kha dog bsgyur ba la sogs pa'i don bya bsgrub par mi byed de /
translated: After that, the object of the conception that arises, ‚ÄúThis is blue,‚Äù does not perform the function of the object, such as the function of the object of blue cloth.

original: 'di ltar spyi ni rtag pa 'am brtags pa zhig yin par khas blangs grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi ni rtag pa 'am brtags pa zhig yin par khas blangs grang na /
translated: In this way, whether you assert that the universal is permanent or imputed,

original: rtag pa ni shes pa'i ngo bo tsam gyi don byed par yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rtag pa ni shes pa'i ngo bo tsam gyi don byed par yang mi 'thad de /
translated: it is not tenable that a permanent thing performs the function of the object that is the mere nature of consciousness.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu dus thams cad du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu dus thams cad du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it does not rely on a cooperative condition, its effect would occur at all times.

original: de lta bas na shes pa gcig pu kho na rtogs par byed pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na shes pa gcig pu kho na rtogs par byed pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, only a single cognition would be the apprehender,

original: shes pa gzhan gyi go skabs kyang med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyi go skabs kyang med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: and there would be no opportunity for other cognitions.

original: bya ba gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same can be said for other actions.

original: spyi rtag pa zhig yin na yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir don byed nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi rtag pa zhig yin na yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir don byed nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If the universal is permanent, it cannot perform a function because it is not the intrinsic nature of a thing.

original: de ltar don byed pa ma rtogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad ma nyid du bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar don byed pa ma rtogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad ma nyid du bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having established that a cognition that does not understand a functioning thing is a valid cognition,

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /üîΩde lta bas na don ma rtogs pa'i yul can tshad ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir / de lta bas na don ma rtogs pa'i yul can tshad ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to summarize, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúTherefore, a cognition that does not understand a thing is a valid cognition.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ma rtogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad ma nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po ma rtogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad ma nyid yin la /
translated: Because in that way a cognition that does not understand a thing that performs a function is a valid cognition,

original: spyi ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin pa de'i phyir don ma rtogs pa rtogs par byed pa tshad ma yin no zhes de skad du rjod par byed pas kyang /
analyzed: spyi ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin pa de'i phyir don ma rtogs pa rtogs par byed pa tshad ma yin no zhes de skad du rjod par byed pas kyang /
translated: Since a universal does not perform the function of an object, therefore, even though one says, ‚ÄúA valid cognition is that which causes one to understand what was not understood,‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa zhes khyad par du bya dgos te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa zhes khyad par du bya dgos te /
translated: one must specify, ‚Äúa particular that was not understood.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa rtogs par byed pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes brjod par bya dgos so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa rtogs par byed pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes brjod par bya dgos so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: One should say, ‚ÄúA valid cognition is that which causes one to understand a particular that was not understood.‚Äù

original: de ltar re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa rtogs pa'i rgyu mthong ba tshad ma nyid du bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa rtogs pa'i rgyu mthong ba tshad ma nyid du bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having established that seeing is a valid cognition that causes one to understand a particular that was not understood,

original: de'i stobs kyis 'byung ba ni dran pa nyid yin pa dang / tshad ma nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis 'byung ba ni dran pa nyid yin pa dang / tshad ma nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to establish by the power of that that memory is not a valid cognition, he says, ‚ÄúHaving understood a particular,‚Äù and so on.

original: mngon sum gyi rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs nas phyis mngon sum gyi mthu las skye ba mngon sum dang mthun bar byed pa'i rnam @110b par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs nas phyis mngon sum gyi mthu las skye ba mngon sum dang mthun bar byed pa'i rnam @110b par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Having realized the nature of the object through direct perception, the conceptual cognition that arises later from the power of direct perception and conforms to direct perception is

original: bya ba'i sgo nas de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dran pa kho na yin par rigs kyi tshad ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i sgo nas de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dran pa kho na yin par rigs kyi tshad ma ni ma yin no //
translated: only memory, because it is the object of that action, but it is not a valid cognition.

original: de'i mthu ni de'i mthu ste /
analyzed: de'i mthu ni de'i mthu ste /
translated: Its power is the power of that.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected to the realization of the nature of the object.

original: 'di la de'i mthu las skyes pa yod pas de la tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la de'i mthu las skyes pa yod pas de la tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Since it arises from the power of that, the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is applied to it.

original: 'di ni de dang mthun par byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas de dang mthun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de dang mthun par byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas de dang mthun par byed pa'o //
translated: Since it has the character of conforming to that, it conforms to that.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the nature of the object.

original: gsal bar mi snang bar brgyud pa'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid kho na dang mthun par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsal bar mi snang bar brgyud pa'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid kho na dang mthun par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it conforms to the nature of the object alone through an indirect process, without appearing clearly.

original: yang na de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mngon sum dang sbyar ro //üîΩbya ba'i sgo nas de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mngon sum dang sbyar ro // bya ba'i sgo nas de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi /
translated: Or else, the term ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to perception.

original: don da par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don da par ni ma yin te /
translated: Because it has that as its object in terms of activity means that conceptual thought has that as its object in terms of its result, but not in terms of its object.üîΩFor,

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni dngos sun yul med pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni dngos sun yul med pa kho na yin na /
translated: all conceptual thoughts have no object at all.

original: de dag ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'gyur /
translated: How then could they have a real object?

original: bya ba ni 'dir rang gi mtshan nyid la lhag par zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba ni 'dir rang gi mtshan nyid la lhag par zhen pa yin te /
translated: Activity here means adherence to a real object.

original: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / mngon sum la snang ba gang yin ba dang / rnam par rtog pa la snang ba gang yin pa de thams cad 'dra ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pas gcig pa nyid du mngon bar zhen par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / mngon sum la snang ba gang yin ba dang / rnam par rtog pa la snang ba gang yin pa de thams cad 'dra ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pas gcig pa nyid du mngon bar zhen par byed do //
translated: For, whatever is a real object, whatever appears in perception, and whatever appears in conceptual thought, all of these are the same, and conceptual thought adheres to them as identical.

original: yang na bya ba ni 'dir ji ltar yongs su mthong pa'i yul ma gtogs pa'i yul 'dzin pa med ba yin bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na bya ba ni 'dir ji ltar yongs su mthong pa'i yul ma gtogs pa'i yul 'dzin pa med ba yin bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Or else, the object of activity should be viewed as the object that is seen here, since there is no apprehension of an object that is not seen.

original: gang gi tshe bya ba'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bya ba'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is a valid cognition in terms of its object of activity, then at that time

original: nyams su myong zin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dran pa kho na yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong zin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dran pa kho na yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin no //
translated: it is memory alone, since it has an experienced object, but it is not a valid cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyams su myong zin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dran pa nyid yin du chug na yang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyams su myong zin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dran pa nyid yin du chug na yang /
translated: Even though it is memory since it has an experienced object that is conceptual,

original: ci'i phyir bya ba'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin snyam pa la de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bya ba'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin snyam pa la de'i phyir /
translated: why is it not a valid cognition since it is a valid cognition in terms of its object of activity?

original: dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚Äúbecause there is no realization of a thing‚Äôs essence.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog par bya ba'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin du zin kyang rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par bya ba'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin du zin kyang rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'dod do //
translated: Although it is an object that is the basis of conceptualization, it is not asserted to be valid knowledge because it does not realize what was not previously realized, even though it realizes its object‚Äôs specific characteristics.

original: de ltar na don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams ni tshad ma tshol ba'i phyir dngos po don byed nus pa'i yul can gyi shes pa ni tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar na don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams ni tshad ma tshol ba'i phyir dngos po don byed nus pa'i yul can gyi shes pa ni tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Thus it is established that the consciousness that is the object of a thing that is able to perform a function is valid knowledge because those who seek to perform a function seek valid knowledge.

original: don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams lta zhig tshad ma'am @111a * //üîΩtshad ma ma yin pa chol du zad mod /
analyzed: don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams lta zhig tshad ma'am @111a * // tshad ma ma yin pa chol du zad mod /
translated: But why is it that those who seek to perform a function are satisfied with valid knowledge or invalid knowledge?

original: don byed pa bsgrub pa'i yul can gyi shes pa kho na tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: don byed pa bsgrub pa'i yul can gyi shes pa kho na tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is it that only the consciousness that is the object of the establishment of a function is valid knowledge?

original: tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos po la brten pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos ste /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos po la brten pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos ste /
translated: Because the presentation of valid knowledge is based on things.

original: tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la rag las pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la rag las pa yin te /
translated: The presentation of valid knowledge depends on specific characteristics.

original: 'di ltar dngos po mi slu ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de tshad ma'o zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po mi slu ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de tshad ma'o zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, that non-deceptive cognition in regard to an entity is a valid cognition.

original: gang la dngos po la brten pa yod pa de ni dngos po la brten pa can no //
analyzed: gang la dngos po la brten pa yod pa de ni dngos po la brten pa can no //
translated: That which has a basis in an entity is said to be ‚Äúbased on an entity.‚Äù

original: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de dngos po la brten pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de dngos po la brten pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Its nature is just that, because it is based on an entity.

original: brten pa dang rag lus pa dag na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: brten pa dang rag lus pa dag na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBased‚Äù and ‚Äúdependent‚Äù are synonyms.

original: dngos po la brten pa can tshad mar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: dngos po la brten pa can tshad mar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is it that a valid cognition is said to be based on an entity?

original: de'i don du 'jug pa ni don byed par rung ba'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i don du 'jug pa ni don byed par rung ba'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause its engagement is in the object that is capable of effective action.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams dngos po don byed par rung ba la 'jug pa de'i phyir tshad ma ni dngos po la rag lus pa zhes tha snyad gdags so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams dngos po don byed par rung ba la 'jug pa de'i phyir tshad ma ni dngos po la rag lus pa zhes tha snyad gdags so //
translated: Because those who seek to perform an action engage in an entity that is capable of effective action, therefore a valid cognition is conventionally designated as ‚Äúbased on an entity.‚Äù

original: don bya bar rung ba ni don byed par rung ba'o //
analyzed: don bya bar rung ba ni don byed par rung ba'o //
translated: That which is suitable for performing an object is suitable for performing an object.

original: 'jug pa gang la yul de yod pa de ni don byed par rung ba'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa gang la yul de yod pa de ni don byed par rung ba'i yul can yin no //
translated: That which engages in an object that exists is the subject that is suitable for performing an object.

original: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de don byed par rung ba'i yul can nyid yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de don byed par rung ba'i yul can nyid yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Its nature is just that, because it is the subject that is suitable for performing an object.

original: gal te de don du gnyer ba rnams don byed par rung ba la 'jug tu zin kyang ji ltar dngos po la brten pa can tshad mar rnam par gzhag snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te de don du gnyer ba rnams don byed par rung ba la 'jug tu zin kyang ji ltar dngos po la brten pa can tshad mar rnam par gzhag snyam pa la /
translated: If those who seek an object engage in that which is suitable for performing an object, then how is it that valid knowledge is posited as that which is based on an object?

original: de'i phyir dngos po ni don byed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ni don byed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúBecause an object has the characteristic of being suitable for performing an object.‚Äù

original: gal te don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams don byed par rung ba la 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams don byed par rung ba la 'jug na /
translated: If those who seek to perform an object engage in that which is suitable for performing an object,

original: 'o na ni de dag dngos po kho na la zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de dag dngos po kho na la zhugs pa yin te /
translated: then they engage in an object alone.

original: 'di ltar don byed par rung ba ni dngos po kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar don byed par rung ba ni dngos po kho na yin no //
translated: In that case, that which is suitable for performing an object is an object alone.

original: 'di la don byed par rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la don byed par rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it has the characteristic of being suitable to perform a function‚Äù is to be applied here.

original: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de don byed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de don byed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid can nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: The nature of that is just that; it is the characteristic of being suitable to perform a function.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams don byed par rung ba la 'jug la /üîΩdon byed par rung ba yang dngos po yin pa de'i phyir dngos po la brten pa can tshad mar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te / gang gi phyir don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams don byed par rung ba la 'jug la / don byed par rung ba yang dngos po yin pa de'i phyir dngos po la brten pa can tshad mar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The condensed meaning of this passage is as follows:üîΩBecause those who seek to perform a function engage in that which is suitable to perform a function, and that which is suitable to perform a function is an entity, therefore valid knowledge is posited as being based on an entity.

original: 'di ltar don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams ni dngos po don byed par rung ba bsgrub pa'i @111b phyir tshad ma tshol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams ni dngos po don byed par rung ba bsgrub pa'i @111b phyir tshad ma tshol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, those who seek to perform a function seek valid knowledge in order to establish an entity that is suitable to perform a function.

original: de lta bas na gang gi tshe dngos po don byed par rung bar mi slu ba'i shes pa tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe ji ltar na tshad ma nyid dngos po la rag lus pa ma yin /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gi tshe dngos po don byed par rung bar mi slu ba'i shes pa tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe ji ltar na tshad ma nyid dngos po la rag lus pa ma yin /
translated: Therefore, when a non-deceptive consciousness that is suitable to perform a function is posited as valid knowledge, at that time how could valid knowledge not depend on things?

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma nyid dngos po la rag lus pa yin pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //üîΩyang tshul gzhan gyis rnam par rtog pa tshad ma nyid du dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma nyid dngos po la rag lus pa yin pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so // yang tshul gzhan gyis rnam par rtog pa tshad ma nyid du dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because valid knowledge depends on things, therefore it is established that conceptual consciousnesses are not valid knowledge.

original: rnam par rtog pa de las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to refute that conceptual consciousnesses are valid knowledge by another method, he says, ‚ÄúAlso, from that conceptual consciousness,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid gzung ba'i stobs kyis skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa de las kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi lhag par chags pas dngos po kho na la 'jug la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid gzung ba'i stobs kyis skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa de las kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi lhag par chags pas dngos po kho na la 'jug la /
translated: Because conceptual consciousnesses arise by the power of apprehending their own characteristics, whatever conceptual consciousnesses there are, they engage only in things through the superimposition of their own characteristics.

original: zhugs na ni 'di ltar mngon sum dang rnam par rtog par grub pa dang bde ba mtshungs pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa logs shig tu tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhugs na ni 'di ltar mngon sum dang rnam par rtog par grub pa dang bde ba mtshungs pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa logs shig tu tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does engage, then it is like the establishment and happiness of direct perception, and therefore conceptual cognition does not become a separate valid cognition.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mngon sum gyi dngos po la 'jug pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mngon sum gyi dngos po la 'jug pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that it is not only the case that the entity of direct perception engages.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is it?‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa de las kyang dngos po kho na la 'jug go zhes bsdu ba'i don to //üîΩ'bras bu gcig pa nyid ni grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de las kyang dngos po kho na la 'jug go zhes bsdu ba'i don to // 'bras bu gcig pa nyid ni grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The meaning of the summary is that the entity is engaged by that conceptual cognition.üîΩThe identity of effect is expressed by the word ‚Äúnon-different establishment and happiness.‚ÄùüîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.

original: grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir logs shig tu tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di 'khrul pa yod par dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩmngon sum snga ma dang phyi ma rnams su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir logs shig tu tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di 'khrul pa yod par dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩmngon sum snga ma dang phyi ma rnams su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the doubt that this is a mistake, ‚Äúthe non-difference of establishment and happiness‚Äù is stated.

original: gal te grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa logs shig tu tshad mar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa logs shig tu tshad mar mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not accept that conceptual cognition is a separate valid cognition because it is not different from the cognition that is its result and the pleasure that is its result,

original: de lta na ni gang gi tshe yul gcig la mngon sum rgyun chags su 'jug pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta na ni gang gi tshe yul gcig la mngon sum rgyun chags su 'jug pa de'i tshe /
translated: then when a single object is engaged by a continuous series of direct perceptions,

original: mngon sum snga ma dang mngon sum phyi ma rnams su 'ga' zhig la nye bar sbyor ba gcig pa'i phyir de dag logs shig tu tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur te /
