analyzed: mngon sum snga ma dang mngon sum phyi ma rnams su 'ga' zhig la nye bar sbyor ba gcig pa'i phyir de dag logs shig tu tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: the earlier direct perception and the later direct perceptions would not be separate valid cognitions because they are the same in being applied to something.

original: 'di dag gis nye bar sbyor ba tha mi dad pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis nye bar sbyor ba tha mi dad pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they are not different in their application‚Äù should be supplied.

original: 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni yul 'ga' zhig la ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni yul 'ga' zhig la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSomething‚Äù means some object.

original: de lta bu ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no//
analyzed: de lta bu ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no//
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin no //
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don du 'dod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don du 'dod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIt is asserted that the object to be established is by means of the particular moment.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe skad cig ma'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don du 'dod pa yin pa de'i tshe 'di dag gi nye bar sbyor ba tha dad pa kho na yin no //üîΩde lta bas na nye bar @112a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe skad cig ma'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don du 'dod pa yin pa de'i tshe 'di dag gi nye bar sbyor ba tha dad pa kho na yin no // de lta bas na nye bar @112a * //
translated: When it is asserted that the object to be established is by means of the particular moment, then at that time, their application is only different.

original: sbyor ba tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir phyi ma rnams tshad ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir phyi ma rnams tshad ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, because their application is different, the latter are not valid cognitions.

original: dper na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rgyun la sbyor ba'i lam gang yin pa des ni bar chad med pa'i lam 'dren par byed la /
analyzed: dper na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rgyun la sbyor ba'i lam gang yin pa des ni bar chad med pa'i lam 'dren par byed la /
translated: For example, whatever is the path of application in the continuum of consciousness that focuses on the four noble truths of the yogis, that induces the uninterrupted path.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis kyang rnam par grol ba'i lam 'dren par byed /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis kyang rnam par grol ba'i lam 'dren par byed /
translated: And the uninterrupted path also induces the path of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis kyang nyon mongs pa skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i brten pa bskyed pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs pa brtan par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis kyang nyon mongs pa skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i brten pa bskyed pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs pa brtan par byed do //
translated: And the path of liberation also stabilizes the abandonment of the afflictions because it generates a support that is in complete opposition to the arising of the afflictions.

original: de lta bas na de dag 'dzin par byed pa pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang tha dad par tshad ma nyid yin pa de dang 'dra ba gzhan du yang gal te skad cig ma'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag 'dzin par byed pa pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang tha dad par tshad ma nyid yin pa de dang 'dra ba gzhan du yang gal te skad cig ma'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don
translated: Therefore, even those that apprehend the mind of another, i.e., the knowledge of the mind of another, are valid cognitions in regard to the specific object.

original: yin na de la yang logs shig tu tshad ma nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yin na de la yang logs shig tu tshad ma nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If the object to be established is the specific moment, then it should be understood that the valid cognition is also specific.

original: gal te skad cig ma'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don du 'dod pa la grub pa dang bde ba du ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don du 'dod pa la grub pa dang bde ba du ma yin na /
translated: If the object to be established is the specific moment, then there is no establishment and no happiness.

original: 'o na gzhan gang la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan gang la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is the establishment and happiness of another?

original: 'bras bu thun mong ba la ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu thun mong ba la ni //
translated: In regard to the common result,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: gang gi tshe skad cig ma thams cad kyi 'bras bu thun mong yin par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skad cig ma thams cad kyi 'bras bu thun mong yin par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is asserted that the result of all moments is common,

original: de dag gi mthu tha dad par med de /
analyzed: de dag gi mthu tha dad par med de /
translated: then their power is not specific.

original: de'i tshe tshad ma nyid kyang tha dad par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshad ma nyid kyang tha dad par mi 'dod do //
translated: At that time, the valid cognitions are not asserted to be different.

original: dper na gang la mnyam pa la me tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don la du ba gzhan dang gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na gang la mnyam pa la me tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don la du ba gzhan dang gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, in the case of establishing the mere existence of fire by any smoke, it is said that by other and other smokes.

original: gang gi tshe du ba gzhan dang gzhan gyis me nye bar 'jal bar byed pa'i tshe me tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don brjod par 'dod pa la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe du ba gzhan dang gzhan gyis me nye bar 'jal bar byed pa'i tshe me tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don brjod par 'dod pa la /
translated: When other and other smokes are used to infer the mere existence of fire, the mere existence of fire is the object to be established.

original: ji ltar du ba rnams tshad ma nyid tha dad par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar du ba rnams tshad ma nyid tha dad par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the valid cognitions are not asserted to be different, it should be understood in the same way here.

original: gang gi tshe tsha ba lngas gdung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe ni du ba lnga char yang tshad ma nyid tha dad pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tsha ba lngas gdung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe ni du ba lnga char yang tshad ma nyid tha dad pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: When the five hot ones are used to burn, it should be understood that all five smokes are different valid cognitions.

original: gzhan dang gzhan ni gzhan dang gzhan no //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan ni gzhan dang gzhan no //
translated: Other and other are other and other.

original: de dag ni gzhan dang gzhan yang yin la du ba yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar la /
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan dang gzhan yang yin la du ba yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar la /
translated: They are other and other, and they are also smoke. The words are combined in this way.

original: du ba gzhan dang gzhan dag gis gzhal ba zhes bsdu'o //
analyzed: du ba gzhan dang gzhan dag gis gzhal ba zhes bsdu'o //
translated: and by other and other smokes, it is measured.

original: de dag ni nye ba yang yin la me yang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar zhing /
analyzed: de dag ni nye ba yang yin la me yang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar zhing /
translated: They are near and they are fire.

original: de dag gis du ba gzhan dang gzhan gyis gzhal ba yang yin la me nye ba yang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gis du ba gzhan dang gzhan gyis gzhal ba yang yin la me nye ba yang yin zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: By them, other and other smokes are measured, and fire is near.

original: de tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don ni mar @112b me sbar ba dang / me sbar ba dang / rab tu gdung ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //üîΩde ltar phyogs kyi chos la rnam par rtog pa tshad ma'i rjes su byung ba logs shig tu tshad ma nyid yin pa bsal nas gzhan la yang bsgre bar bya ba'i phyir 'dis ni chos dang chos can dang rtags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya
analyzed: de tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don ni mar @112b me sbar ba dang / me sbar ba dang / rab tu gdung ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o // de ltar phyogs kyi chos la rnam par rtog pa tshad ma'i rjes su byung ba logs shig tu tshad ma nyid yin pa bsal nas gzhan la yang bsgre bar bya ba'i phyir 'dis ni chos dang chos can dang rtags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya
translated: The object to be established by that much is such things as the burning of the wick, the burning of the fire, and the intense heat.

original: ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, having eliminated the conception of the property of the subject as a separate valid cognition that arises after the valid cognition, in order to extend this to other cases, he says, ‚ÄúThe conception of the property of the subject, the reason, and so on,‚Äù and so forth.

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma nyid yin pa gsal ba'i dpe kho nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang / chos can phyogs la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang / rtags du ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa tshad ma'i stobs las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma nyid yin pa bsal bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma nyid yin pa gsal ba'i dpe kho nas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang / chos can phyogs la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang / rtags du ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa tshad ma'i stobs las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma nyid yin pa bsal bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The example of the lamp clearly proves that the conceptual consciousness that apprehends the property of the subject is a valid knowledge. The conceptual consciousness that apprehends the property to be proven, such as fire, the subject, such as the smoky pass, and the reason, such as smoke, which arise from the power of valid knowledge are also valid knowledge.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pa ni sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba'i stobs kyis skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang tshad ma nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pa ni sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba'i stobs kyis skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang tshad ma nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is stated because it is clear that the conceptual consciousness that arises from the power of seeing blue and so on is also valid knowledge.

original: re zhig phyogs tsam zhig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs tsam zhig brjod par bya ste /
translated: We will now state only a brief summary.

original: mngon sum ni mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo tsam mthun par byed pa na skye la /
analyzed: mngon sum ni mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo tsam mthun par byed pa na skye la /
translated: Direct perception arises in relation to an object that is present in front of one, merely in accordance with its nature.

original: dngos po de ni dngos su na yod pa'i ngo bos sngon po'i ngo bo gcig pu dang de las gzhan pa'i dngos po mtha' dag las log pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: dngos po de ni dngos su na yod pa'i ngo bos sngon po'i ngo bo gcig pu dang de las gzhan pa'i dngos po mtha' dag las log pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin no //
translated: That entity is, in reality, the entity that is blue, which is a single nature, and the nature that is the opposite of all entities that are other than that.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po de yod pa'i ngo bos sngon po yin pa de'i phyir 'dir sngon po snang ba mngon sum las ma skyes pa'i phyir mi gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po de yod pa'i ngo bos sngon po yin pa de'i phyir 'dir sngon po snang ba mngon sum las ma skyes pa'i phyir mi gsal ba yin te /
translated: Because that entity is blue by virtue of its existent nature, therefore, in this case, the appearance of blue is not generated from direct perception, and therefore it is unclear.

original: sngar mthong bas 'phangs pa'i phyir sngon po snang ba ma bor na 'di ni sngon po'o snyam pa yod pa'i ngo bo la reg pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sngar mthong bas 'phangs pa'i phyir sngon po snang ba ma bor na 'di ni sngon po'o snyam pa yod pa'i ngo bo la reg pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Because it is projected by what was seen previously, when the appearance of blue is not lost, there is the conceptual thought that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is blue.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir sngon po de dngos po ma lus pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa de kho na'i phyir ser po la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon po de dngos po ma lus pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa de kho na'i phyir ser po la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because that blue is not in accord with the character of all entities without exception, therefore it is not yellow, etc.

original: snyam pa ser po la sogs pa sel bar byed pa dgag pa'i shes pa gnyis pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyam pa ser po la sogs pa sel bar byed pa dgag pa'i shes pa gnyis pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The second cognition that is a negation, which is the exclusion of yellow, etc., is generated.

original: de lta bas na mngon sum sngon po la 'jug pa na re zhig de'i rnam par skye bas bdag nyid kyi sngon po de rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon sum sngon po la 'jug pa na re zhig de'i rnam par skye bas bdag nyid kyi sngon po de rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when a perception engages blue, it first generates an image of blue, and thereby it realizes blue itself.

original: sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur 'gyur bar yongs su gcod cing ser po la sogs pa dgag pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur bar rnam par gcod par byed do //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur 'gyur bar yongs su gcod cing ser po la sogs pa dgag pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur bar rnam par gcod par byed do //
translated: It determines that the image is the cause of the conception of blue, and it excludes the possibility that it is the cause of the exclusion of yellow, etc.

original: de la mngon sum dngos po'i stobs kyis skye ba ni dngos po la rag lus pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mngon sum dngos po'i stobs kyis skye ba ni dngos po la rag lus pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: Since the arising of a perception through the power of an object is dependent on the object, it is a valid cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gnyis ni mngon sum gyi stobs las skyes pa'i phyir mi slu ba yin yang /üîΩdon ma rtogs pa @113a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gnyis ni mngon sum gyi stobs las skyes pa'i phyir mi slu ba yin yang / don ma rtogs pa @113a * //
translated: Although the other two conceptions arise through the power of perception, they are nondeceptive.üîΩHowever, since they do not realize an unrealized object,

original: rtogs pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid logs shig na med de /
analyzed: rtogs pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid logs shig na med de /
translated: they are not separate valid cognitions.

original: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way for other objects.

original: de ltar na gtan tshigs gsum char gyi phyogs la chos kyi nges pa yang tshul 'dra'o zhes khyad par med par bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar na gtan tshigs gsum char gyi phyogs la chos kyi nges pa yang tshul 'dra'o zhes khyad par med par bshad do //
translated: Thus, the certainty of the property in the case of all three reasons is the same, and there is no difference.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa'i thabs tha dad pa'i bye brag gis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa'i thabs tha dad pa'i bye brag gis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the difference in the means of ascertaining the pervasion and the counter pervasion,

original: rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe ascertainment of the pervasion is also . . . .‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni dngos su na sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni dngos su na sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo yin no //
translated: The property to be established is the nature of the proving property.

original: de lta bas na sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel bar grub pa gang yin pa de nyid rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa
analyzed: de lta bas na sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel bar grub pa gang yin pa de nyid rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa
translated: Therefore, because it is the nature of the proving property, the property to be established is established as merely related to the nature of the proving property. That is the ascertainment of the pervasion in the case of a reason based on the nature of things.

original: yin no // dngos su na zhes bya ba ni don dam par te /
analyzed: yin no // dngos su na zhes bya ba ni don dam par te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn reality‚Äù means ultimately.

original: sgra'i don gyi sgo nas ni tha dad pa kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i don gyi sgo nas ni tha dad pa kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is different.

original: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: In regard to the statement ‚Äúthe nature of that,‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sgrub pa'i chos dang sbyar ro //üîΩgang la de'i ngo bo yod pa de ni de'i ngo bo can no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sgrub pa'i chos dang sbyar ro // gang la de'i ngo bo yod pa de ni de'i ngo bo can no //
translated: the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected with the property to be established.üîΩThat which has the nature of that is ‚Äúhaving the nature of that.‚Äù

original: de'i ngo bo can gyi ngo bo ni de'i ngo bo can nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo can gyi ngo bo ni de'i ngo bo can nyid do //
translated: The nature of that which has the nature of that is ‚Äúhaving the nature of that.‚Äù

original: yang na de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang sbyar te /üîΩsgrub pa'i chos 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de'i ngo bo ste bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang sbyar te / sgrub pa'i chos 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de'i ngo bo ste bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected with the property to be established.üîΩThis property to be established is the nature of that property to be established.

original: sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo ni bsgrub pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo ni bsgrub pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam yin no //
translated: The nature of the property to be established is merely the nature of the property to be established.

original: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos po gzhan la ltos pa bsal to //
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos po gzhan la ltos pa bsal to //
translated: The word ‚Äúmerely‚Äù excludes reliance on other things.

original: mthun par 'brel pa ni rjes su 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: mthun par 'brel pa ni rjes su 'brel pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúConcomitant‚Äù means ‚Äúrelated.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúpervading.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The property to be established is merely related.

original: de grub pa la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de grub pa la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: This is what is said when it is established.

original: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos gnyis dngos su gcig yin kyang ldog pa'i bye brag gis bye brag yod pas de dag rjod par byed pa'i sgra gnyis kyang rnam grangs ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos gnyis dngos su gcig yin kyang ldog pa'i bye brag gis bye brag yod pas de dag rjod par byed pa'i sgra gnyis kyang rnam grangs ma yin la /
translated: Here, the two things to be established and the establishing property are actually the same, but because of the difference in their aspects, there is a difference. Therefore, the two words that express them are not synonyms.

original: dam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig gis kyang gtan tshigs ma yin no //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i phyogs gcig gis kyang gtan tshigs ma yin no //
translated: And even one part of the thesis is not the reason.

original: rang gi ngo bo rab tu bstan pa'i thabs kyi 'brel pa grub pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rab tu bstan pa'i thabs kyi 'brel pa grub pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the connection, the cause of establishing the method of teaching one's own nature,

original: de ni bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, That is the opposite of the probandum, and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The opposite of the probandum is the dissimilar instance.

original: de la gtan tshigs kyi gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gang yin pa de 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni sgrub pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa @113b grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs kyi gnod pa can gyi tshad ma gang yin pa de 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni sgrub pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa @113b grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The valid cognition that harms the reason there, that engagement, is called the establishment of the mere connection with the nature of the property to be established.

original: rjes su 'brel pa grub pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa yin te zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa grub pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa yin te zhes bshad do //
translated: The establishment of the relation of invariable concomitance is the result of the operation of the sublating cognition; hence it is said that the sublating cognition operates.

original: 'dir tshul gyi rjes su 'brel pa grub pa'i rgyu 'di yin par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir tshul gyi rjes su 'brel pa grub pa'i rgyu 'di yin par bstan te /
translated: Here, this is the cause of the establishment of the relation of invariable concomitance:

original: 'di ltar gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam dang 'brel pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam dang 'brel pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: Thus, by the operation of the sublating cognition, one establishes the relation of the mere nature of the property to be established to the property that establishes it.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa de nyid bstan par bzhed nas gang yod pa de ni skad cig ma kho na yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa de nyid bstan par bzhed nas gang yod pa de ni skad cig ma kho na yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Wishing to teach just that operation of the sublating cognition, he says, ‚ÄúWhatever exists is momentary, etc.‚Äù

original: gang cung zad yod pa de thams cad skad cig ma kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang cung zad yod pa de thams cad skad cig ma kho na yin no //
translated: Whatever exists in the least is momentary.

original: yod pa la ni skad cig ma nyid ma gtogs pa rnam pa gzhan ci yang med do //
analyzed: yod pa la ni skad cig ma nyid ma gtogs pa rnam pa gzhan ci yang med do //
translated: For existence, there is no other form than momentariness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skad cig ma nyid ma yin na don byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid ma yin na don byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it were not momentary, it would be contradictory for it to perform a function.

original: gang zhig skad cig ma ma yin pa de ni rim dang cig car dag gi don byed par mi 'thad de ni 'og nas ston par byed do //
analyzed: gang zhig skad cig ma ma yin pa de ni rim dang cig car dag gi don byed par mi 'thad de ni 'og nas ston par byed do //
translated: Whatever is not momentary is not tenable to perform a function either gradually or instantaneously. This will be shown below.

original: yod pa ni don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid can du 'dod na /
analyzed: yod pa ni don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid can du 'dod na /
translated: If one asserts that existence has the characteristic of being able to perform a function,

original: gal te skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams la don byed nus pa med na de dag ga las yod de /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams la don byed nus pa med na de dag ga las yod de /
translated: if non-momentary things are not able to perform a function, how could they exist?

original: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: This is a valid refutation that undermines the discordant position.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the ascertainment of the forward pervasion of a reason based on nature,

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to teach the effect reason, he says, ‚ÄúThe effect reason is ascertained by the establishment of the nature of cause and effect.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of the nature of cause and effect is the ascertainment of the forward pervasion of an effect reason.

original: 'dir yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa yin te zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa yin te zhes bshad do //
translated: Here, the ascertainment of the forward mode of the effect reason is based on the reason that establishes the nature of cause and effect. Therefore, it is explained that the nature of cause and effect is established.

original: de 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu la khyab pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu la khyab pa grub pa'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of cause and effect is established and the pervasion of cause and effect is established.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyang ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyang ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: How is the nature of cause and effect established?

original: 'di lta ste 'di dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúWhen this is observed, etc.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa sngon mi dmigs pa rgyu dmigs na dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa sngon mi dmigs pa rgyu dmigs na dmigs pa yin no //
translated: When the cause is observed, the effect is observed, because the effect is observed as the object of observation, but was not observed previously.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan dag kyang yod par mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med na med do //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan dag kyang yod par mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu med na med do //
translated: Other co-operating causes are also accepted as being manifest. Without a cause, there is no effect.

original: de'i phyir rgyu yod na ni 'bras bu yod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu yod na ni 'bras bu yod la /
translated: Therefore, when there is a cause, there is an effect.

original: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu med pa gang yin pa mngon sum dang mi @114a * //
analyzed: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu med pa gang yin pa mngon sum dang mi @114a * //
translated: When there is no cause, there is no effect. This is directly perceived and is not non-existent.

original: dmigs pa dag gis sgrub par byed pa de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo zhes bya ste //
analyzed: dmigs pa dag gis sgrub par byed pa de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo zhes bya ste //
translated: That which is established by the means of valid knowledge is called the nature of cause and effect.

original: grub pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang nges pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: grub pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang nges pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Accomplishment is the conformity and certainty.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa'i tshig yin no //üîΩ'di zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa'i tshig yin no // 'di zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu bstan to //
translated: Thus is a term that introduces an example.üîΩ By this, he shows the cause.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
translated: By this, he shows the effect.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ni 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa ni 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: The object of perception will be explained later.

original: de yod na ni yod ces bya ba 'dir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yod na ni yod ces bya ba 'dir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu dang sbyar ro //
translated: When this exists, this exists - the word this is connected with the cause.

original: gang la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i sgrub pa yod pa de ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i sgrub pa can no //
analyzed: gang la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i sgrub pa yod pa de ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i sgrub pa can no //
translated: That which has the means of valid knowledge of perception and non-perception is one who has the means of valid knowledge of perception and non-perception.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: Cause and effect are cause and effect.

original: de gnyis kyi dngos po ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi dngos po ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature of those two is the nature of cause and effect.

original: rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the nature of cause and effect.

original: gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa ni 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa ni 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: The effect is that which is dependent on the activity of another.

original: mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la de bskyed par rung ba'i bdag nyid kyis gdon mi za bar nye bar gnas pa ni rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la de bskyed par rung ba'i bdag nyid kyis gdon mi za bar nye bar gnas pa ni rgyu nyid do //
translated: The cause is that which, by its very nature, is fit to generate the effect that arises immediately after it, and it necessarily remains in the presence of the effect.

original: yang ci'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin par brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin par brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said that the ascertainment of the pervasion of the effect is based on the establishment of the nature of the cause and effect?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni //
translated: The nature of cause and effect

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gi phyir gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod ces bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa de rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo don tha dad pa yod na ni yod la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi phyir gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod ces bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa de rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo don tha dad pa yod na ni yod la /
translated: and so on.

original: med na ni med pa de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: med na ni med pa de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin par brjod do //
translated: Because wherever there is smoke, there is fire, the pervasion is that the nature of cause and effect exists when the objects are different, and it does not exist when they are not different. Therefore, the ascertainment of the pervasion is based on the establishment of the nature of cause and effect.

original: 'di skad du 'di gnyis dngos su tha dad mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'di gnyis dngos su tha dad mod kyi /
translated: This is what is said: Although these two are actually different,

original: 'on kyang thabs gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir thabs dang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba tha mi dad par bstan te /
analyzed: 'on kyang thabs gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir thabs dang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba tha mi dad par bstan te /
translated: But since it is not to be accomplished by any other means, it is taught that the means and the object to be accomplished are not different.

original: tha mi dad pa'i thabs kyis 'di rjes su 'gro ba nges pa'i thabs nyid du bstan to zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i thabs kyis 'di rjes su 'gro ba nges pa'i thabs nyid du bstan to zhes bshad do //
translated: The means is taught to be the means of ascertaining the pervasion because it is not different from the object to be accomplished.

original: ci'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni don tha dad pa kho na yod na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni don tha dad pa kho na yod na /
translated: Why is the nature of cause and effect only a different object?

original: gang na du ba yod pa de na gdon mi za bar me yod do zhes bya ba'i khyab pa 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang na du ba yod pa de na gdon mi za bar me yod do zhes bya ba'i khyab pa 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that this pervasion occurs, that where there is smoke there is definitely fire?

original: de'i phyir / me yod na yod pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / me yod na yod pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúwhere there is fire, it exists,‚Äù and so on.

original: du ba ni me'i 'bras bu nyid yin pas de skad ces bshad do //
analyzed: du ba ni me'i 'bras bu nyid yin pas de skad ces bshad do //
translated: Since smoke is the effect of fire, it is explained in that way.

original: 'di ltar me yod na yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar me yod na yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, where there is fire, it exists.

original: gang gi tshe me yod na du ba yod pa nyid kyi phyir me'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe me yod na du ba yod pa nyid kyi phyir me'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When there is fire, smoke exists, and because of that, smoke is accepted as the effect of fire.

original: gang na du ba yod pa de na gdon mi za bar me yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang na du ba yod pa de na gdon mi za bar me yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Where there is smoke, there is fire.

original: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes @114b su 'gro ba nges par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes @114b su 'gro ba nges par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the pervasion of the effect reason is taught.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the pervasion of non-apprehension, he says:

original: mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ascertainment of the pervasion of non-apprehension is also like this.

original: gang gi tshe med pa'i tha snyad ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyi rgyu can du sgrub pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba rjes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe med pa'i tha snyad ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyi rgyu can du sgrub pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba rjes pa yin no //
translated: When the convention of non-existence is established as having the mere non-apprehension of what is suitable to appear as its cause, then the pervasion of non-apprehension is ascertained.

original: mi dmigs pa tsam la 'jug pa ni mi dmigs pa tsam 'jug pa'o //üîΩji ltar na med pa'i tha snyad dmigs ba smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam la 'jug pa ni mi dmigs pa tsam 'jug pa'o // ji ltar na med pa'i tha snyad dmigs ba smos te /
translated: The engagement of mere non-apprehension is the engagement of mere non-apprehension.üîΩHow is the convention of non-existence engaged?

original: gang gi tshe med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan zhe na /
translated: When the reason for the convention of non-existence is asked,

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan med par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan med par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, because another reason is not seen.

original: gang gi tshe med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan bkag par gyur pa de'i tshe de ni de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can du rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan bkag par gyur pa de'i tshe de ni de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can du rnam par gnas so //
translated: When the reason for the term non-existence is refuted, then it is established as having just that as its reason.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan dgag pa ni brtsad pa'i rigs pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan dgag pa ni brtsad pa'i rigs pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The refutation of other reasons should be understood from the logic of debate.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs gsum char rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs gsum char rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the ascertainment of the forward pervasion for all three types of reasons,

original: ldog pa nges pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ldog pa nges pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the ascertainment of the counter pervasion,

original: ldog pa nges pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub la /
analyzed: ldog pa nges pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub la /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe ascertainment of the counter pervasion is also like that,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe effect reason establishes the nature of cause and effect.üîΩThe nature reason establishes the nature of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo grub na gang gi tshe yul ba ltar rung ba rgyu mi dmigs pa dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par bsgrub
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo grub na gang gi tshe yul ba ltar rung ba rgyu mi dmigs pa dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par bsgrub
translated: When the object is suitable to be the reason, the non-observation of the cause and the non-observation of the pervader establish the absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum.

original: pa yin pa de'i tshe 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag gi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin pa de'i tshe 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag gi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the pervasion of the effect and nature reasons is ascertained.

original: 'dis gnyis ni yul bltar rung ba yin pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dis gnyis ni yul bltar rung ba yin pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: Here, the two are connected by the phrase ‚Äúbecause the object is suitable to be seen.‚Äù

original: bltar 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bltar 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is suitable to be seen is that which has become the observed object.

original: 'di skad du gang gi tshe rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par sgrub par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi tshe rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par sgrub par byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is saying that when the cause and the pervader have become the observed object, then the absence of the probandum is established as the absence of the reason.

original: mi dmigs pa yul bltar rung ba nyid la ltos pa gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yul bltar rung ba nyid la ltos pa gang las yin zhe na /
translated: From what is the non-observation that relies on the object being suitable to be seen?

original: de'i phyir / yul bstan pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / yul bstan pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it says ‚Äúthat which has a demonstrated object‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe yul 'ga' zhig nye bar bstan nas 'di na med do zhes med pa sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa yul bltar rung ba nyid la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yul 'ga' zhig nye bar bstan nas 'di na med do zhes med pa sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa yul bltar rung ba nyid la ltos pa yin no //
translated: When an object is demonstrated and it is established that it does not exist, that is, that it is absent, saying ‚ÄúIt is not here,‚Äù then the non-observation relies on the object being suitable to be seen.

original: gang la yul bstan pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: gang la yul bstan pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which has an object-field that is shown‚Äù is to beüîΩanalyzed as follows.

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Shown‚Äù means ‚Äúmade known.‚Äù

original: yul zhes bya ba ni gang du med pa @115a * //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba ni gang du med pa @115a * //
translated: ‚Äú Object-field‚Äù means ‚Äúthat in which something does not exist.‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú To establish‚Äù means ‚Äúto prove.‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir yul bltar rung ba nyid la ltos she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir yul bltar rung ba nyid la ltos she na /
translated: Why is it necessary to rely on the object-field being visible?üîΩTo answer this, the root text states, ‚ÄúOtherwise, it would not be possible to

original: de'i phyir / de lta ma yin na dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de lta ma yin na dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: establish the nonexistence of something that is not an object of knowledge.‚Äù

original: gang zhig dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa de gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa de gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is not an object of knowledge is something that is other.üîΩTo demonstrate that this is the case, the root text states, ‚Äúbecause it is not

original: de bzhin du gyur pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir gang du yang med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gyur pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir gang du yang med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: possible to establish the nonexistence of something that is not an object-field.‚ÄùüîΩIt would not be possible to establish the nonexistence of something that is

original: dngos po dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa gang du yang med par mi 'grub par yang 'gyur ro //üîΩrnam pa gcig tu na /
analyzed: dngos po dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa gang du yang med par mi 'grub par yang 'gyur ro // rnam pa gcig tu na /
translated: not an object of knowledge.üîΩIn another way,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te khyad par du mi bya na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te khyad par du mi bya na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means ‚Äúif it is not specified.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na 'di ltar dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa ni gang du yang med par mi 'grub par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya bar blta ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ltar dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa ni gang du yang med par mi 'grub par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya bar blta ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be seen that ‚Äúthat which is not an object of perception is not established as nonexistent.‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir mi dmigs pa yul bltar rung ba nyid la ltos pa yul bstan pa can med pa rab tu ston pa kho na las yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mi dmigs pa yul bltar rung ba nyid la ltos pa yul bstan pa can med pa rab tu ston pa kho na las yin zhe na /
translated: Again, why is non-apprehension, which is dependent on the mere possibility of perception, only taught as the absence of a demonstrable object?

original: de'i phyir yul ma bstan pa can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul ma bstan pa can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe non-demonstrable object . . . ‚Äù

original: gang du yul nye bar ma bstan par bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par ston pa der ni gang gi phyir 'brel pa tsam zhig grub pas bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med pa 'grub pa de'i phyir de la ni ldog pa bsgrub
analyzed: gang du yul nye bar ma bstan par bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par ston pa der ni gang gi phyir 'brel pa tsam zhig grub pas bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med pa 'grub pa de'i phyir de la ni ldog pa bsgrub
translated: In the case of a proof where the object is not demonstrated, the absence of the reason is taught in the absence of the probandum. In that case, because the mere relation is established, the absence of the reason is established in the absence of the probandum. Therefore, in that case, the counter-pervasion

original: par bya ba la mi dmigs pa yul bltar rung ba nyid la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: par bya ba la mi dmigs pa yul bltar rung ba nyid la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: is established. Non-apprehension, which is dependent on the mere possibility of perception, is not established.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo ni 'dir 'brel pa'i sgrar bshad de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo ni 'dir 'brel pa'i sgrar bshad de /
translated: Here, the relation is explained as the nature of cause and effect, and the nature of the pervaded and pervader.

original: de yang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma la rag las pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma la rag las pa yin no //
translated: And that is dependent on the valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: de'i phyir gang gis na de nyid gcig la gcig brten pa nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag gcig la gcig rag las pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis na de nyid gcig la gcig brten pa nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag gcig la gcig rag las pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of positive and negative concomitance is not mutually dependent, since they are mutually dependent, that would be a fault.

original: de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag gi ldog pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag gi ldog pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the ascertainment of the effect and nature,

original: mi dmigs pa'i ldog pa nges pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i ldog pa nges pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the ascertainment of the absence of the object of non-apprehension is stated by ‚Äúthe ascertainment of the absence of the object of non-apprehension,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po gang zhig yod pa yin la /üîΩde gal te dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yin na gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig yod pa yin la / de gal te dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa yin na gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If an existent thingüîΩis an object of apprehension, then without a doubt it would be apprehended.

original: de ltar na gang gi tshe me dmigs pa med par bstan pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i ldog pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi tshe me dmigs pa med par bstan pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i ldog pa nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the absence of the apprehension of fire is taught, at that time there is the ascertainment of the absence of the object of non-apprehension.

original: re zhig de lta bu ni chos kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de lta bu ni chos kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the ascertainment of the concomitance and the reverse concomitance of the property of the subject.

original: gtan tshigs gsum nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsum nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that there are only three kinds of logical mark,

original: mtshan nyid de lta bu can zhes bya ba la sogs pa @115b smos so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de lta bu can zhes bya ba la sogs pa @115b smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúthat which has such and such a characteristic,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe property of the subject that is pervaded by a part of that is called the logical mark.

original: phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid 'di dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa gsum kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid 'di dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa gsum kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The logical mark that is explained as having this characteristic should be seen as being of only three kinds.

original: gang la mtshan nyid de lta bu yod pa de ni mtshan nyid de lta bu can no //
analyzed: gang la mtshan nyid de lta bu yod pa de ni mtshan nyid de lta bu can no //
translated: That which has such and such a characteristic is that which has that characteristic.

original: rnam pa gsum po bye brag tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po bye brag tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the three kinds individually,

original: rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúnature,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang rang gi ming gis gtan tshigs gsum ston par byed do //
analyzed: rang rang gi ming gis gtan tshigs gsum ston par byed do //
translated: Each of the three logical marks is taught by its own name.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù has the meaning of inclusion.

original: yin te zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par rjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yin te zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par rjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word namely indicates that the following is a complete statement.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate an example of a natural reason,

original: dper na 'ga' zhig mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa de lta bu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa de lta bu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: [Dharmakƒ´rti] says, For example, in the proof of something as impermanent, like that which exists.

original: 'ga' zhig mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: A reason characterized by existence in the probandum is a natural reason in the proof of something as impermanent.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dpe me dang ldan pa'i phyogs la du ba lta bu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dpe me dang ldan pa'i phyogs la du ba lta bu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate an example of a resultant reason, [Dharmakƒ´rti] says, For example, in the proof of a place as possessing fire, smoke.

original: phyogs 'ga' zhig me dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba la du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' zhig me dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba la du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: A reason characterized by smoke is a resultant reason in the proof of a place as possessing fire.

original: mi dmigs pa'i dpe med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i dpe med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate an example of a non-observation [reason], [Dharmakƒ´rti] says, For example, in the proof of the absence of a vase on a place that is visible and free of obstruction.

original: dngos po 'ga' zhig med par bsgrub par bya ba la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa ni gtan tshigs gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' zhig med par bsgrub par bya ba la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa ni gtan tshigs gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third reason is the non-apprehension of an object that is perceptible, in order to prove the non-existence of some entity.

original: yang ci'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum kho na yin zhe na /
translated: Again, why are there only three kinds of reasons?

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di kho nar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di kho nar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúOnly these three kinds,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs gsum po nye bar bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag kho na med na mi 'byung bar nges pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs ni rnam pa gsum po na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs gsum po nye bar bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag kho na med na mi 'byung bar nges pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs ni rnam pa gsum po na yin no //
translated: Because only these three kinds of reasons are ascertained as being invariably concomitant, therefore there are only three kinds of reasons.

original: yang med na mi 'byung ba 'di ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: yang med na mi 'byung ba 'di ni ci zhig yin /
translated: Again, what is this invariable concomitance?

original: de ni ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar nges she na /
translated: How is it ascertained?

original: de'i phyir / phyogs kyi chos kyi khyab pa ji skad du bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / phyogs kyi chos kyi khyab pa ji skad du bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúThe pervasion of the property of the position, as it has been explained,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la khyab par byed pa po yod pa kho na 'am /
analyzed: de la khyab par byed pa po yod pa kho na 'am /
translated: Therein, the pervader exists, or

original: de la khyab par bya ba yod pa kho na zhes bya bar khyab pa nye bar bstan pa gang yin pa phyogs kyi chos la khyab pa ji skad du bshad pa de ni med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la khyab par bya ba yod pa kho na zhes bya bar khyab pa nye bar bstan pa gang yin pa phyogs kyi chos la khyab pa ji skad du bshad pa de ni med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The pervasion that is taught in the statement ‚Äúonly where there is the pervaded‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe invariable concomitance‚Äù of the property of the subject, as it was explained above.

original: med na mi 'byung ba de yang gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum ma gtogs pa gzhan na med pas 'di nyid du nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba de yang gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum ma gtogs pa gzhan na med pas 'di nyid du nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that invariable concomitance does not exist apart from the three kinds of reasons, it is called ‚Äúthe ascertainment of the three kinds of reasons.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the definition of the reason of nature, [Dharmakƒ´rti] says,

original: de la sgrub pa'i chos kyi ngo bo @116a * //üîΩtsam dang ldan pa can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i chos kyi ngo bo @116a * // tsam dang ldan pa can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which possesses the mere nature of the property to be established . . .‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gang zhig gdon mi za ba sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang ldan pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de lta bu de la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gang zhig gdon mi za ba sgrub pa'i chos tsam dang ldan pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de lta bu de la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The property to be established is the property that is to be proven. That which possesses the mere property to be established, without fail, is the property to be established. Such a property to be established is called ‚Äúthe reason of nature.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa'i chos kho na bsgrub pa'i chos tsam yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos kho na bsgrub pa'i chos tsam yin te /
translated: The property to be established is the mere property to be established.

original: 'di la de dang ldan pa'i ngang tshul yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la de dang ldan pa'i ngang tshul yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The compound ‚Äúhaving that nature‚Äù is to be analyzed as ‚Äúhaving that as its nature.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin ni bdag nyid dang rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni bdag nyid dang rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Nature is synonymous with essence and intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin nyid gtan tshigs yin pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid gtan tshigs yin pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The compound ‚Äúhaving that as its nature‚Äù is to be analyzed as ‚Äúhaving that as its nature.‚Äù

original: gang gi rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: thos pa'i phyir dang nye ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud do //
analyzed: thos pa'i phyir dang nye ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud do //
translated: It is the nature of the property to be established, because it is heard and because it is proximate.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag sel ba'i bye brag gis tha dad pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag sel ba'i bye brag gis tha dad pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt the property to be established and the proof different, because they are mutually exclusive?

original: de ji ltar na gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How can the reason be the nature of the property to be established?

original: de'i phyir / dngos su na gtan tshigs ni rtags can gyi rang bzhin kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dngos su na gtan tshigs ni rtags can gyi rang bzhin kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIn reality, the reason is the nature of the sign only.‚Äù

original: phan tshun ldog pa'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos dag tha dad pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: phan tshun ldog pa'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos dag tha dad pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the property to be established and the proving property are different, due to their mutual exclusion.

original: 'on kyang don dam par na gtan tshigs ni rtags can gyi rang bzhin kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang don dam par na gtan tshigs ni rtags can gyi rang bzhin kho na yin te /
translated: However, in the ultimate sense, the reason is only the nature of the property possessor.

original: 'di ltar rkyen la rag las te skye ba'i phyir byas pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid 'jig pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rkyen la rag las te skye ba'i phyir byas pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid 'jig pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'dod do //
translated: Thus, because it arises in dependence on conditions, what is called ‚Äúproduced‚Äù is accepted as impermanent because it is perishable.

original: de lta ma yin na byas pa yang gzhan la mi rtag pa yang gzhan du 'gyur te /üîΩde lta na sgra ni byas pa ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na byas pa yang gzhan la mi rtag pa yang gzhan du 'gyur te / de lta na sgra ni byas pa ste /
translated: If it were not so, then production would be one thing and impermanence would be another.

original: mi rtag pa'o zhes gcig tu nye bar bsdu bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'o zhes gcig tu nye bar bsdu bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would not be possible to summarize ‚Äúsound is produced‚Äù and ‚Äúsound is impermanent‚Äù as one.

original: gang gi tshe gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin par brjod pa de'i tshe gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gtan tshigs dang rjes su 'brel pa can du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin par brjod pa de'i tshe gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gtan tshigs dang rjes su 'brel pa can du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: When the reason is said to be the nature of the property to be established, at that time, is it not the case that the property to be established must be connected to the reason?

original: de la ci'i phyir de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di byed ce na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa can zhes bya ba'i khyad par 'di byed ce na /
translated: Why is this distinction, ‚Äúmerely related to the probandum,‚Äù made?

original: rang bzhin la rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa med pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgtan tshigs bsgrub par bya pa'i rang bzhin yin par khas blangs na bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa med mod kyi 'on kyang mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba la gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas bsgrub pa'i chos tsam dang 'brel pa can zhes bya
analyzed: rang bzhin la rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa med pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya pa'i rang bzhin yin par khas blangs na bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa med mod kyi 'on kyang mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba la gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas bsgrub pa'i chos tsam dang 'brel pa can zhes bya
translated: To respond, he says, ‚ÄúThere is also the unmistaken concomitance with the nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: ba'i khyad par 'di bya dgos pa nyid do //
analyzed: ba'i khyad par 'di bya dgos pa nyid do //
translated: If the reason is accepted as being the nature of the probandum, then there is indeed the unmistaken concomitance with the probandum. However, in order to state the definition, it is necessary to make this distinction, ‚Äúmerely related to the probandum,‚Äù in dependence on the other system.

original: gzhan gyi lugs de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that other system, he says,

original: @116b gzhan dag ni don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @116b gzhan dag ni don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúOthers say that the reason is a property of the subject,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan phyir rgol ba dag ni dngos po grub zin ba la don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan las chos gang skye ba de tsam dang 'brel pa can ma yin pa de yang rang bzhin du 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan phyir rgol ba dag ni dngos po grub zin ba la don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan las chos gang skye ba de tsam dang 'brel pa can ma yin pa de yang rang bzhin du 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because other opponents assert that whatever phenomenon arises from a reason that is a different object from an already established thing is not related to just that, and that is also asserted to be the essence.

original: khyad par gyi chos de lta bu rang bzhin nyid yin pa yang 'gog la /
analyzed: khyad par gyi chos de lta bu rang bzhin nyid yin pa yang 'gog la /
translated: Therefore, it refutes that such a specific attribute is the essence itself.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de la gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yang khyad par gyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de la gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yang khyad par gyis ston par byed do //
translated: Later, it also shows that the reason is mistaken with respect to the property of the thesis.

original: dngos po'i rang gi rgyu dag las don gzhan pa ni don gzhan te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi rgyu dag las don gzhan pa ni don gzhan te /
translated: A different object from the causes of a thing is a different object.

original: 'di la don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving a reason that is a different object‚Äù is a compound.

original: 'di de'i ngo bo tsam dang ldan pa'i ngang tshul yod pas de'i ngo bo tsam dang ldan pa can no //
analyzed: 'di de'i ngo bo tsam dang ldan pa'i ngang tshul yod pas de'i ngo bo tsam dang ldan pa can no //
translated: It has the nature of possessing just that essence, and thus it is one that possesses just that essence.

original: de dgag pa ni ngo bo tsam dang ldan pa ma yin pa can no //
analyzed: de dgag pa ni ngo bo tsam dang ldan pa ma yin pa can no //
translated: The negation of that is one that does not possess just that essence.

original: don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gtan tshigs 'khrul pa gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gtan tshigs 'khrul pa gang las yin zhe na /
translated: What is the error of the reason in regard to the property to be established, which is based on another meaning?

original: dper na 'jigs pa rgyu dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na 'jigs pa rgyu dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, it is said, ‚ÄúIn regard to that which possesses a cause of fear,‚Äù etc.

original: byas pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa la 'khrul pa yod de /
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan pa la 'khrul pa yod de /
translated: The reason, ‚Äúbecause of being produced,‚Äù is erroneous in regard to the property to be established, ‚Äúbecause of possessing a cause of destruction.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gal te 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par 'dod na de'i tshe 'ga' zhig mi 'jig par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par 'dod na de'i tshe 'ga' zhig mi 'jig par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: For, if one maintains that destruction possesses a cause, then it would follow that something would not be destroyed.

original: 'di ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, those that are dependent do not necessarily occur.

original: de'i phyir la la byas pa yang yin la mi rtag pa yang ma yin par 'gyur bas 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir la la byas pa yang yin la mi rtag pa yang ma yin par 'gyur bas 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is erroneous to say that something is produced and also not impermanent.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid brjod nas sbyor ba'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid brjod nas sbyor ba'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus stated the definition of a reason based on nature, in order to teach the varieties of application, he says,

original: de'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIts application is of two types.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de na rnam pa gnyis rab tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de na rnam pa gnyis rab tu sbyar ro //
translated: The natural reasoning is applied in two ways.

original: rnam pa gnyis po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the two ways, he says,

original: chos mthun pa can nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos mthun pa can nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äúthrough similarity of attributes‚Äù and so on.

original: res 'ga' ni chos mthun pa can nyid kyi sgo nas rab tu sbyor la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni chos mthun pa can nyid kyi sgo nas rab tu sbyor la /
translated: Sometimes it is applied through similarity of attributes,

original: res 'ga' ni chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and sometimes through dissimilarity of attributes.

original: 'di la chos mthun pa yod pas na 'di ni chos mthun pa can no //
analyzed: 'di la chos mthun pa yod pas na 'di ni chos mthun pa can no //
translated: That which has similarity of attributes is similar.

original: chos mthun pa can gyi ngo bo ni chos mthun pa can nyid do //üîΩ'di la chos mi mthun pa yod pas na 'di ni chos mi mthun pa can no //
analyzed: chos mthun pa can gyi ngo bo ni chos mthun pa can nyid do // 'di la chos mi mthun pa yod pas na 'di ni chos mi mthun pa can no //
translated: Similarity of attributes is the nature of similarity.üîΩThat which has dissimilarity of attributes is dissimilar.

original: chos mi mthun pa can gyi ngo bo ni chos mi mthun pa can nyid do //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa can gyi ngo bo ni chos mi mthun pa can nyid do //
translated: Dissimilarity of attributes is the nature of dissimilarity.

original: chos mthun pa can nyid kyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgang yod pa @117a * //
analyzed: chos mthun pa can nyid kyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir / gang yod pa @117a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate the application of similarity of attributes, he says,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äúwhere there is existence‚Äù and so on.

original: gang cung zad yod pa de thams cad ni skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: gang cung zad yod pa de thams cad ni skad cig ma ste /
translated: Whatever exists is momentary.üîΩFor example, like a pot, etc.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba bstan to //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the pervasion.

original: chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the application of the dissimilar reason,

original: de bzhin du skad cig ma nyid med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig ma nyid med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúSimilarly, if there is no momentariness,‚Äù etc.

original: gang zhig skad cig ma ma yin pa de ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig skad cig ma ma yin pa de ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: That which is not momentary does not exist.üîΩFor example, like space.

original: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni ldog pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the counter-pervasion.üîΩSound exists.

original: sgra ni yod pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos mi mthun pa can nyid las rnam par phye ba'i phyogs kyi chos nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: sgra ni yod pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos mi mthun pa can nyid las rnam par phye ba'i phyogs kyi chos nye bar bstan to //
translated: This shows the property of the position that distinguishes it from the dissimilar reason.

original: chos mthun pa can nyid dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyi sbyor ba dag gis khyab pa dag rab tu ston pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos mthun pa can nyid dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyi sbyor ba dag gis khyab pa dag rab tu ston pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the mode of teaching the pervasions by means of the applications of the similar and dissimilar reasons,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúFor example, like a pot, etc.‚Äù

original: thams cad nye bar bsdus nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad nye bar bsdus nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase having subsumed all things and so on.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pas dngos po thams cad nye bar bsdus te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pas dngos po thams cad nye bar bsdus te /
translated: Having subsumed all things by means of concomitance or the reverse,

original: chos mthun pa can nyid dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyi sbyor ba dag gis khyab pa rab tu ston gyi /
analyzed: chos mthun pa can nyid dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyi sbyor ba dag gis khyab pa rab tu ston gyi /
translated: he demonstrates pervasion by means of the application of the similar and the reverse.

original: ji ltar gzhan dag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yongs su spangs nas khyab pa gzhan rab tu ston pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yongs su spangs nas khyab pa gzhan rab tu ston pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: But he does not demonstrate pervasion in some other way, as do others, by abandoning the subject that is to be established.

original: thams cad smos pas ni khyab pa gzhan dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad smos pas ni khyab pa gzhan dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he mentions all things, he excludes other forms of pervasion.

original: khyab pa rab tu ston pa ni khyab pa rab tu ston pa ste /
analyzed: khyab pa rab tu ston pa ni khyab pa rab tu ston pa ste /
translated: Demonstration of pervasion means demonstration of pervasion.

original: gang dag la mtshan nyid de yod pa de dag ni khyab pa rab tu ston pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: gang dag la mtshan nyid de yod pa de dag ni khyab pa rab tu ston pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Those that have that characteristic are those that have the characteristic of demonstrating pervasion.

original: gang gi tshe thams cad nye bar bsdus nas khyab pa rab tu ston pa de'i tshe chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can yang rtogs pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe thams cad nye bar bsdus nas khyab pa rab tu ston pa de'i tshe chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can yang rtogs pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: When one comprehends the pervasion by subsuming everything, then at that time, does one not also understand the subject qualified by the property?

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni dran pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni dran pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, inference would be just memory.

original: bshad pa gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya bar spyir rtogs kyi khyab pa'i tshe sgra ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba 'di ni rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: bshad pa gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya bar spyir rtogs kyi khyab pa'i tshe sgra ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba 'di ni rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: We reply: When one understands in general that whatever is produced is impermanent, at that time one cannot understand that sound is impermanent when comprehending the pervasion.

original: de'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji ltar dran pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji ltar dran pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, how could inference be memory of the nature of the subject?

original: sbyor ba ston pa la goms pa'i phyir gang gis chos rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyang sbyor ba'i tshul kho nas rtogs par 'gyur bas rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang sbyor ba'i bye brag bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ston pa la goms pa'i phyir gang gis chos rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyang sbyor ba'i tshul kho nas rtogs par 'gyur bas rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang sbyor ba'i bye brag bya ste /
