translated: Since one becomes familiar with teaching syllogisms, when one understands the property by the method of the syllogism, one also understands by the method of the syllogism. Therefore, one should state the difference in syllogisms for inference for one‚Äôs own sake.

original: gtan tshigs gsum char la yang sbyor ba'i bye brag 'di srid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsum char la yang sbyor ba'i bye brag 'di srid do //
translated: This is the specific application of all three reasons.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo nges pa rab tu sgrub @117b ba'i skabs kyis 'di bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo nges pa rab tu sgrub @117b ba'i skabs kyis 'di bstan to //
translated: The occasion for establishing the nature of the pervasion in the case of a natural reason is taught here.

original: sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang dam bca' ba ma bstan pas de'i don ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang dam bca' ba ma bstan pas de'i don ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since the thesis is not stated in either syllogism, how is its meaning understood?

original: de'i phyir 'dir ni shugs kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ni shugs kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said here, ‚Äúonly by implication,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang phyogs kyi chos dang khyab pa rab tu bstan pa'i shugs kho nas dam bca' ba'i don rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir dam bca' ba rab tu mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang phyogs kyi chos dang khyab pa rab tu bstan pa'i shugs kho nas dam bca' ba'i don rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir dam bca' ba rab tu mi sbyor ro //
translated: Since the meaning of the thesis is understood only by implication from the teaching of the property of the subject and the pervasion in both syllogisms, therefore the thesis is not explicitly stated.

original: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Anticipating the opportunity for others to object, he says,

original: gal te gzhal bya'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te gzhal bya'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said that the meaning of the thesis is understood by implication, then the statement of the reason would be pointless,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te gzhal bya'i don rab tu ston na tshig med par ji ltar rtogs par nus zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhal bya'i don rab tu ston na tshig med par ji ltar rtogs par nus zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa'o //
translated: If it were to reveal the object of comprehension, how could it be understood without words?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas bdag nyid kyi rtogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas bdag nyid kyi rtogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says, ‚ÄúIn one‚Äôs own understanding . . .‚Äù

original: gzhal bya rab tu bstan pa med par gzhal bya rtogs par mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshe yang rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhal bya rab tu bstan pa med par gzhal bya rtogs par mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshe yang rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the object of comprehension were not revealed, the object of comprehension would not be understood. In that case, it would not be understood even when one‚Äôs own purpose is inferred,

original: de'i tshe yang su yang gzhal bya nye bar ston par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang su yang gzhal bya nye bar ston par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time no one would reveal the object of comprehension.

original: 'o na de'i tshe de ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe de ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how would it be understood at that time?

original: de'i phyir / phyogs na yod pa'i du ba nye bar dmigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / phyogs na yod pa'i du ba nye bar dmigs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúBy the perception of smoke in the vicinity . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe phyogs na du ba nye bar dmigs pa la de la yang mes khyab bar dran pa de'i tshe gnyi ga'i mthu kho nas phyogs 'di na me yod do zhes de ltar rtogs kyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyogs na du ba nye bar dmigs pa la de la yang mes khyab bar dran pa de'i tshe gnyi ga'i mthu kho nas phyogs 'di na me yod do zhes de ltar rtogs kyi /
translated: When one perceives smoke in a particular place and recalls that it is pervaded by fire, then one understands that fire exists in that place by the power of both of them.

original: 'di la su yang 'di na me yod do zhes ston par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di la su yang 'di na me yod do zhes ston par mi byed do //
translated: But no one teaches that fire exists here.

original: de la 'di snyam du rjes su dpag pa'i sngon rol du bdag nyid kyis gzhal bya rtogs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du rjes su dpag pa'i sngon rol du bdag nyid kyis gzhal bya rtogs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that one understands the object of comprehension by oneself prior to inference,

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid kyis kyang sngar cung zad kyang ma rtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid kyis kyang sngar cung zad kyang ma rtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said that one does not understand anything at all by oneself prior to that.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i sngon rol du yang de lta bu cung zad kyang mi rtogs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i sngon rol du yang de lta bu cung zad kyang mi rtogs so //
translated: One does not understand anything at all in that way prior to inference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩtshad ma ma gtogs par de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / tshad ma ma gtogs par de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Why is that?üîΩIt is said that there is no other reason for understanding that fire exists here except for valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma ma gtogs par 'di na me yod do zhes de lta bur rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: tshad ma ma gtogs par 'di na me yod do zhes de lta bur rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other reason for understanding that fire exists here except for valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir sngon rol kho nar ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon rol kho nar ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be comprehended prior to it?

original: de la 'di snyam du 'dis sngon rol du ci zhig ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'dis sngon rol du ci zhig ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that it is only in this way that it is comprehended prior to it,

original: de'i phyir / rtogs na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te 'di la gang gis na tshad ma med par sngon rol kho nar gzhal bya rtogs par 'gyur ba de @118a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rtogs na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te 'di la gang gis na tshad ma med par sngon rol kho nar gzhal bya rtogs par 'gyur ba de @118a * //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: If it is comprehended, then what is the use of a reason?

original: lta bu'i mthu zhig yod na /
analyzed: lta bu'i mthu zhig yod na /
translated: If it has the power to comprehend the object of comprehension prior to the existence of valid knowledge,üîΩthen what is the use of a reason?

original: 'o na ni rtags don med pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe rtags kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'o na ni rtags don med pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe rtags kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is pointless, then what is the use of a reason?

original: de la 'di snyam du re zhig dang po kho nar gzhal bya rnam par gzhag par bya la /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du re zhig dang po kho nar gzhal bya rnam par gzhag par bya la /
translated: But if you think that first the object of comprehension is posited and

original: de nas phyis de rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma bshad par bya'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de nas phyis de rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir tshad ma bshad par bya'o snyam du sems na /
translated: then later valid knowledge is explained in order to establish it,

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid kyis bab col du 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid kyis bab col du 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúFirst, without reason, you say, ‚ÄòFire exists here.‚Äô‚Äù

original: gang zhig tshad ma med par bab col kho nar gzhal bya rnam par 'jog par byed cing phyis de rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir rtags tshol bar byed pa de'i rtogs pa'i rim pa'i rnam pa 'di ci zhig yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig tshad ma med par bab col kho nar gzhal bya rnam par 'jog par byed cing phyis de rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir rtags tshol bar byed pa de'i rtogs pa'i rim pa'i rnam pa 'di ci zhig yin te /
translated: What kind of process of understanding is this, in which one posits the object of understanding by mere fancy, without a means of knowledge, and later seeks a reason to establish it?

original: 'di ltar dang por ma nges pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar dang por ma nges pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: What use is this method of positing something that is not ascertained?

original: 'di rnam par gzhag pa'i dus ni nges pa'i dus kho nar yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnam par gzhag pa'i dus ni nges pa'i dus kho nar yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the time of positing it is precisely the time of ascertaining it.

original: gal te bdag nyid rtogs par byed pa gzhal bya brjod pa med par rtogs kyang gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba la gzhal bya bstan par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid rtogs par byed pa gzhal bya brjod pa med par rtogs kyang gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba la gzhal bya bstan par rigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that although the object of understanding is understood without being stated, it is proper to state the object of understanding for the sake of the understanding of others,

original: de'i phyir de gzhan gyis brjod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de gzhan gyis brjod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúEven if it is stated for others,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan gyi rtogs par bya ba la yang gzhal bya brjod pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir lhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtogs par bya ba la yang gzhal bya brjod pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir lhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even for the sake of the understanding of others, stating the object of understanding is pointless.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i lugs kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i lugs kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: To anticipate the objection of those who follow the system of Master Dignaga,

original: gal te dgos pa yul bstan pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te dgos pa yul bstan pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the purpose of the thesis is to indicate the object.‚Äù

original: gzhal bya smos pas gtan tshigs kyi yul rab tu ston to zhes grags te /
analyzed: gzhal bya smos pas gtan tshigs kyi yul rab tu ston to zhes grags te /
translated: It is well known that by mentioning the object of comprehension, the object of the reason is indicated.

original: de'i phyir gzhal bya smos pa'i dgos pa ni yul bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhal bya smos pa'i dgos pa ni yul bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the purpose of mentioning the object of comprehension is to indicate the object. This is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /üîΩre zhig bstan pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩre zhig yul bstan pa de nyid kyis phan pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas / re zhig bstan pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / re zhig yul bstan pa de nyid kyis phan pa ci zhig yod /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says:üîΩ‚ÄúFirst, what is the use of indicating the object?‚Äù

original: gang gis na yul rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dam bca' ba smos pa log par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na yul rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dam bca' ba smos pa log par 'gyur /
translated: By what means is it the case that the statement of the thesis is reversed in order to indicate the object?

original: de la 'di snyam du yul rab tu bstan pa med par bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par mi 'gyur ba nyid pas de'i phyir gdon mi za bar yul rab tu bstan par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du yul rab tu bstan pa med par bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par mi 'gyur ba nyid pas de'i phyir gdon mi za bar yul rab tu bstan par bya'o zhe na /
translated: But if you think that without the demonstration of the object, the object to be established is not understood, therefore, you must demonstrate the object.

original: de'i phyir gal te gzhan du na rtogs par mi 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gzhan du na rtogs par mi 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To that, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is not understood in another way,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te yul rab tu bstan pa med par rtogs par mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe khyod kyis smras pa thams cad legs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yul rab tu bstan pa med par rtogs par mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe khyod kyis smras pa thams cad legs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not understood without the demonstration of the object, then at that time all that you say will be good.

original: de ni ji ltar btub pa de ltar sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar btub pa de ltar sngar bstan zin to //
translated: But that is not possible, and so it was explained earlier.

original: de ltar sgrub pa'i tshig las dam bca' @118b ba'i sbyor ba bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa'i tshig las dam bca' @118b ba'i sbyor ba bsal nas /
translated: Having thus refuted the application of the thesis in the proof statement,

original: mjug bsdu bar de lta bas na 'dis bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu bar de lta bas na 'dis bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in the conclusion he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, when one understands by oneself,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir dam bca' ba smos pa ji ltar yang dgos pa med pa'i phyir dam bca' ba smra ba 'di gang gi tsha bdag nyid rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe dam bca' ba smras pa 'di dam bca' ba smos pa med pa kho nar rtogs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam bca' ba smos pa ji ltar yang dgos pa med pa'i phyir dam bca' ba smra ba 'di gang gi tsha bdag nyid rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe dam bca' ba smras pa 'di dam bca' ba smos pa med pa kho nar rtogs so //
translated: Because there is no need to state a thesis, when you yourself understand it, then you understand the statement of the thesis without stating the thesis.

original: gang gi tshe kho bo gzhal bya rtogs par bya bar rtsom pa de'i tshe ni kho bo de sgrub pa'i don du gnyer ba mthong nas dam bca' ba smos pa med par ngas mi rtogs kyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kho bo gzhal bya rtogs par bya bar rtsom pa de'i tshe ni kho bo de sgrub pa'i don du gnyer ba mthong nas dam bca' ba smos pa med par ngas mi rtogs kyi /
translated: When we begin to understand the object of comprehension, then we see that you are seeking to prove it, and we do not understand you without stating the thesis.

original: dam bca' ba rab tu sbyor cig ces smra ste /
analyzed: dam bca' ba rab tu sbyor cig ces smra ste /
translated: So say, ‚ÄúI will state the thesis.‚Äù

original: de de skad du smra ba ni dus ston gyi bram ze'i bzhin du gsal ba rngan pa sgugs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de de skad du smra ba ni dus ston gyi bram ze'i bzhin du gsal ba rngan pa sgugs par byed pa yin no //
translated: When you say that, you are like a brahmin at a festival, waiting for a reward.

original: dper na gnas shig tu mchu la mtshun gtor ba la sogs par bram ze thams cad mgron du bos pa dang / chod pa bkres pa shin tu dad pa can zhig gis bram ze gzhan ni ma rnyed kyi /
analyzed: dper na gnas shig tu mchu la mtshun gtor ba la sogs par bram ze thams cad mgron du bos pa dang / chod pa bkres pa shin tu dad pa can zhig gis bram ze gzhan ni ma rnyed kyi /
translated: For example, suppose a brahmin is invited to a feast in a certain place, and a very faithful person who is hungry and poor says to him, ‚ÄúI have not found any other brahmin,

original: sprang ba ltogs te lto rnyongs pa mchu dang gre ba yongs su bskams pa /
analyzed: sprang ba ltogs te lto rnyongs pa mchu dang gre ba yongs su bskams pa /
translated: The beggar was hungry and his mouth and throat were completely dry.

original: gdong rnyi rnyi bor 'dug pa /
analyzed: gdong rnyi rnyi bor 'dug pa /
translated: His face was sunken and his cheeks were sunken and pale.

original: mkhur tshos rlabs skya ba zhig tshur 'ong ba mthong nas /
analyzed: mkhur tshos rlabs skya ba zhig tshur 'ong ba mthong nas /
translated: When he saw him coming,üîΩhe bowed his head, put his hands together like a lotus flower, and said, Please come to my house for the midday meal.

original: mgo bos phyag 'tshal te thal mo padmal bye ba lta bur sbyar nas bdag gi khyim du gdugs tshod gsol bar thugs bag mdzad ces smras pa dang / bram zes tshod pa des bram ze gzhan ma rnyed par shes nas /
analyzed: mgo bos phyag 'tshal te thal mo padmal bye ba lta bur sbyar nas bdag gi khyim du gdugs tshod gsol bar thugs bag mdzad ces smras pa dang / bram zes tshod pa des bram ze gzhan ma rnyed par shes nas /
translated: The brahmin knew that he had not found any other brahmins,üîΩand said, If you give me a silver coin for each ladle of milk-rice, then I will go to your house to eat, but not otherwise.

original: gal te mar khur re re la dngul gyi dong tshe re re byin na gdod kho bo khyim du zan za'i gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes smras so zhes grags pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mar khur re re la dngul gyi dong tshe re re byin na gdod kho bo khyim du zan za'i gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes smras so zhes grags pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is said that this should be seen as similar to that.

original: de la 'di snyam du rang gis rtogs pa la ni rtags kyi stobs kyis gzhal bya rtogs pa /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du rang gis rtogs pa la ni rtags kyi stobs kyis gzhal bya rtogs pa /
translated: In this regard, if you think that in one's own realization, the object of comprehension is realized by the power of the reason,

original: gzhan gyi khong du chud par byed na ni tshig gis rtogs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi khong du chud par byed na ni tshig gis rtogs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that if others are to understand it, then it must be understood through words,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: de'i phyir / kho bos brjod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / kho bos brjod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even if I were to state it,üîΩyou would not understand it.

original: gal te pha rol po de las khong du chud par 'gyur na ni phyogs kyi tshig brjod par bya ba yang yin na /
analyzed: gal te pha rol po de las khong du chud par 'gyur na ni phyogs kyi tshig brjod par bya ba yang yin na /
translated: If you were to understand it from the other party, then it would be necessary to state the reason.

original: kho bos ji tsam du dam bca' ba'i tshig brjod kyang de la mi ltos par bdag nyid grub zin pa'i rtags gang yin pa de kho na rjes su dran nas rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kho bos ji tsam du dam bca' ba'i tshig brjod kyang de la mi ltos par bdag nyid grub zin pa'i rtags gang yin pa de kho na rjes su dran nas rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if I were to state the words of the thesis, you would not understand it in dependence on that, but you would understand it by remembering only the reason that establishes the thesis on your own.

original: de'i phyir dam bca' ba'i tshig brjod pa dang ma brjod pa'i gnas skabs 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod /üîΩde la 'di snyam du gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la dam bca' @119a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bca' ba'i tshig brjod pa dang ma brjod pa'i gnas skabs 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod / de la 'di snyam du gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la dam bca' @119a * //
translated: Therefore, what difference is there between the two situations, one in which the words of the thesis are stated and one in which they are not?

original: ba smos pa med par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: ba smos pa med par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: In this regard, if you think that in an inference for the sake of others, the thesis must be stated because it will not be understood if it is not stated,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: de'i phyir dam bca' ba smos pa med par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bca' ba smos pa med par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, without stating a thesis, one should say, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang gi don dang 'gal ba'i sbyor ba la dam bca' ba smos pa med pa kho nar phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel ba smos pa tsam gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba mthong ste /
analyzed: rang gi don dang 'gal ba'i sbyor ba la dam bca' ba smos pa med pa kho nar phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel ba smos pa tsam gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba mthong ste /
translated: In a syllogism that is inconsistent with one‚Äôs own purpose, one sees that the mere statement of the property of the subject, without stating a thesis, is sufficient for understanding.

original: de lta bas na dam bca' ba smos pa de gang du dgos /
analyzed: de lta bas na dam bca' ba smos pa de gang du dgos /
translated: Therefore, why is it necessary to state a thesis?

original: 'di ltar gang byas pa de ni gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba khyab pa rab tu bstan la sgra yang byas pa yin pas zhes phyogs kyi chos brjod pa de gnyis kyi shugs kho nas sgra mi rtag pa yin no zhes byaüîΩbar gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang byas pa de ni gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba khyab pa rab tu bstan la sgra yang byas pa yin pas zhes phyogs kyi chos brjod pa de gnyis kyi shugs kho nas sgra mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya bar gyur na /
translated: Thus, having fully taught the pervasion, ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is necessarily impermanent,‚Äù and having stated the property of the subject, ‚ÄúSound is produced,‚Äù by the mere power of those two, it is understood that ‚ÄúSound is impermanent.‚Äù

original: de la dam bca' ba smos pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de la dam bca' ba smos pas ci zhig bya /
translated: In that case, what is the point of stating a thesis?

original: gtan tshigs gzhan gyi thabs kyis gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sa bon can nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan gyi thabs kyis gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sa bon can nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the other‚Äôs purpose is the seed of the other‚Äôs inference, the method of the other‚Äôs reason is stated.

original: rang la nges pa bzhin du gzhan dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang la nges pa bzhin du gzhan dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúJust as one is certain oneself, so one should be certain with regard to others,‚Äù

original: ji ltar rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshe rang la nges pa skyes pa de kho na bzhin gzhan dag la yang ji ltar na nges par 'gyur snyam nas gtan tshigs rjod par byed do zhes bya ba de ni rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshe rang la nges pa skyes pa de kho na bzhin gzhan dag la yang ji ltar na nges par 'gyur snyam nas gtan tshigs rjod par byed do zhes bya ba de ni rtogs pa yin no //
translated: it is understood that one states the reason, thinking, ‚ÄúJust as certainty arises for oneself when one has an inference for one‚Äôs own sake, so how can I make others certain?‚Äù

original: yang gang zhig bdag nyid ni gzhal bya nye bar bstan pa med par yang gzhal bya rtogs la /üîΩgang gi tshe pha rol po go bar byed pa de'i tshe gzhal bya'i tshig smos par byed pa de don gyi rim pa sngon ma byung ba la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: yang gang zhig bdag nyid ni gzhal bya nye bar bstan pa med par yang gzhal bya rtogs la / gang gi tshe pha rol po go bar byed pa de'i tshe gzhal bya'i tshig smos par byed pa de don gyi rim pa sngon ma byung ba la brten pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, someone might say, ‚ÄúI understand the object of comprehension without teaching it to myself.

original: de'i phyir rigs pa las 'das nas don gyi rim pa sngon ma byung ba la brten pa'i rgyu brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs pa las 'das nas don gyi rim pa sngon ma byung ba la brten pa'i rgyu brjod dgos so //
translated: But when I make others understand it, I must state the words of the object of comprehension. Therefore, I must state a reason that depends on a previous order of the object.‚Äù

original: de ltar rigs pas dam bca' ba smos pa bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar rigs pas dam bca' ba smos pa bkag nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted the statement of the thesis through reasoning,

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to summarize, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúThe statement of the thesis is not a proof.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na gzhal bya smos pa ni cung zad kyang mi dgos so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhal bya smos pa ni cung zad kyang mi dgos so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not necessary to state the object of the inference at all.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sa bon can nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sa bon can nyid yin la /
translated: Because in that way, in an inference for the sake of another, the seed of an inference for one‚Äôs own sake exists,

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba med pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang dam bca' ba smos pa dgos pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba med pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang dam bca' ba smos pa dgos pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: and in an inference for one‚Äôs own sake, the statement of a thesis is not used, therefore, in an inference for the sake of another, the statement of a thesis is not necessary at all.

original: ci'i phyir mi dgos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi dgos she na /
translated: Why is it not necessary?

original: gzhan du yang rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan du yang rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause it is understood elsewhere,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar dam bca' ba smos pa med par yang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar dam bca' ba smos pa med par yang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is understood in that way without the statement of a thesis.

original: de ltar sgrub pa'i tshig las dam bca' ba bsal nas mi 'dod pa'i @119b yan lag bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa'i tshig las dam bca' ba bsal nas mi 'dod pa'i @119b yan lag bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having eliminated the thesis from the statement of proof, in order to eliminate the unwanted parts, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúBecause it is understood elsewhere,‚Äù and so on.

original: bsgre bar bya bar 'dis ni nye bar gtod pa dang / mjug sdud pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bsgre bar bya bar 'dis ni nye bar gtod pa dang / mjug sdud pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This also includes the statement of the application, the conclusion, and so on.

original: dam bca' ba smos pa gsal ba kho nas nye bar gtod pa dang / mjug bsdus pa dag kyang gsal bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba smos pa gsal ba kho nas nye bar gtod pa dang / mjug bsdus pa dag kyang gsal bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The statement of the thesis itself makes clear the statement of the application and the conclusion.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni the tshom dang bag ma ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni the tshom dang bag ma ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes doubt, uncertainty, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sbyor ba 'di tsam kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di tsam kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of this much alone,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa smos pa tsam kho nas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa smos pa tsam kho nas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the mere statement of the relation between the property of the subject and the reason makes the probandum understood.

original: de la 'di snyam du ji srid du mthong ba'i mthu can gyi gtan tshigs kyang chos can la nye bar mi gtong la /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du ji srid du mthong ba'i mthu can gyi gtan tshigs kyang chos can la nye bar mi gtong la /
translated: In this regard, if one thinks that the reason, which has the power to be seen, does not apply to the subject,

original: chad pa'i byed pa mtha' dag mjug brtul te /
analyzed: chad pa'i byed pa mtha' dag mjug brtul te /
translated: and all the parts of the proof are concluded,

original: yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la mjug sdud par mi byed pa de srid dub sgrub par bya ba rtogs par gal 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la mjug sdud par mi byed pa de srid dub sgrub par bya ba rtogs par gal 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Moreover, if one thinks that as long as one does not conclude with regard to the subject to be established, there is no understanding of the probandum,

original: de'i phyir / kha bya'i chags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩre zhig gnas ma yin par mngon par zhe na pa 'or la sems mnyam par zhog la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / kha bya'i chags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / re zhig gnas ma yin par mngon par zhe na pa 'or la sems mnyam par zhog la /
translated: then in order to respond to that, he says, ‚Äúlike the attachment of a goose to curd,‚Äù etc.üîΩFirst, one should set one‚Äôs mind in equipoise on the attachment to an improper object.

original: ci phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel ba smos pa 'di tsam gyis rtogs pa rab tu bam mi btub soms shig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel ba smos pa 'di tsam gyis rtogs pa rab tu bam mi btub soms shig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: One should think, ‚ÄúIs the understanding not completely destroyed by merely mentioning the connection with the property of the position?‚Äù

original: kha bya ni gcer bu ba'i slob dpon rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: kha bya ni gcer bu ba'i slob dpon rnams la bya ste /
translated: The goose refers to the teachers of the naked ones.

original: de dag ni 'bras bu med par tshegs chen pos bsgrub par bya ba nas gon du ming 'dri ba la chags pa yin la gnas ma yin pa la chags pa 'di yang de dang 'dra'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bu med par tshegs chen pos bsgrub par bya ba nas gon du ming 'dri ba la chags pa yin la gnas ma yin pa la chags pa 'di yang de dang 'dra'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: They are attached to the recitation of meaningless words with great difficulty, and this attachment to an improper object is like that.

original: mig bcums te zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba spong ngo //
analyzed: mig bcums te zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba spong ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith eyes closed‚Äù rejects external distraction.

original: re zhig soms shig ces bya ba 'dis ni gtod par byed do //
analyzed: re zhig soms shig ces bya ba 'dis ni gtod par byed do //
translated: This is the ‚Äúassignment‚Äù of the matter to be proved.

original: gal te pha rol po khas len pa lta na /
analyzed: gal te pha rol po khas len pa lta na /
translated: If the opponent accepts the matter,

original: btub pa lta na spros pa'i phreng bas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: btub pa lta na spros pa'i phreng bas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then what is the use of a string of arguments?

original: gal te 'di tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur na de'i tshe dang por phyogs kyi chos smos so //
analyzed: gal te 'di tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par 'gyur na de'i tshe dang por phyogs kyi chos smos so //
translated: If the matter to be proved is understood by this much, then first the property of the subject is mentioned,

original: de'i 'og tu gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: then the reason is stated,

original: de'i 'og tu yang dpe bsnyad do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang dpe bsnyad do //
translated: then an example is given,

original: de'i rjes la chos can la nye bar gtad do //
analyzed: de'i rjes la chos can la nye bar gtad do //
translated: then the subject is assigned,

original: de'i 'og tu bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mjug bsdu'o zhes bya ba spros pa'i 'brel pa gang yin pa de cung zad kyang dgos pa med do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mjug bsdu'o zhes bya ba spros pa'i 'brel pa gang yin pa de cung zad kyang dgos pa med do //
translated: and finally the property to be proved is concluded. What is the use of a string of arguments?

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir sgrub pa'i tshigs por ba la 'di tsam kho na zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir sgrub pa'i tshigs por ba la 'di tsam kho na zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to conclude, he says, ‚ÄúIn the statement of the proof, this much alone is necessary,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgrub pa'i tshig sbyor ba la phyogs kyi chos smos pa dang / 'brel pa @120a * //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i tshig sbyor ba la phyogs kyi chos smos pa dang / 'brel pa @120a * //
translated: In the statement of the proof, first the property of the subject is mentioned, then the relation,

original: smos pa zhes smos pa 'di tsam gyi tshong cig rigs rab bo //
analyzed: smos pa zhes smos pa 'di tsam gyi tshong cig rigs rab bo //
translated: The word etc. indicates that this much is the proper procedure for the statement of one's own case.

original: de la pha rol po'i bsam pa ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la dang por ni phyogs na du ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la pha rol po'i bsam pa ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la dang por ni phyogs na du ba mthong ngo //
translated: The opponent's idea is that in the inference for oneself, one first sees smoke on the hill,

original: de'i 'og tu ni 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni 'brel pa yin no //
translated: then one remembers the relation,

original: 'brel pa dran pa'i mjug thogs su gang gi phyogs na du ba yod par yang snon par byed pa 'di du ba ni yod do snyam pa de lta bu snon pa'i shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa dran pa'i mjug thogs su gang gi phyogs na du ba yod par yang snon par byed pa 'di du ba ni yod do snyam pa de lta bu snon pa'i shes pa skye'o //
translated: and immediately after the memory of the relation, the inferential cognition arises in the form There is fire on the hill where there is smoke, adding the object to the cognition.

original: snon pa'i shes pa'i don ni gzhan gyi dong yi rjes su dpag pa la nye bar gtod par brjod do zhes grags te /
analyzed: snon pa'i shes pa'i don ni gzhan gyi dong yi rjes su dpag pa la nye bar gtod par brjod do zhes grags te /
translated: The meaning of adding the object is said to be the application to the inference for others.

original: de bas na rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang nye bar gtod pa'i don yod pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang 'di yan lag gzhan nyid du rig pa kho na'o snyam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang nye bar gtod pa'i don yod pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang 'di yan lag gzhan nyid du rig pa kho na'o snyam pa 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is the meaning of application even in the inference for oneself, it is understood that this is another part even in the inference for others.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i dgongs pa yang thams cad du snon pa'i don srid pa ni ma yin te /üîΩme don du gnyer ba'i rtogs pa po gang zhig dang po kho nar du ba dang me dag gis 'brel pa sems la bzhag nas me gang na yod ces me tshol bar byed pa de lta bu'i rtog pa po des gal te du ba mthong na de du
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i dgongs pa yang thams cad du snon pa'i don srid pa ni ma yin te / me don du gnyer ba'i rtogs pa po gang zhig dang po kho nar du ba dang me dag gis 'brel pa sems la bzhag nas me gang na yod ces me tshol bar byed pa de lta bu'i rtog pa po des gal te du ba mthong na de du
translated: The intention of the proponents of tenets is not that the meaning of the term is always added,üîΩbecause when a person who desires fire first sets in his mind the connection between smoke and fire and then seeks fire by asking, ‚ÄúWhere is the fire?‚Äù

original: ba mthong ba dang po kho nas 'di na me yod do snyam pa'i shes pa skye'i //
analyzed: ba mthong ba dang po kho nas 'di na me yod do snyam pa'i shes pa skye'i //
translated: if that person sees smoke, then at the very first moment of seeing the smoke, the thought ‚ÄúThere is fire here‚Äù arises.

original: snon pa shes pa gnyis pa la ni mi ltos so //
analyzed: snon pa shes pa gnyis pa la ni mi ltos so //
translated: It does not depend on a second cognition that adds the term.

original: de'i phyir snon pa'i shes pa don gdon mi za bar thams cad dgos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snon pa'i shes pa don gdon mi za bar thams cad dgos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not that a cognition that adds the term is definitely needed in all cases.

original: 'on te yang res 'ga' dgos pa yod pas sgrub pa'i yan lag nyid du 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yang res 'ga' dgos pa yod pas sgrub pa'i yan lag nyid du 'dod do zhe na /
translated: But if you assert that it is a part of the proof because it is sometimes needed,

original: de'i tshe lag pa na la sogs pa res 'ga' dgos pa rnams kyang sgrub pa'i yan lag nyid yin par brjod dgos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe lag pa na la sogs pa res 'ga' dgos pa rnams kyang sgrub pa'i yan lag nyid yin par brjod dgos te /
translated: then you must also say that sometimes needed things such as a hand or a foot are parts of the proof.

original: rtogs pa gang zhig lag pa na 'thungs na /
analyzed: rtogs pa gang zhig lag pa na 'thungs na /
translated: And if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.

original: gur kum dang tsan dan dag gis lus bskus te mchu rtsi dmar pos mdzes par byas /üîΩmgo la me tog gi thod bcings nas du ba mthong ste /
analyzed: gur kum dang tsan dan dag gis lus bskus te mchu rtsi dmar pos mdzes par byas / mgo la me tog gi thod bcings nas du ba mthong ste /
translated: And if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.

original: me shes par byed pa'i lag pa na la sogs pa yang bsgrub pa'i yan lag tu thal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa 'di yin no //üîΩmjug sdud pa ni dam bcas pa gsal ba kho nas bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: me shes par byed pa'i lag pa na la sogs pa yang bsgrub pa'i yan lag tu thal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa 'di yin no // mjug sdud pa ni dam bcas pa gsal ba kho nas bsal ba yin te /
translated: And if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.

original: gang du dam bca' ba dang por smos mi bzod pa de'i tshe de yang smos pa'i go skabs lta zhing rgyangs bcad de bor ba yin no //üîΩthe tshom dang ba gam pa la sogs pa ni rigs pa can dag nyid kyis bkag ste /
analyzed: gang du dam bca' ba dang por smos mi bzod pa de'i tshe de yang smos pa'i go skabs lta zhing rgyangs bcad de bor ba yin no // the tshom dang ba gam pa la sogs pa ni rigs pa can dag nyid kyis bkag ste /
translated: And if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.üîΩAnd if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.

original: de lta bas na sgrub pa'i tshig la sbyor ba ji skad bshad tshad kho na zhig rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgrub pa'i tshig la sbyor ba ji skad bshad tshad kho na zhig rigs pa yin no //
translated: And if the hand that drinks were the wine, then the hand that drinks would be drunk by the hand that drinks.

original: de ltar sgrub pa'i tshig gi tshad bshad pa bstan @120b nas /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa'i tshig gi tshad bshad pa bstan @120b nas /
translated: And if the hand that

original: rim pa nges pa bsal ba'i phyir /üîΩ'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rim pa nges pa bsal ba'i phyir / 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to eliminate the certainty of order,

original: tshad de tsam gyi sgrub pa'i tshig 'di la bar phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel ba smos pa dag gi sbyor ba nges pa ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: tshad de tsam gyi sgrub pa'i tshig 'di la bar phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel ba smos pa dag gi sbyor ba nges pa ni ci yang med do //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHere, too, there is no certainty of application of the reasonings that prove the measure of the words, because of the understanding in any way.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: ji ltar yang rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgal te phyogs kyi chos sngar ram /
analyzed: ji ltar yang rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / gal te phyogs kyi chos sngar ram /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the understanding in any way.‚Äù

original: 'on te phyis sbyor yang rung /
analyzed: 'on te phyis sbyor yang rung /
translated: Whether the property of the subject is stated first or later,

original: de lta na yang rtogs par byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rtogs par byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: in either case there is the understanding.

original: 'di ltar na rtogs kyi gzhan du na mi rtogs pa'i phyir rim pa des rab khas blang bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar na rtogs kyi gzhan du na mi rtogs pa'i phyir rim pa des rab khas blang bar bya ba yin na /
translated: Thus, because of the understanding in that order, the order is to be accepted.

original: gal te gnyi ga ltar yang btub na go de'i tshe rim pa nges pa cung zad kyang mi dgos so //
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga ltar yang btub na go de'i tshe rim pa nges pa cung zad kyang mi dgos so //
translated: But if both are possible, then at that time there is not the slightest need for certainty of order.

original: chos mthun pa can nyid dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid dag gis sbyor ba tha dad par bstan pa gang yin pa de la ci don tha dad pa zhig yod dam 'o na tre med ce na /
analyzed: chos mthun pa can nyid dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid dag gis sbyor ba tha dad par bstan pa gang yin pa de la ci don tha dad pa zhig yod dam 'o na tre med ce na /
translated: The two syllogisms that have been taught, one with a similar example and one without, are they different in meaning? Or are they not?

original: de'i phyir / 'brel pa smos pa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'brel pa smos pa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúEven when a connection is mentioned,‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyor ba gnyis po gang gis 'brel pa brjod pa de ni 'brel pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis po gang gis 'brel pa brjod pa de ni 'brel pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The two syllogisms that express a connection are those that mention a connection.

original: de la yang sbyor ba 'ba' zhig tha dad par zad kyi don ni tha dad pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de la yang sbyor ba 'ba' zhig tha dad par zad kyi don ni tha dad pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: In that case, the syllogisms are different only in form; they are not different in meaning at all.

original: ci'i phyir don tha dad pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don tha dad pa med ce na /
translated: Why are they not different in meaning?

original: de'i phyir / gnyi ga ltar yang chos tha dad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gnyi ga ltar yang chos tha dad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúAlthough the properties of both are different,‚Äù and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag gi chos tha dad mod kyi /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag gi chos tha dad mod kyi /
translated: The properties of the probandum and the proof are indeed different.

original: 'on kyang chos mthun pa can nyid kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin can gyis grub pa ston la /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos mthun pa can nyid kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin can gyis grub pa ston la /
translated: Nevertheless, the property of the similar example, which is the nature of the probandum, teaches the proof.

original: chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyis kyang ston to //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyis kyang ston to //
translated: It is also taught by the dissimilar property.

original: chos tha dad pa ni ldog pa'i bye brag las blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: chos tha dad pa ni ldog pa'i bye brag las blta bar bya ste /
translated: The different properties are to be seen by the difference of the exclusion.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa dag las log pa ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la ma byas pa dag las log pa ni byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa dag las log pa ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la ma byas pa dag las log pa ni byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, impermanence is the opposite of permanence, and the produced is the opposite of the unproduced.

original: dngos su ni gcig kho na yin te /
analyzed: dngos su ni gcig kho na yin te /
translated: In fact, it is only one.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa gang yin pa de yin pa gang yin pa de nyid byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa gang yin pa de yin pa gang yin pa de nyid byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, whatever is impermanent is produced.

original: yang ci'i phyir chos mthun pa can nyid dang / chos mi mthun pa can nyid dag gis de'i ngo bo ston ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir chos mthun pa can nyid dang / chos mi mthun pa can nyid dag gis de'i ngo bo ston ce na /
translated: Now, why is its nature taught by the similar property and the dissimilar property?

original: de'i phyir / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúIf the non-existence of the nature of that . . .‚Äù

original: gal te sgrub pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin can zhig yin pa rma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin can zhig yin pa rma gyur na /
translated: If the property of the proof were the nature of the probandum, then

original: de'i tshe gang na sgrub pa yod pa de na bsgrub par bya ba yod par nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang na sgrub pa yod pa de na bsgrub par bya ba yod par nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: at that time, wherever the proof exists, the probandum would not necessarily exist.

original: 'di ltar gang na byas pa nyid yod pa de na cig don mi za bar brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid yod dam /üîΩre zhig de ltar na chos mthun pa can nyid @121a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang na byas pa nyid yod pa de na cig don mi za bar brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid yod dam / re zhig de ltar na chos mthun pa can nyid @121a * //
translated: As such, wherever there is the state of being produced, there is the state of being that which arises immediately upon the application of effort.

original: kyis de'i ngo bo ston par bshad pa yin no //üîΩchos mi mthun pa can nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kyis de'i ngo bo ston par bshad pa yin no // chos mi mthun pa can nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, the statement ‚ÄúThe nature of that is taught by the reason‚Äù is explained to be a statement of a reason that is similar to the predicate.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa log na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa log na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate a reason that is dissimilar to the predicate, the root text says, ‚ÄúEven when the nature of that is not reversed.‚Äù

original: gal te sgrub pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin can zhig yin par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin can zhig yin par ma gyur na /
translated: If the property of the reason were not the nature of the predicate,

original: de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba log na ci'i phyir sgrub pa'i chos gdon mi za bar ldog ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba log na ci'i phyir sgrub pa'i chos gdon mi za bar ldog ste /
translated: then when the predicate is reversed, why would the property of the reason necessarily be reversed?

original: 'di ltar gang na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba med pa nyid med pa de ni ci byas pa nyid kyang gdon mi za bar med dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba med pa nyid med pa de ni ci byas pa nyid kyang gdon mi za bar med dam /
translated: As such, wherever there is the state of not being that which arises immediately upon the application of effort, there is the state of not being produced.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis gnyis cig car sbyor ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis gnyis cig car sbyor ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the method of combining the two, the reason and the predicate, the root text says, ‚ÄúThe two are not combined.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gi phyir de ltar bshad ma thag gi tshul gyis chos mthun pa nyid can dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid dag las ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa gcig sbyar bas kyang gnyis pa 'phen pa de'i phyir sgrub pa'i tshig gcig la gnyis sbyor
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi phyir de ltar bshad ma thag gi tshul gyis chos mthun pa nyid can dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid dag las ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa gcig sbyar bas kyang gnyis pa 'phen pa de'i phyir sgrub pa'i tshig gcig la gnyis sbyor
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause of the presence and absence of the property of the reason, etc.‚Äù

original: ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: ba mi bya'o //
translated: Since, in the manner just explained, the presence and absence of the property of the reason are the same as the presence and absence of the property of the thesis, the application of one of the two properties, as explained, implies the other. Therefore, one should not apply both properties in a single proof statement.

original: chos mthun pa can nyid dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid ni 'dir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgrar bshad do //
analyzed: chos mthun pa can nyid dang chos mi mthun pa can nyid ni 'dir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgrar bshad do //
translated: Here, the presence and absence of the property of the reason are explained by the terms ‚Äúpresence‚Äù and ‚Äúabsence.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir gcig la gnyis sbyor ba mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gcig la gnyis sbyor ba mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it unacceptable to apply both properties to a single proof statement?

original: de'i phyir / don med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / don med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To answer this, Dharmakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúBecause it would be meaningless.‚Äù

original: gcig kho nas de'i don bstan pa byas zin na gnyis pa don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig kho nas de'i don bstan pa byas zin na gnyis pa don med pa nyid do //
translated: If the meaning of one of the two properties is already stated, the other would be meaningless.

original: gcig gis gnyis pa'i don ji ltar ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: gcig gis gnyis pa'i don ji ltar ston par byed ce na /
translated: How does one property indicate the meaning of the other?

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the nature of that‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe bsgrub pa'i chos kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi bdag gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'brel to zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub pa med pa grub pa kho nar blta bar bya
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsgrub pa'i chos kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi bdag gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'brel to zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub pa med pa grub pa kho nar blta bar bya
translated: When it is established that the reason is related to the predicate of the probandum because of being the nature of the predicate of the probandum, then it is seen that it is established that if the predicate of the probandum does not exist, the reason does not exist.

original: ste / 'di ltar de med kyang yod na de'i ngo bo ga las yin /
analyzed: ste / 'di ltar de med kyang yod na de'i ngo bo ga las yin /
translated: Because if it exists even though that does not exist, how could it be its nature?

original: de la ci'i phyir ldog pa smos te /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir ldog pa smos te /
translated: Why is the contrapositive stated?

original: gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs gdon mi za bar med par grub pa yin pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro'o zhes bya ba 'di yang sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs gdon mi za bar med par grub pa yin pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro'o zhes bya ba 'di yang sgrub pa yin te /
translated: When it is established that if the predicate of the probandum does not exist, the reason definitely does not exist, then it is established that the reason definitely follows the predicate of the probandum.

original: 'di ltar gal te gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba dang rjes su ma 'brel na ci'i phyir te log na nges par ldog / de la ci'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba smos /üîΩde la 'di snyam du rjes su 'gro ba smos pa kho nas ldog pa sgrub mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba dang rjes su ma 'brel na ci'i phyir te log na nges par ldog / de la ci'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba smos / de la 'di snyam du rjes su 'gro ba smos pa kho nas ldog pa sgrub mod kyi /
translated: In that regard, why is it said to be related?üîΩIn that regard, if one thinks that the reversal is indeed established by the mere statement of the relation,

original: 'on kyang 'di ni nges par bya ba'i ched yin par @121b 'gyur ro snyam nas /üîΩde'i phyir / ldog pa'i sbyor ba ni ji ltar na med pa kho na la med pa yin par ston pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni nges par bya ba'i ched yin par @121b 'gyur ro snyam nas / de'i phyir / ldog pa'i sbyor ba ni ji ltar na med pa kho na la med pa yin par ston pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then in order to ascertain that,üîΩthe statement ‚ÄúThe application of the reversal is, for instance, ‚ÄòIf it does not exist, it is shown to be nonexistent‚Äô‚Äù is made.

original: gang zhig ldog pa sbyor ba ni ci nas kyang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs med pa yin par rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig ldog pa sbyor ba ni ci nas kyang bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs med pa yin par rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The application of the reversal is that the reason is nonexistent in the absence of the predicate.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las gzhan pa la yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las gzhan pa la yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not in anything other than the predicate.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba la yang ma yin no zhes de ltar nges par bstan pa'i don yin par brjod pa 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba la yang ma yin no zhes de ltar nges par bstan pa'i don yin par brjod pa 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This statement of the meaning of the proof is also unreasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzhan pa 'gal ba dag kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan pa 'gal ba dag kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because even others and contradictions are discordant classes.

original: gang gi tshe mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba de'i tshe gzhan dang 'gal ba dag la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba de'i tshe gzhan dang 'gal ba dag la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa kho na'o //
translated: When what is not a concordant class is called a discordant class, then others and contradictions are discordant classes.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa de ni gdon mi za bar mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa de ni gdon mi za bar mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin la /
translated: Thus, that which is other than a concordant class is certainly not a concordant class.

original: gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'gal ba de yang mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'gal ba de yang mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
translated: And that which is contradictory to a concordant class is also not a concordant class.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du yongs su bzung na gtan tshigs chad par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs las gzhan pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du yongs su bzung na gtan tshigs chad par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that which is other than a concordant class is taken to be a discordant class, then the fallacy of the reason being inconclusive does not arise.

original: 'di ltar gzhan ni 'jig rten na brjod par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rten ma yin par grags kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan ni 'jig rten na brjod par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rten ma yin par grags kyi /
translated: Thus, in the world, the other is known as the basis of the phenomenon that is desired to be expressed.

original: chos gzhan dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the basis of another phenomenon.

original: 'di ltar bram ze las gzhan pa khrid de shog shig ces byas na bram ze nyid kyi rten ma yin pa rgyal rigs khrid de 'ong gi mi nyid la sogs pa chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir bram ze de nyid gzhan yin pas khrid de 'ong ba niüîΩma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bram ze las gzhan pa khrid de shog shig ces byas na bram ze nyid kyi rten ma yin pa rgyal rigs khrid de 'ong gi mi nyid la sogs pa chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir bram ze de nyid gzhan yin pas khrid de 'ong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if one is told, ‚ÄúBring the other than a Brahmin,‚Äù a Brahmin himself is not brought, but a k·π£atriya is brought. But a Brahmin is not brought because he is the basis of another phenomenon, such as being a human.

original: stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa yang gzhan yin pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs chad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa yang gzhan yin pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs chad pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, emptiness, selflessness, and so on are not refuted because they are reasons that are discordant by being other.

original: 'di ltar de dag la byas pa nyid mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la byas pa nyid mi 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, the reason that they are other is not established.

original: 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos rnam par mi 'jog go //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams kyi chos rnam par mi 'jog go //
translated: Thus, phenomena are not posited as phenomena.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'gal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin na yang gal te 'gal ba 'ba' zhig las rnam par gcod par byed na ni de'i tshe me yod pa las ni 'di na dro ba'i reg pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di la dro ba yang
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'gal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin na yang gal te 'gal ba 'ba' zhig las rnam par gcod par byed na ni de'i tshe me yod pa las ni 'di na dro ba'i reg pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di la dro ba yang
translated: If it were the case that the concordant class and the discordant class were mutually exclusive, and if it were the case that the exclusion of the object of negation were established by the mere exclusion of the discordant class, then in the case of the statement, ‚ÄúBecause fire exists, heat exists here,‚Äù

original: ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa las rnam par bcad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi tshe gzhan yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa nyid kyi dro ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa las rnam @122a * //
analyzed: ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa las rnam par bcad par mi 'gyur ro // gang gi tshe gzhan yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa nyid kyi dro ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa las rnam @122a * //
translated: heat would not be excluded from that which is neither hot nor cold.

original: par bcad par sgrub pa de'i tshe nyes pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: par bcad par sgrub pa de'i tshe nyes pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But when it is established that heat is excluded from that which is neither hot nor cold because it is the discordant class, then there is no fault.

original: de ltar tshig gis chos nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag phan tshun 'phen par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshig gis chos nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag phan tshun 'phen par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown that the presence and absence of the object of affirmation and the object of negation are mutually implicative,

original: dngos su 'brel pa sgrub par bzhed nas gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tu 'gyur ba yod pa gdon mi za bar 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ji ltar khong du chud ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te
analyzed: dngos su 'brel pa sgrub par bzhed nas gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tu 'gyur ba yod pa gdon mi za bar 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ji ltar khong du chud ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te
translated: If you assert that there is an actual relationship, then how do you understand the statement, ‚ÄúWhatever is existent is necessarily momentary, because it is invariably concomitant with destruction‚Äù?

original: / rgyu gang gis na yod pa skad cig ma nyid yin pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tu 'gyur ba dngos po yod pa ni gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar khong du chud /
analyzed: / rgyu gang gis na yod pa skad cig ma nyid yin pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tu 'gyur ba dngos po yod pa ni gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar khong du chud /
translated: By what reason is it understood that whatever is existent is momentary, so that whatever is existent is invariably concomitant with destruction?

original: 'dir pha rol po'i bsam pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa ni yod kyang rtag pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po'i bsam pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa ni yod kyang rtag pa kho na yin no //
translated: Here, the opponent thinks that space and so on exist but are permanent.

original: dngos po mi rtag pa dag kyang dus gzhan gyi bar du gnas te /
analyzed: dngos po mi rtag pa dag kyang dus gzhan gyi bar du gnas te /
translated: Impermanent things also endure for a period of time.

original: 'di ltar de dag 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas 'jig gi / ji srid du de dang ma phrad pa de srid du gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas 'jig gi / ji srid du de dang ma phrad pa de srid du gnas so //
translated: Thus they are destroyed only when they come into contact with the cause of their destruction, and as long as they do not come into contact with it, they endure.

original: dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa'i rgyu sgrub kyang mi dgos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa'i rgyu sgrub kyang mi dgos te /
translated: It is not necessary to prove the cause of the destruction of things.

original: shing la sogs pa la me la sogs pa bab pas 'jig pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa la me la sogs pa bab pas 'jig pa mthong ngo //
translated: We see that a tree, etc. is destroyed by the falling of fire, etc.

original: mthong ba yang bsnyon du rigs pa ma yin no snyam pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba yang bsnyon du rigs pa ma yin no snyam pa 'di yin te /
translated: And it is not proper to deny what is seen.

original: phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: This is the opponent's position.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says:

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because a cause of destruction is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyu dpyad na ji ltar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyu dpyad na ji ltar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, when the cause of their destruction is examined, it is not tenable in any way.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa yang nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa nyid yin na yod pa bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa yang nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa nyid yin na yod pa bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: And the intended meaning is that if space, etc. were permanent, it would only be necessary to prove that it exists.

original: shing la sogs pa me la sogs pas 'jig go zhes bya ba 'di yang mngon sum du ma grub ste /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa me la sogs pas 'jig go zhes bya ba 'di yang mngon sum du ma grub ste /
translated: This statement that a tree, etc. is destroyed by fire, etc. is not established by direct perception.

original: re zhig ci shing la sogs pa me la sogs pas bshig ste /
analyzed: re zhig ci shing la sogs pa me la sogs pas bshig ste /
translated: First, is a tree, etc. destroyed by fire, etc.?

original: de'i phyir mi snang ba zhig ni na ma 'on te rang gi dang kho na zhig la rgyu'i tshogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dang phrad pas gzhan du byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi snang ba zhig ni na ma 'on te rang gi dang kho na zhig la rgyu'i tshogs pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa dang phrad pas gzhan du byung ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not that something does not appear, but rather that a collection of causes that is different from the one that produced it encounters a different characteristic,

original: de'i phyir mi snang zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya'o snyam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi snang zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya'o snyam pa 'di yin no //
translated: and therefore it is not that it does not appear.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni 'og nas kyang dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni 'og nas kyang dgag par bya'o //
translated: We will also refute the cause of destruction later.

original: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po rnams mi 'jig na 'on de dag ji ltar 'jig ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po rnams mi 'jig na 'on de dag ji ltar 'jig ce na /
translated: If the cause of destruction does not destroy things, then how are they destroyed?

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThings are destroyed by their own intrinsic nature alone.‚Äù

original: dngos po rnams ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas 'jig pa'i dang tshul can yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rang gi ngo bo kho nas 'jig pa'i dang tshul can yin te /
translated: Things are by their very nature subject to destruction.

original: des na skad cig las phan tshun du mi gnas kyi /
analyzed: des na skad cig las phan tshun du mi gnas kyi /
translated: Therefore, they do not remain together for a second moment.

original: rang gi ngo bo grub zin pa 'di dag @122b phyis tho ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo grub zin pa 'di dag @122b phyis tho ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are destroyed by their own intrinsic nature alone, not by the subsequent destruction of something else, such as a hammer.

original: dam bcas pa tsam gyis don grub pa ma mthong bas gtan tshigs de la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa tsam gyis don grub pa ma mthong bas gtan tshigs de la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the meaning is not seen to be established merely by the assertion, the reason is not capable of establishing the meaning.

original: 'di ltar 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po 'jig par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po 'jig par mi nus so //
translated: Thus, a cause of destruction is not capable of destroying a thing.

original: 'di ltar 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po 'jig na gzhig par bya ba'i dngos po de nyid byed dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po 'jig na gzhig par bya ba'i dngos po de nyid byed dam /
translated: If a cause of destruction destroys a thing, does it cause the destruction of that very thing to be destroyed?

original: 'on te de las gzhan pa gyo mo la sos pa'i ngo bo zhig byed dam /
analyzed: 'on te de las gzhan pa gyo mo la sos pa'i ngo bo zhig byed dam /
translated: Or does it cause the destruction of something else, such as a pot that has the nature of shards?üîΩOr does it cause the destruction of a non-thing?

original: 'on te dngos po med pa zhig byed ces bya ba brtag pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa zhig byed ces bya ba brtag pa gsum mo //
translated: These are the three alternatives.

original: brtag pa dang po gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa dang po gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the first alternative,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúA cause of destruction does not cause the destruction of a thing to be destroyed,‚Äù and so on.

original: re zhig 'jig pa'i rgyus gzhig par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig 'jig pa'i rgyus gzhig par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: A cause of destruction does not cause the destruction of a thing to be destroyed, such as a pot, because it does not make contact with it.

original: ji ltar de ni 'ji ba dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo dang skud pa dang lag ngar dang sor mo dang chu la sogs pa rang gi rgyu dag nyid las grub zin pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar de ni 'ji ba dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo dang skud pa dang lag ngar dang sor mo dang chu la sogs pa rang gi rgyu dag nyid las grub zin pa kho na yin na /
translated: Just as it is that, having been established from its own causes‚Äîthe clay, the stick, the wheel, the thread, the hands, the fingers, the water, and so on‚Äî

original: de la tho ba la sogs pas gzhan bya ci dgos te /
analyzed: de la tho ba la sogs pas gzhan bya ci dgos te /
translated: what need is there for a hammer and so on to make it other?

original: de dag ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: They are not causes.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the second analysis, he says,

original: ngo bo nyid gzhan zhig byed na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhan zhig byed na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúEven if another intrinsic reality is made,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on te 'jig pa'i rgyus bum pa la ma gtogs pa ngo bo nyid gzhan zhig byed na de lta na bum pa de'i so na 'dug pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig pa'i rgyus bum pa la ma gtogs pa ngo bo nyid gzhan zhig byed na de lta na bum pa de'i so na 'dug pa kho na yin te /
translated: But if another intrinsic reality is made by the cause of cessation, apart from the pot, then in that case the pot would remain just as it is.

original: de la 'jig pa'i rgyus cung zad kyang ma byas so //
analyzed: de la 'jig pa'i rgyus cung zad kyang ma byas so //
translated: The cause of cessation would not do anything to it at all.

original: de'i phyir mngon bzhin du dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon bzhin du dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be observed as manifest.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni de bzhin du sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa chu ba dang / rkang pa gcod pa la sogs pa yang byed par 'gyur ba bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni de bzhin du sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa chu ba dang / rkang pa gcod pa la sogs pa yang byed par 'gyur ba bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the cutting of the bamboo and so on, and the cutting of the legs and so on.

original: de la 'di snyam du ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi gyo mo la sogs pa'i ngo bo byas pa gang yin pa des bum pa bsgribs te /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi gyo mo la sogs pa'i ngo bo byas pa gang yin pa des bum pa bsgribs te /
translated: If you think that the nature of the clay and so on is transformed into the nature of the pot and so on, and that the pot is obscured by that transformation,

original: des na ji skad du bshad pa 'di mi byed do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na ji skad du bshad pa 'di mi byed do snyam du sems na /
translated: and that for that reason the previously mentioned faults do not apply,

original: de'i phyir / ngo bo nyid gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ngo bo nyid gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: A different nature does not obscure it.

original: ngo bo nyid gzhan yang bum pa la sgrib par mi byed do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhan yang bum pa la sgrib par mi byed do //
translated: A different nature does not obscure the pot.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i son 'dug na de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i son 'dug na de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf it exists there, it is not tenable that it is established.‚Äù

original: gal te bum pa'i rang gi ngo bor ngas par 'dug na de la sgrub par yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te bum pa'i rang gi ngo bor ngas par 'dug na de la sgrub par yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If the nature of the pot exists there, it is not tenable that it is established.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the meaning of inclusion.

original: 'jig pa mi rung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sgrib par yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig pa mi rung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sgrib par yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not only is destruction untenable, but also obscuration is untenable.

original: 'di ltar sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la sogs pa bskyed par rung ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la sogs pa bskyed par rung ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan du byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, what is called ‚Äúobscuration‚Äù is the transformation of the nature of the object, etc., into something else that is suitable to be produced.

original: de lta ma yin na sgrib pa nyid mi 'thad do //üîΩde lta bu'i @123a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sgrib pa nyid mi 'thad do // de lta bu'i @123a * //
translated: If it were otherwise, obscuration itself would be untenable.

original: ngo bo nyid gzhan du byed na yang sgrib par byed pas bshig pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhan du byed na yang sgrib par byed pas bshig pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the nature of the object, etc., were transformed into something else, it would be destroyed by the obscuration that is supposed to obscure it.

original: gal te de lta yin du zin mod ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin du zin mod ce na ma yin te /
translated: If this is so, then what?

original: de la bshad ma thag pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bshad ma thag pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it does not transcend the three alternatives just explained.

original: brtag pa gsum pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa gsum pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the third alternative, he says,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po med par byed pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
