analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po med par byed pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúNor is the cause of destruction the nonexistence of the thing.‚Äù

original: 'jig pa'i rgyus bum pa med par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyus bum pa med par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The cause of destruction does not make the pot nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: med pa tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúNonexistence‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te ma yin pa'i ngo bo med pa 'bras bu nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe med par byed do zhes bya bar 'di la tshig gi don ni dngos po las gzhan pa zhig byed do zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma yin pa'i ngo bo med pa 'bras bu nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe med par byed do zhes bya bar 'di la tshig gi don ni dngos po las gzhan pa zhig byed do zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that the nonexistence of an entity that is not a thing is the effect, then in that case, the meaning of the statement ‚Äúit makes nonexistence‚Äù would be that it makes something other than an entity.

original: de'i phyir ma yin pa 'jug pas med pa 'bras bu nyid du khas len na byed pa gang yin pa de ci bum pa la tha dad pa zhig gam /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma yin pa 'jug pas med pa 'bras bu nyid du khas len na byed pa gang yin pa de ci bum pa la tha dad pa zhig gam /
translated: Therefore, if you accept that nonexistence is the effect of engagement, then whatever is the agent of that, is it different from the vase or not?

original: 'on te tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rnam par brtag pa gnyis las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rnam par brtag pa gnyis las mi 'da' ste /
translated: This does not go beyond the two alternatives.

original: de la yang nyes pa bshad zin te //
analyzed: de la yang nyes pa bshad zin te //
translated: The error has already been explained.

original: tshul zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir ma yin pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la 'di snyam du 'on med pa dgag pa yin par 'gyur ro snyam na de'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir ma yin pa yin par rig par bya'o // de la 'di snyam du 'on med pa dgag pa yin par 'gyur ro snyam na de'i phyir /
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù should be understood to mean ‚Äúit is not.‚Äù

original: dngos po dgag pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na 'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po dgag pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na 'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In that regard, if you think that nonexistence is a negation, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says: If the nature of the negation of an entity is one, and so on.

original: gal te med par dgag pa la brten na de'i tshe tshig gi don dngos po mi byed ces bya ba 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te med par dgag pa la brten na de'i tshe tshig gi don dngos po mi byed ces bya ba 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: If you rely on a non-implicative negation, then the meaning of the words would be ‚Äúa cause of cessation does not make a thing.‚Äù

original: dngos po mi byed pa la rgyu nyid med pas 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ci yang ma grub bo //
analyzed: dngos po mi byed pa la rgyu nyid med pas 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ci yang ma grub bo //
translated: Since a cause of cessation does not make a thing, it is not established at all as a cause of cessation.

original: dngos po dgag pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir med par dgag pa la bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po dgag pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir med par dgag pa la bya ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúthe nature of a negation of a thing‚Äù here refers to a non-implicative negation.

original: de ltar na 'jig pa'i rgyu la nus pa med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig pa'i rgyu la nus pa med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it has been shown that a cause of cessation has no power.

original: da ni nus pa khas blangs nas kyang 'bras bu med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nus pa khas blangs nas kyang 'bras bu med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that an effect does not exist even if you accept that it has power,

original: don med pa'i yang phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: don med pa'i yang phyir te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAlso, because it is pointless.‚Äù

original: yongs su brtags na 'jig pa'i rgyu 'di ni don med pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su brtags na 'jig pa'i rgyu 'di ni don med pa yin te /
translated: When you examine it, this cause of cessation is pointless.

original: 'di ltar 'di la dngos po bstan pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin pa 'am mi brten pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin par 'gyur grang zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la dngos po bstan pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin pa 'am mi brten pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin par 'gyur grang zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: In this regard, there are two alternatives: it would be the nature of a thing that is shown or it would be the nature of something that is not supported.

original: de la brtag pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas gal te dngos po rang gi ngo bos 'jig pa yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la brtag pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas gal te dngos po rang gi ngo bos 'jig pa yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In the first of these analyses, it says, If things were to disintegrate by their very nature, etc.

original: gal te dngos po rang gi ngo bo kho nas 'jig pa yi na 'jig pa'i rgyu ci zhig dgos /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rang gi ngo bo kho nas 'jig pa yi na 'jig pa'i rgyu ci zhig dgos /
translated: If things were to disintegrate by their very nature, what need would there be for a cause of disintegration?

original: srog rker phyin te shi @123b la thug pa ni gsod par byed pa'i 'bad pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srog rker phyin te shi @123b la thug pa ni gsod par byed pa'i 'bad pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: When one‚Äôs life is at stake, it is not the case that the effort to kill is fruitless.

original: ci'i phyir 'bras bu med snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'bras bu med snyam na /
translated: Why is it fruitless?

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa kho nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It says, ‚ÄúBecause of its very nature, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di 'jig pa'i ngo bo yin pa kho nas bdag nyid 'jig na rang tshig pa de la me ci zhig dgos /
analyzed: 'di 'jig pa'i ngo bo yin pa kho nas bdag nyid 'jig na rang tshig pa de la me ci zhig dgos /
translated: If it were to disintegrate by its very nature, what need would there be for fire to burn it?

original: de la 'dis snyam du 'jig pa'i rgyu dag gis 'di 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid du byed do snyam na /
analyzed: de la 'dis snyam du 'jig pa'i rgyu dag gis 'di 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid du byed do snyam na /
translated: If he thinks that the causes of disintegration make it have the nature of disintegration,

original: gang zhig gang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúWhat would be the nature of that which is what?‚Äù

original: dngos po gang gi rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rang gi rgyu dag kho na las skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po gang gi rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rang gi rgyu dag kho na las skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Whatever the intrinsic reality of a thing is, it arises only from its own causes.

original: dang po dngos po skye la phyis rang gi ngo bo de lta bu thob par bya ba'i phyir rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po dngos po skye la phyis rang gi ngo bo de lta bu thob par bya ba'i phyir rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: A thing does not arise first and then later depend on other causes in order to obtain such an intrinsic reality.

original: 'dir dpe gsal ba dang gsher ba dang dro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir dpe gsal ba dang gsher ba dang dro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, the example is stated: ‚Äúclarity, fluidity, heat, and solidity.‚Äù

original: gsal ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / sra ba zhes bya bar bsdu'o //
analyzed: gsal ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / sra ba zhes bya bar bsdu'o //
translated: Clarity, fluidity, heat, and solidity are included.

original: gsal ba ni sgron ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni sgron ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Clarity is a lamp, etc.

original: gsher ba ni chu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsher ba ni chu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Fluidity is water, etc.

original: dro ba ni me'o //
analyzed: dro ba ni me'o //
translated: Heat is fire.

original: sra ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sra ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Solidity is earth, etc.

original: gsal ba dang gsher ba dang dro ba dang sra ba dag ste /
analyzed: gsal ba dang gsher ba dang dro ba dang sra ba dag ste /
translated: Clarity, fluidity, heat, and solidityüîΩare the four great elements.

original: rjes de dag ces bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes de dag ces bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äútheir‚Äù is to be connected with ‚Äúthose.‚Äù

original: de dag dang 'dra ba yin pas na de dag dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dang 'dra ba yin pas na de dag dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Since they are similar to those, they are similar to those.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the example, he says:

original: gsal ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgsal ba la sogs pa ji skad du bshad pa gsal ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / sra ba la sogs pa ngo bor byung ba rnams ni yang de dag gis bdag nyid du bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsal ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gsal ba la sogs pa ji skad du bshad pa gsal ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / sra ba la sogs pa ngo bor byung ba rnams ni yang de dag gis bdag nyid du bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe clarity, etc.,‚Äù etc.

original: gsal ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du bya ba'i phyir rang gi rgyu la ma gtogs pa rgyu gzhan la lta ci smos so //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du bya ba'i phyir rang gi rgyu la ma gtogs pa rgyu gzhan la lta ci smos so // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The clarity, etc., as they have been explained, i.e., clarity, fluidity, heat, and motility, etc., are the entities that arise. They are not again to be made into their own natures, i.e., they are not to be made into the natures of clarity, etc. Why not?

original: de'i bdag nyid la de'i bdag nyid med na bdag nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la de'i bdag nyid med na bdag nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because, if that which is of the nature of something does not exist as that nature, it follows that it does not exist at all.

original: gang zhig gang gi ngo bo yin par 'dod pa de gal te de'i ngo bor 'byung ba na mi 'gyur na de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi ngo bo yin par 'dod pa de gal te de'i ngo bor 'byung ba na mi 'gyur na de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that which is asserted to be of the nature of something does not exist as that nature, then it has no nature of its own.

original: dpe la rab tu grub pa'i don dngos la sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe la rab tu grub pa'i don dngos la sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to apply the meaning of the example to the actual case, he says,

original: de dang 'dra bar gal te mi gnas pa'i chos can zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar gal te mi gnas pa'i chos can zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Likewise, if it is impermanent, etc.

original: ji ltar gsal ba la sogs pa rang gi rgyu dag las gsal ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba de bzhin du gal te mi gnas pa'i chos can zhig yin na ni ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo grub pa yang mi gnas pa'i chos can nyidüîΩdu bya ba'i @124a * //
analyzed: ji ltar gsal ba la sogs pa rang gi rgyu dag las gsal ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du 'byung ba de bzhin du gal te mi gnas pa'i chos can zhig yin na ni ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo grub pa yang mi gnas pa'i chos can nyid du bya ba'i @124a * //
translated: Just as manifestation, etc. arise in the nature of manifestation, etc. from their own causes, likewise, if it is impermanent, etc.üîΩthen it would not be permanent, etc.

original: phyir rang gi rgyu lam gtogs par rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir rang gi rgyu lam gtogs par rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and it would not depend on another cause apart from its own cause in order to be impermanent, etc.

original: 'di la mi gnas pa'i chos yod pa 'di ni mi gnas pa'i chos can te rang bzhin mi gnas pa mjug thogs su 'jig pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la mi gnas pa'i chos yod pa 'di ni mi gnas pa'i chos can te rang bzhin mi gnas pa mjug thogs su 'jig pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, the one who has the quality of impermanence is impermanent, i.e., by nature impermanent, i.e., disintegrating immediately after arising.

original: sbyor ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The syllogism is this:

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa la ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par khyab po //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa la ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par khyab po //
translated: Whatever depends on another cause is not of the nature of that,üîΩbecause it is impermanent, like a pot.

original: de dang 'gal ba ni ngo bo nyid yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba ni ngo bo nyid yin pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is intrinsic nature.

original: ba mo'i reg pa la khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dro ba'i reg pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba mo'i reg pa la khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dro ba'i reg pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the contact of heat is the opposite of the contact of cold, which pervades the body.

original: gzhan gyi 'khrul pa gleng pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'khrul pa gleng pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Fearing that someone might say that the error of the opponent is being imputed to us,

original: sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩde nyid rnam par grol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // de nyid rnam par grol ba'i phyir /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúLike a seed, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because of that, he says, ‚ÄúWe think,‚Äù and so on.

original: sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
translated: Although a seed, etc., has the nature of producing a sprout, etc.,

original: 'on kyang 'ba' zhig gis rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi chu la sogs pa rgyu gzhan la ltos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ba' zhig gis rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi chu la sogs pa rgyu gzhan la ltos so //
translated: nevertheless, it does not produce its effect by itself alone, but depends on other causes, such as water.

original: de dang 'dra bar dngos po yang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar dngos po yang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, although an entity has the nature of destruction,üîΩnevertheless, in order to be destroyed, it depends on other causes, such as a hammer, etc.

original: 'jig par bya ba'i phyir thob la sogs pa rgyu gzhan la ltos so zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig par bya ba'i phyir thob la sogs pa rgyu gzhan la ltos so zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa'o //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says, ‚ÄúNo, it is not like that.‚Äù

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIts very essence‚Äù and so on.

original: sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu gang yin pa de ni rang gi 'bras bu bskyed pa kho na ste /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa myu gu la sogs pa skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu gang yin pa de ni rang gi 'bras bu bskyed pa kho na ste /
translated: The cause of the arising of such things as the sprout from such things as the seed is the essence of the cause that generates its own effect.

original: gzhan la mi ltos so //
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos so //
translated: It does not depend on another.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ltos pa gang yin pa de ni skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'dod pa kho na yin pas 'khrul par ga las 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ltos pa gang yin pa de ni skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'dod pa kho na yin pas 'khrul par ga las 'gyur /
translated: That which is dependent in the context of arising and so on is not asserted to be the essence of the cause that generates it. So how could there be error?

original: de la 'di snyam du ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin na /
translated: In this regard, if you think that if they are the same essence,

original: de ji ltar rung snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de ji ltar rung snyam du sems na /
translated: how could that be tenable?

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnas skabs de gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnas skabs de gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause those two contexts are not different in substance,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar skyed par byed pa ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar skyed par byed pa ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Because in that way the cause that generates its effect is the essence of the cause that generates it,

original: skyed par byed pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'dod pa de nyid kyi phyir sa bon la sogs pa'i skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dag dngos po tha dad par nges par bya ste /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'dod pa de nyid kyi phyir sa bon la sogs pa'i skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dag dngos po tha dad par nges par bya ste /
translated: Because we do not assert that the producer is the very essence of the produced, one should ascertain that the states of being a producer and not being a producer of such things as a sprout are different things.

original: ngo bo nyid sna tshogs pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid sna tshogs pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should understand that they have various essences.

original: skyed par byed pa nyid dang / skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis bye brag yod par gyur du chug na yang ngo bo nyid tha dad pa go ci'i @124b phyir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa nyid dang / skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis bye brag yod par gyur du chug na yang ngo bo nyid tha dad pa go ci'i @124b phyir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if one allows that there is a difference in being a producer and not being a producer, why would there be a difference in their essences?

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause the essences of things do not transform,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te gnas skabs 'di gnyis ngo bo nyid tha dad par ma gyur na de'i tshe de'i ngo bo nyid gnas skabs tha ma bzhin du sngon gyi gnas skabs na yang skyed par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs 'di gnyis ngo bo nyid tha dad par ma gyur na de'i tshe de'i ngo bo nyid gnas skabs tha ma bzhin du sngon gyi gnas skabs na yang skyed par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If these two occasions were not different in nature, then at that time, its nature would be that of the final occasion, and it would absurdly follow that it would generate the sprout at the prior occasion as well.

original: de ltar tha dad pa yin par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar tha dad pa yin par bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus shown that they are different, in order to summarize, he says:

original: de lta bas na gnas skabs kyi bye brag tha ma gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas skabs kyi bye brag tha ma gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, that which is the final occasion, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas gnas skabs de nyid ngo bo nyid tha dad pa de'i phyir de la gnas skabs kyi bye brag tha ma gang yin pa de nyid myu gu skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas gnas skabs de nyid ngo bo nyid tha dad pa de'i phyir de la gnas skabs kyi bye brag tha ma gang yin pa de nyid myu gu skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
translated: Because it has been explained in this way, that occasion itself is different in nature. Therefore, it is established that that which is the final occasion is the nature that generates the sprout.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: It is not another.

original: 'on ci'i phyir 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams sngon gyi gnas skabs su de nye bar len par byed /
analyzed: 'on ci'i phyir 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams sngon gyi gnas skabs su de nye bar len par byed /
translated: But why do those who seek the effect take up the prior occasion?

original: ji ltar na ni rgyu zhes tha snyad 'dogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ni rgyu zhes tha snyad 'dogs she na /
translated: How do you designate a cause?

original: de'i phyir / sngon gyi gnas skabs na yod pa'i bye brag rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sngon gyi gnas skabs na yod pa'i bye brag rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe particulars that exist in the prior state‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu gang dag sngon gyi gnas skabs na yod pa de dag ni rgyu'i rgyu dag yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang dag sngon gyi gnas skabs na yod pa de dag ni rgyu'i rgyu dag yin no //
translated: Those causes that exist in the prior state are the causes of the causes.

original: 'di ltar gnas skabs tha ma gang yin pa de ni nye ba'i tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas skabs tha ma gang yin pa de ni nye ba'i tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu can yin la /
translated: Thus, the final state has the prior state as its cause,

original: nye ba'i tha ma'i gnas skabs ni de las gzhan pa'i gnas skabs dag ni rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: nye ba'i tha ma'i gnas skabs ni de las gzhan pa'i gnas skabs dag ni rgyu can yin te /
translated: and the prior state has the state other than that as its cause.

original: de bzhin du de nas phyung ba'i gnas skabs ni skyen 'dug pa'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu can gyi bar du yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nas phyung ba'i gnas skabs ni skyen 'dug pa'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu can gyi bar du yin no //
translated: In the same way, the state of being removed from the sack has the state of being in the sack as its cause, up to the state of being in the granary.

original: sgye na 'dug pa'i gnas skabs med par yang de nas phyung ba'i gnas skabs med la /
analyzed: sgye na 'dug pa'i gnas skabs med par yang de nas phyung ba'i gnas skabs med la /
translated: Without the state of being in the sack, the state of being removed from the sack would not exist.

original: de bzhin du nye ba'i tha ma'i gnas skabs med par yang gnas skabs tha ma med pa'i bar du yin te de ltar na sngon gyi gnas skabs na yod pa'i rgyu rnams la rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'dogs shing 'bras bu don du gnyer bar len gyi
analyzed: de bzhin du nye ba'i tha ma'i gnas skabs med par yang gnas skabs tha ma med pa'i bar du yin te de ltar na sngon gyi gnas skabs na yod pa'i rgyu rnams la rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'dogs shing 'bras bu don du gnyer bar len gyi
translated: So too, without the state of the immediate antecedent, there would be no state of the immediate antecedent, and so on, until there would be no state of the final antecedent. Thus, one designates as causes the causes that exist in the prior state and one takes up the pursuit of the effect.

original: dngos su rgyu yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin pas ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos su rgyu yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin pas ma nges pa yin no //
translated: But it is not because they are actually causes that they are called causes. Therefore, your reason is not established.

original: rgyu'i rgyu ni rgyu dag yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyu ni rgyu dag yin no //
translated: The cause of the cause is the cause.

original: de dag gi ngo bo ni de dag nyid de /
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo ni de dag nyid de /
translated: The nature of those is just those.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is like that, etc.

original: ci'i phyir skad cig ma tha dad pa de lta bu 'di dngos po'i ngo bo gcig par snang zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skad cig ma tha dad pa de lta bu 'di dngos po'i ngo bo gcig par snang zhe na /
translated: Why do those different moments appear as the same entity of a thing?

original: de'i phyir dngos po skad cig ma rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po skad cig ma rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, he says, ‚ÄúThe entity of all things is momentary.‚Äù

original: dngos po thams cad ni skad cig tu 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni skad cig tu 'jig pa yin la /
translated: All things are momentary destruction.

original: de dag la yang skad cig @125a * //
analyzed: de dag la yang skad cig @125a * //
translated: And those are momentary.

original: ma gzhan dang gzhan skyen de dag la gcig pa nyid ga la yod /
analyzed: ma gzhan dang gzhan skyen de dag la gcig pa nyid ga la yod /
translated: How could the other and other-arising be the same?

original: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: To forestall the opponent‚Äôs position, it says,

original: gal te tha ma dag nus pa yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te tha ma dag nus pa yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the final state of the cause is the capacity . . .‚Äù

original: gal te rgyu rnams kyi gnas skabs tha ma kho na la mngon sum du nus pa nyid du 'dod na ci ste 'bras bu skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: gal te rgyu rnams kyi gnas skabs tha ma kho na la mngon sum du nus pa nyid du 'dod na ci ste 'bras bu skyed par mi byed /
translated: If you assert that the final state of the cause alone is the capacity to produce the effect, why does it not produce the effect?

original: 'dir yang pha rol po ci ste so sor 'bras bu re re skyed par mi byed ces de snyam du sems shing spyir rgal zhing rtag par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir yang pha rol po ci ste so sor 'bras bu re re skyed par mi byed ces de snyam du sems shing spyir rgal zhing rtag par byed do //
translated: Here, the opponent thinks, ‚ÄúWhy does each of the causes not produce each of the effects individually?‚Äù and thus he objects in general and in terms of a universal.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas kyang de'i khong na 'khrul pa mi mkhyen pa ltar brdzus nas lan du /üîΩskyed par byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas kyang de'i khong na 'khrul pa mi mkhyen pa ltar brdzus nas lan du / skyed par byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion pretends not to know that there is a mistake in this and replies:üîΩ‚ÄúOnly that which is the capacity produces the effect.‚Äù

original: gang dag nus pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag nus pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar skyed par byed do //
translated: That which is the capacity must produce the effect.

original: de dag gi tha ma'i gnas skabs 'di la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de dag gi tha ma'i gnas skabs 'di la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: But in the final stage of these, there is no transformation into something else.

original: mi skyed pa tsam la 'dir gzhan du 'gyur ba'i sgrar bshad do //
analyzed: mi skyed pa tsam la 'dir gzhan du 'gyur ba'i sgrar bshad do //
translated: Here, the term ‚Äútransformation‚Äù is explained as mere non-production.

original: ci'i phyir gdon mi za bar bskyed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gdon mi za bar bskyed ce na /
translated: Why is it that they necessarily produce?

original: ngo bo nyid bzlog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid bzlog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the non-reversal of their intrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'di dag gi 'bras bu bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid gnag yin pa de nam yang bzlog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag gi 'bras bu bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid gnag yin pa de nam yang bzlog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the intrinsic reality of these that produces the effect never reverses.

original: bzlog pa ni 'dir bskyed par mi byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'dir bskyed par mi byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Reversal here means not producing.

original: gzhan rang gi bsam pa sgrogs pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gzhan rang gi bsam pa sgrogs pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Anticipating the qualm of others that this is just his own opinion, he says,

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa de dag thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa de dag thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf all of those that are asserted to be co-operating causes . . .‚Äù

original: lhan cig byed pa nyid du mngon bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i khyad par tha ma'i gnas skabs na yod pa de dag thams cad so sro 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa nyid du mngon bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i khyad par tha ma'i gnas skabs na yod pa de dag thams cad so sro 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yin te /
translated: All of those that are asserted to be co-operating causes, the specific causes that exist in the final stage, are able to produce the effect individually.

original: de'i phyir de la gzhan gyi nye bar sbyor ba ci zhig dgos /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gzhan gyi nye bar sbyor ba ci zhig dgos /
translated: Therefore, what need is there for the application of another?

original: gang gis na lhan cig kho nar 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed pa so sor ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis na lhan cig kho nar 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed pa so sor ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs doubt is stated in the words, ‚ÄúBy which one, not individually, produces an effect simultaneously.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: dngos po rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThings do not have such a nature.‚Äù

original: dngos po rnams la ni gang gis na 'di gcig pus kyang 'bras bu bskyed par bya bar nus na bdag cag lhag pas ci zhig bya zhes de snyam du brtags nas /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la ni gang gis na 'di gcig pus kyang 'bras bu bskyed par bya bar nus na bdag cag lhag pas ci zhig bya zhes de snyam du brtags nas /
translated: Things do not have such a nature that one of them is able to produce an effect by itself, so that we think, ‚ÄúWhat is the use of the others?‚Äù

original: gzhan ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bur rtogs par 'gyur ba rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gzhan ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bur rtogs par 'gyur ba rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no one who has the conception, ‚ÄúThe others will be stopped.‚Äù

original: gang dag la rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa'i dang tshul yod pa de dag ni rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag ste /
analyzed: gang dag la rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa'i dang tshul yod pa de dag ni rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag ste /
translated: Those who have the mode of having the conception prior to it are those who have the conception prior to it.

original: rtog pa ni dpyod pa dang sems @125b pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog pa ni dpyod pa dang sems @125b pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Conceptualization is a synonym for investigation and intention.

original: gal te rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag ma yin na 'o na ji ltar rtag tu lhan cig kho nar byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag ma yin na 'o na ji ltar rtag tu lhan cig kho nar byed ce na /
translated: If they do not precede, then how do they always occur simultaneously?

original: de'i phyir sems pa med par byed pa can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems pa med par byed pa can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond, he says, ‚ÄúThey are not accompanied by intention.‚Äù

original: gang dag la sems pa med par byed pa yod pa de dag ni sems pa med par byed pa can //
analyzed: gang dag la sems pa med par byed pa yod pa de dag ni sems pa med par byed pa can //
translated: Those that are not accompanied by intention are those that are not preceded by intention.

original: dag ste / blo sngon du ma gtong bar byed pa can dag bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgal te blo sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag cig ma yin na 'o na ci'i phyir rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag kho na bzhin du gcig tu 'du zhe na /
analyzed: dag ste / blo sngon du ma gtong bar byed pa can dag bya ba'i tha tshig go // gal te blo sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag cig ma yin na 'o na ci'i phyir rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag kho na bzhin du gcig tu 'du zhe na /
translated: They are not preceded by mind, and they are called ‚Äúaction.‚ÄùüîΩIf they are not preceded by mind, then why are they included in the same category as conceptualization, which is preceded by mind?

original: de'i phyir rang gi rgyu yongs su gyur pas 'du ba'i chos can gang yin la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rgyu yongs su gyur pas 'du ba'i chos can gang yin la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond, he says, ‚ÄúThey are included in the same category as conceptualization because they are included in the same category as the cause of conceptualization.‚Äù

original: rang gi 'du ba'i rgyu yongs su gyur pa ni rang gi rgyur yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'du ba'i rgyu yongs su gyur pa ni rang gi rgyur yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The cause of their collection is their cause‚Äôs transformation.

original: gang dag la rang gi rgyu yongs su gyur pas 'du ba'i chos yod pa de dag ni rang gi rgyu yongs su gyur pas 'du ba'i chos can dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la rang gi rgyu yongs su gyur pas 'du ba'i chos yod pa de dag ni rang gi rgyu yongs su gyur pas 'du ba'i chos can dag yin no //
translated: Those that have the quality of being collected through the transformation of their cause are those that have the quality of being collected through the transformation of their cause.

original: 'du ba ni rung ba'i yul du tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'du ba ni rung ba'i yul du tshogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúCollection‚Äù means the coming together in a suitable place.

original: nye ba dang rung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nye ba dang rung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúnear‚Äù and ‚Äúsuitable.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir de dag de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why do they become that way?

original: de'i phyir / de'i rang bzhin las de lta bur 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de'i rang bzhin las de lta bur 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúbecause of the nature of that transformation.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni de'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni de'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of that is the nature of that.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni rung ba'i yul du tshogs nas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni rung ba'i yul du tshogs nas bskyed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means the coming together in a suitable place.

original: de lta bur 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni tshogs shing 'bras bu skyed par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: de lta bur 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni tshogs shing 'bras bu skyed par byed pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThat way‚Äù means the coming together and producing an effect.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag rtog pa sngon du gtong bar byed pa can dag ma yin gyi /
translated: Because they are not those that are preceded by an idea.

original: rang gi rgyu yongs su gyur ba'i dbang po kho nas gcig tu 'du bar gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu yongs su gyur ba'i dbang po kho nas gcig tu 'du bar gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa de'i phyir /
translated: It is only due to the transformation of their causes that the sense faculties come together in one place.

original: rung ba'i yul du tshogs nas skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbang gis 'dus pa rnams 'bras bu skyed par byed pa la ji ste re re kho nas skyed par mi byed ces klan ka btsal bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rung ba'i yul du tshogs nas skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbang gis 'dus pa rnams 'bras bu skyed par byed pa la ji ste re re kho nas skyed par mi byed ces klan ka btsal bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not right to object, ‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt they generate the effect individually due to the nature of the assembly that generates the effect in a suitable object?‚Äù

original: yang de lta ma yin par gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang de lta ma yin par gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, to anticipate the opponent‚Äôs doubt, he says,

original: gal te nus pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te nus pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf they are potent, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te rgyu yongs su gyur pa'i dbang gis 'dus pa rnams mi ldog tu zad na nus pa dag yin pa go ci ste so sor 'bras bu dag gzhan dang gzhan skyed par mi byed par 'bras bu gcig gis yongs su dga' ste /
analyzed: gal te rgyu yongs su gyur pa'i dbang gis 'dus pa rnams mi ldog tu zad na nus pa dag yin pa go ci ste so sor 'bras bu dag gzhan dang gzhan skyed par mi byed par 'bras bu gcig gis yongs su dga' ste /
translated: If the assembly is not averted due to the transformation of the cause, why don‚Äôt the potent individual things generate other effects and instead generate one effect?

original: 'khod ces bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khod ces bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are satisfied‚Äù means the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

original: de kho na la zhes bya ba la sogs @126a * //
analyzed: de kho na la zhes bya ba la sogs @126a * //
translated: The phrase in reality is stated in the root text.

original: pa smos te /
analyzed: pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn reality, etc.

original: de nyid rnam par grol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par grol ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of being liberated from that,

original: gcig bu de nyid bskyed par bya bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gcig bu de nyid bskyed par bya bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat very one, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'bras bu gcig bskyed par nus kyi gzhan ni ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan skyed par mi byed do //üîΩyang gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'bras bu gcig bskyed par nus kyi gzhan ni ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan skyed par mi byed do // yang gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Because it is able to produce one effect in that way, not another, therefore it does not produce another and another.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa ngo bo nyid tha dad pa dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa ngo bo nyid tha dad pa dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Again, anticipating an opportunity for another‚Äôs words, he says, ‚ÄúIf from the eye, etc., co-operators, different in nature, etc.

original: gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa ngo bo nyid tha dad pa rnams 'bras bu gcig pa bskyed pa de'i rgyu'i bye brag las 'bras bu'i bye brag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa ngo bo nyid tha dad pa rnams 'bras bu gcig pa bskyed pa de'i rgyu'i bye brag las 'bras bu'i bye brag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: When the eye, etc., different in nature, produce one effect, then from the difference in cause, there is no difference in effect. This is the doubt of the opponent.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ma yin te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúNo, because, etc.

original: bdag nyid ji lta bu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta bu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the different natures of the individual selves‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams gang gi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gang yin pa de dag nyid ji lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag des 'bras bu khyad par du bya ba la nye bar sbyar ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig byed pa rnams gang gi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gang yin pa de dag nyid ji lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag des 'bras bu khyad par du bya ba la nye bar sbyar ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because the co-operating causes are applied to the particular effect by the particular nature of their own selves,

original: de'i nye bar sbyor ba dag gis bya ba'i khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag 'chol ba med pa'i phyir ji skad smra pa'i nyes bar thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de'i nye bar sbyor ba dag gis bya ba'i khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag 'chol ba med pa'i phyir ji skad smra pa'i nyes bar thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: therefore, because the particular actions of their application are not confused, there is no absurd consequence as you have stated.

original: de'i khyad par ni de'i khyad par te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni de'i khyad par te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe particular of that‚Äù refers to the particular effect.

original: de'i khyad par la nye bar sbyor ba ni de'i khyad par la nye bar sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de'i khyad par la nye bar sbyor ba ni de'i khyad par la nye bar sbyor ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúApplication to the particular of that‚Äù means application to the particular effect.

original: nye bar sbyor ba ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba ni byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúApplication‚Äù means ‚Äúaction.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe particular of that‚Äù means the particular of the effect.

original: de dag gi nye bar sbyor ba ni de'i nye bar sbyor ba dag ste /
analyzed: de dag gi nye bar sbyor ba ni de'i nye bar sbyor ba dag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe application of those‚Äù means the application of the particular of that.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu rnams la bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the causes.

original: nye bar sbyor zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nus pa dag yin te /
analyzed: nye bar sbyor zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nus pa dag yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúapplication‚Äù refers to the potencies.

original: de dag nye bar sbyor ba dag gis bya ba ni de'i nye bar sbyor bas bya ba dag go //
analyzed: de dag nye bar sbyor ba dag gis bya ba ni de'i nye bar sbyor bas bya ba dag go //
translated: The activity of those is the activity of their application.

original: de dag ni de'i nye bar sbyor bas bya ba yang yin la khyad par yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni de'i nye bar sbyor bas bya ba yang yin la khyad par yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: They are the activity of their application and they are the distinctions, so the sentence is to be resolved in this way.

original: de dag 'chol ba med pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag 'chol ba med pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúwithout confusion.‚Äù

original: de la dpe /
analyzed: de la dpe /
translated: The example is stated:

original: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu dang rdza mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu dang rdza mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, it is like a lump of clay and a potter, etc.

original: bum pa la ni 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa khyad par du bya ba kho na las byed do //
analyzed: bum pa la ni 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa khyad par du bya ba kho na las byed do //
translated: A pot is only made by the lump of clay, etc., which are the distinctions.

original: 'jim pa'i gong bu dang rdza mkhan dang skud pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'jim pa'i gong bu dang rdza mkhan dang skud pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The sentence is to be resolved as ‚Äúa lump of clay, a potter, and thread.‚Äù

original: sogs pa smos pas ni chu la sogs pa yongs su ba spu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni chu la sogs pa yongs su ba spu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes water, etc.

original: 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa'i byed pa so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa'i byed pa so sor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the individual functions of the lump of clay and so on, he says:

original: 'jim @126b pa'i gong du las ni 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'jim pa'i gong bus ni bum pa 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa shing la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dug par byed do //üîΩrdza mkhan gyis ni 'jim ngo bo nyid kyis bum pa nyid gsum pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas ril pa spyi blugs la sogs pa las ngo bo nyid tha dad par byed do //
analyzed: 'jim @126b pa'i gong du las ni 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'jim pa'i gong bus ni bum pa 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa shing la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dug par byed do // rdza mkhan gyis ni 'jim ngo bo nyid kyis bum pa nyid gsum pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas ril pa spyi blugs la sogs pa las ngo bo nyid tha dad par byed do //
translated: The lump of clay does not have the nature of a pot, etc.üîΩThe lump of clay makes that which is not of the nature of clay, such as wood, etc., assume the nature of clay, which is different in characteristics.üîΩThe potter makes the pot, which is by nature clay, assume a different nature from that of a ball of clay, etc., by means of the various processes of throwing it on the wheel, etc.

original: skud pas ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ngang gsus pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can de nyid 'khor lo las rnam par phye ba'i ngo bo nyid du byed do //
analyzed: skud pas ni 'jim pa'i bdag nyid ngang gsus pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can de nyid 'khor lo las rnam par phye ba'i ngo bo nyid du byed do //
translated: The thread makes that which is of the nature of clay, which has the form of a ball, a flat dish, etc., assume a nature that is different from that of a wheel, etc.

original: 'jim pa dang dbyibs kyi bye brag ces bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'jim pa dang dbyibs kyi bye brag ces bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe specific shape of clay‚Äù is to be applied to the phrase ‚Äúthe specific shape of clay.‚Äù

original: gang la bdag nyid de dag yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la bdag nyid de dag yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which possesses those two is called ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: de ltar byed pa'i bye brag gis yul tha dad pa nyid du bstan nas ma 'chol ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa'i bye brag gis yul tha dad pa nyid du bstan nas ma 'chol ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having taught that the object is different due to the difference in the action, in order to teach that the action is not mixed, he says,

original: de ltar na rdza mkhan las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gi phyir de ltar byed pa'i yul tha dad pa de'i phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas na 'jim pa kho nas bum pa 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid du byed pa'i rdza mkhan gyis ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na rdza mkhan las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi phyir de ltar byed pa'i yul tha dad pa de'i phyir de ltar bshad pa'i rnam pas na 'jim pa kho nas bum pa 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid du byed pa'i rdza mkhan gyis ni ma yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, the potter does not make the clay into the nature of the potter.‚ÄùüîΩSince the object is different due to the difference in the action, therefore, in that case, the potter does not make the clay into the nature of the potter, because the potter makes the clay into the nature of a pot.

original: rdza mkhan kho nas gsum pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam par byed kyi 'jim pas ni ma yin pas ma 'chol bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rdza mkhan kho nas gsum pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam par byed kyi 'jim pas ni ma yin pas ma 'chol bar grub pa yin no //
translated: Since the potter alone makes the clay into the shape of a pot, and so on, and the clay does not make the potter into the nature of the clay, it is established that the action is not mixed.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan dag gi byed pa'i yul tha dad pa'i phyir bum pa ngo bo nyid gnyis su thal bar 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan dag gi byed pa'i yul tha dad pa'i phyir bum pa ngo bo nyid gnyis su thal bar 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that because the object of the activity of clay and the potter are different, it follows that the pot has two intrinsic natures,

original: de'i phyir / de gnyis kyi nus pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de gnyis kyi nus pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan dag gi nus pa'i khyad par gyis yul tha dad pa'i phyir bum pa ngo bo nyid gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan dag gi nus pa'i khyad par gyis yul tha dad pa'i phyir bum pa ngo bo nyid gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that because the object of the capacity of those two is different, it follows that the pot has two intrinsic natures,

original: 'on kyang de gnyis kyang bskyed pa'i rnam pa bum pa'i khyad par ni ngo bo nyid tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de gnyis kyang bskyed pa'i rnam pa bum pa'i khyad par ni ngo bo nyid tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then even though the object of the capacity of clay and the potter are different, the pot that is generated by those two does not have different intrinsic natures.

original: nus pa'i bye brag ni 'jim pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: nus pa'i bye brag ni 'jim pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in capacity is a difference in clay.

original: de'i yul tha dad pa ni yul sna tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i yul tha dad pa ni yul sna tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: The difference in their objects is the diversity of objects.

original: de dag gis bskyed pa ni des pa bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gis bskyed pa ni des pa bskyed pa ste /
translated: That which is generated by those two is generated by them.

original: 'di ni des bskyed pa yang yin la khyad par yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni des bskyed pa yang yin la khyad par yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Since it is generated by them and it is a difference, the compound is resolved as ‚Äúthat which is generated by them and is a difference.‚Äù

original: de'i bye brag ni des bskyed pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: de'i bye brag ni des bskyed pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag ste /
translated: Its specific types are its particular types, which are generated by it.

original: khyad par zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir rnam pa la bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir rnam pa la bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúparticular‚Äù here refers to a type.

original: bye brag ces bya ba'i sgra @127a * //
analyzed: bye brag ces bya ba'i sgra @127a * //
translated: The term ‚Äútype‚Äù

original: ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: ni khyad par yin no //
translated: is a particular.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na khyad par yang yin la bye brag kyang yin pas khyad par gyi bye brag go //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na khyad par yang yin la bye brag kyang yin pas khyad par gyi bye brag go //
translated: In one sense, it is a particular and a type, so it is a particular type.

original: ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they different in nature?

original: 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of clay and shape,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te 'jim pa dang dbyibs ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid du ma gyur na de'i tshe 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag phan tshun ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir 'jim pa gsus pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam par mi snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te 'jim pa dang dbyibs ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid du ma gyur na de'i tshe 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag phan tshun ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir 'jim pa gsus pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam par mi snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: If clay and shape were not the same in nature, then clay and shape would not appear as mutually different in nature, such as the clay being bulbous and hollow, and so on.

original: dbyibs kyang 'jim pa'i ngo bor snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyibs kyang 'jim pa'i ngo bor snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And shape would not appear as the nature of clay.

original: gang dag la phan tshun gyi bdag nyid yod pa de dag ni phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can dag go //
analyzed: gang dag la phan tshun gyi bdag nyid yod pa de dag ni phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can dag go //
translated: Those that have the nature of mutual dependence are mutually dependent.

original: de'i ngo bo ni phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is mutual dependence.

original: phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can ma yin pa ni phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can ma yin pa nyid de rgyur gyur pa des so //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can ma yin pa ni phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can ma yin pa nyid de rgyur gyur pa des so //
translated: That which is not mutually dependent is non-mutual dependence.

original: 'dir bye brag pa'i lugs kyi dogs pa bsu bar /üîΩgal te dbyibs yon tan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir bye brag pa'i lugs kyi dogs pa bsu bar / gal te dbyibs yon tan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, anticipating the Vai≈õe·π£ika system, he says,üîΩIf shape is a quality, etc.

original: dbyibs zhes bya ba'i yon tan ni rdzas las gzhan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs zhes bya ba'i yon tan ni rdzas las gzhan pa kho na yin no //
translated: The quality called shape is something completely different from substance.

original: de'i phyir rdza mkhan dang 'jim pa'i gong bu dag gi nye bar sbyor ba'i yul gang yin pa de ngo bo nyid tha dad pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdza mkhan dang 'jim pa'i gong bu dag gi nye bar sbyor ba'i yul gang yin pa de ngo bo nyid tha dad pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, the object of the combination of the potter and the lump of clay is something completely different in nature.

original: 'di ltar 'jim pas ni 'jim pa'i rdzas byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jim pas ni 'jim pa'i rdzas byed la /
translated: Thus, the clay makes the substance of clay,

original: rdza mkhan gyis ni dbyibs zhes bya ba'i yon tan byed pas yul tha dad pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyis ni dbyibs zhes bya ba'i yon tan byed pas yul tha dad pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: 'di la bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis has already been explained.‚Äù

original: 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can ma yin pa nyid kyi de gnyis dbyibs dang 'jim pa'i ngo bo dag tu mi snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag phan tshun gyi bdag nyid can ma yin pa nyid kyi de gnyis dbyibs dang 'jim pa'i ngo bo dag tu mi snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since clay and shape are not mutually identical, it follows that those two do not appear as the entities of shape and clay.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang /üîΩ'jim pa las dbyibs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang / 'jim pa las dbyibs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate another reason, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúMoreover, if shape is different from clay, why does the potter not make it separately?‚Äù

original: gal te dbyibs de 'jim pa las gzhan pa zhig yin na ci ste rdza mkhan gyis logs shig mi byed /
analyzed: gal te dbyibs de 'jim pa las gzhan pa zhig yin na ci ste rdza mkhan gyis logs shig mi byed /
translated: If that shape were different from clay, why would the potter not make it separately?

original: gang dag tha dad pa de dag ni res 'ga' logs shig tu yang byed de /
analyzed: gang dag tha dad pa de dag ni res 'ga' logs shig tu yang byed de /
translated: Those that are different are sometimes made separately.

original: de dag logs shig tu mi bya ba gdon mi za ba can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag logs shig tu mi bya ba gdon mi za ba can ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not certain that they are not made separately.

original: de la bye brag pa'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu bar gal te yon tan ni rdzas kyi gzhan gyi dbang yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la bye brag pa'i lan gyi dogs pa bsu bar gal te yon tan ni rdzas kyi gzhan gyi dbang yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to the Vai≈õe·π£ika‚Äôs reply, the text says, ‚ÄúIf qualities are dependent on substance,‚Äù and so on.

original: yon tan ni dus thams cad du rdzas kyi gzhan gyi dbang yin no //
analyzed: yon tan ni dus thams cad du rdzas kyi gzhan gyi dbang yin no //
translated: Qualities are always dependent on substance.

original: de'i @127b phyir na logs shig tu bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i @127b phyir na logs shig tu bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, they cannot be posited separately.

original: 'di ltar yon tan gyi mtshan nyid ni rdzas la brten pa nyid du brjod pa yin na de ji ltar rdzas la mi ltos par logs shig tu byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yon tan gyi mtshan nyid ni rdzas la brten pa nyid du brjod pa yin na de ji ltar rdzas la mi ltos par logs shig tu byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: The reason is that the definition of a quality is said to be that which is dependent on substance. How could it be posited separately without depending on substance? This is the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: bye brag ba kho nas sangs rgyas pa'i klan ka'i dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: bye brag ba kho nas sangs rgyas pa'i klan ka'i dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika anticipates the Buddhist‚Äôs objection.

original: gal te rang bzhin gyi rdzas de dbyibs de'i rten gyi bdag nyid can yin pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyi rdzas de dbyibs de'i rten gyi bdag nyid can yin pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the substance that is the intrinsic nature is the nature of the support of that shape, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin kho nas bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas de gsus pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dbyibs kyi rten gyi ngo bo nyid gcig yin pa 'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin kho nas bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas de gsus pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dbyibs kyi rten gyi ngo bo nyid gcig yin pa 'am /
translated: When the substance of a vase, etc., is by its very nature the entity that is the basis of the shape of its parts, such as its belly and its mouth,

original: dbyibs de lta bu'i de bum pa'i rdzas la rag las pa zhig yin pa de'i tshe de la rdza mkhan gyi byed pa la ltos ci dgos /
analyzed: dbyibs de lta bu'i de bum pa'i rdzas la rag las pa zhig yin pa de'i tshe de la rdza mkhan gyi byed pa la ltos ci dgos /
translated: or when that shape depends on the substance of the vase, then what need is there to rely on the activity of a potter?

original: rang kho nas ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam ba ni klan ka ba'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: rang kho nas ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam ba ni klan ka ba'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: Why would it not be so by itself? This is the thought of the opponent.

original: de yang yin la dbyibs kyang yin pas dbyibs de'o //
analyzed: de yang yin la dbyibs kyang yin pas dbyibs de'o //
translated: It is that, and it is a shape, so it is that shape.

original: de'i rten ni dbyibs de'i rten no //
analyzed: de'i rten ni dbyibs de'i rten no //
translated: Its basis is the basis of that shape.

original: 'di la dbyibs de'i rten gyi bdag nyid yod pas 'di ni dbyibs de'i rten gyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'di la dbyibs de'i rten gyi bdag nyid yod pas 'di ni dbyibs de'i rten gyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: It has the nature of being the basis of that shape, so it has the nature of being the basis of that shape.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bum pa la yod pa'i dbyibs yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bum pa la yod pa'i dbyibs yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the shape that exists in the vase.

original: de la rag lus pa ni de la rag lus pa'o //
analyzed: de la rag lus pa ni de la rag lus pa'o //
translated: It depends on that, so it depends on that.

original: 'di la de la rag lus pa'i bdag nyid yod pas 'di ni de la rag lus pa'i bdag nyid can de /
analyzed: 'di la de la rag lus pa'i bdag nyid yod pas 'di ni de la rag lus pa'i bdag nyid can de /
translated: Since it has a nature that depends on that, it has a nature that depends on that.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdzas dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdzas dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word that is connected with substance.

original: bye brag pas de ltar pha rol po'i klan ka la dogs par byas na lan du ma yin te /
analyzed: bye brag pas de ltar pha rol po'i klan ka la dogs par byas na lan du ma yin te /
translated: If the Vaise~ika suspects that the argument is like this, then the reply is:

original: de las phan tshun zhes bya ba la smos te /
analyzed: de las phan tshun zhes bya ba la smos te /
translated: Not so, because of mutual dependence.

original: gang gi phyir bum pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas gang yin pa dang / gsus pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par gang yin pa 'di gnyi ga yang rdza mkhan las phan tshun 'brel du rung ba nyid thob pa de'i phyir rdza mkhan la ltos te 'brel pa ni 'dir rten dang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin par
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas gang yin pa dang / gsus pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par gang yin pa 'di gnyi ga yang rdza mkhan las phan tshun 'brel du rung ba nyid thob pa de'i phyir rdza mkhan la ltos te 'brel pa ni 'dir rten dang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin par
translated: Since the substance called pot and the particular features such as bulbousness are both obtained as mutually suitable in dependence on the potter, the dependence on the potter is considered here to be the characteristic of support and basis.

original: bsam pa'o // rdza mkhan la ma ltos na yang nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: bsam pa'o // rdza mkhan la ma ltos na yang nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If it does not depend on the potter, what is the fault?

original: de'i phyir de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not so.

original: dngos po'i chos nyid kho nas sngon yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po'i chos nyid kho nas sngon yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Vaise~ika says:

original: gal te phan tshun 'brel du rung ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir rdza mkhan la ma ltos te /üîΩde'i tshe dngos po'i chos nyid kho nas sngon yang 'jim pa'i rdzas su gsus pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad bar dang @128a * //
analyzed: gal te phan tshun 'brel du rung ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir rdza mkhan la ma ltos te / de'i tshe dngos po'i chos nyid kho nas sngon yang 'jim pa'i rdzas su gsus pa dang khong che ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i khyad bar dang @128a * //
translated: It is not that the potter is not needed in order to make the clay suitable for mutual connection.üîΩIf the clay were suitable for mutual connection by the mere nature of things, then it would be suitable for connection with such a shape as a pot, a bowl, and so on, even before the potter had made it.

original: 'brel du rung ba nyid gcig yin na ni de lta bu'i dbyibs dang 'brel par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'i klan ka'i lan yin no //
analyzed: 'brel du rung ba nyid gcig yin na ni de lta bu'i dbyibs dang 'brel par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'i klan ka'i lan yin no //
translated: This is the response to the Vaise~ika critique.

original: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: Here the Vaibhaika proponent of the tenets says:

original: 'di ltar yin na ni 'o na rdzas 'jim pa'i rung ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yin na ni 'o na rdzas 'jim pa'i rung ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If that is so, then the clay that is suitable for a pot,

original: gal te phan tshun 'brel du rung ba nyid du byas pa'i phyir rdza mkhan la ltos na /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun 'brel du rung ba nyid du byas pa'i phyir rdza mkhan la ltos na /
translated: if the clay is suitable for mutual connection because it depends on the potter, then it is not suitable for mutual connection by the mere nature of things.

original: de lta na ni 'o na rdzas 'jim pa'i rung ba nyid de ni rdza mkhan kho nas byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na rdzas 'jim pa'i rung ba nyid de ni rdza mkhan kho nas byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that the suitability of clay as a substance is created only by the potter.

original: rdza 'jim pa dang rung ba nyid la 'di gnyis ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rdza 'jim pa dang rung ba nyid la 'di gnyis ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And these two, clay and suitability, are not different in nature.

original: gal te 'di gnyis ngo bo nyid tha dad par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe snga ma bzhin du rung ba nyid rdzas las logs shig tu byed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di gnyis ngo bo nyid tha dad par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe snga ma bzhin du rung ba nyid rdzas las logs shig tu byed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If these two were to become different in nature, then, as before, it would follow that suitability would be created separately from the substance.

original: gal te rung ba nyid kyang yon tan yin pa'i phyir logs shig pa ma yin par grub bo zhes smra na /
analyzed: gal te rung ba nyid kyang yon tan yin pa'i phyir logs shig pa ma yin par grub bo zhes smra na /
translated: If you say that suitability is not established as separate because it is a quality,

original: de'i tshe de yang dngos po'i chos nyid kho na sngon yang 'brel par 'gyur du 'ong bas rdzas dang lhan cig 'brel du rung ba nyid la yang rung ba nyid gzhan zhig rdza mkhan las 'gyur bar 'dod par bya dgos la /
analyzed: de'i tshe de yang dngos po'i chos nyid kho na sngon yang 'brel par 'gyur du 'ong bas rdzas dang lhan cig 'brel du rung ba nyid la yang rung ba nyid gzhan zhig rdza mkhan las 'gyur bar 'dod par bya dgos la /
translated: then at that time, since it would be the intrinsic reality of an entity, it would have to be related to it previously. Therefore, since it would be suitable to be related to the substance, you would have to assert that another suitability would come from the potter.

original: de yang logs shig tu byed par thal bar 'gyur bas rdzas las ngo bo nyid gzhan ma yin par 'dod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de yang logs shig tu byed par thal bar 'gyur bas rdzas las ngo bo nyid gzhan ma yin par 'dod par bya dgos te /
translated: But since it would follow that it would be something separate, it must be accepted that it is not a different entity from substance.

original: de la yang de'i shags kyang yang de kho na yin la /
analyzed: de la yang de'i shags kyang yang de kho na yin la /
translated: But in that case, the argument would be just that, and the response would be just that, so it would follow that there would be no end to it.

original: lan yang de kho na yin pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rdzas 'jim pa dang / rung ba nyid gdon mi za bar ngo bo nyid tha dad par khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: lan yang de kho na yin pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rdzas 'jim pa dang / rung ba nyid gdon mi za bar ngo bo nyid tha dad par khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it is definitely necessary to accept that substance and suitability are different entities.

original: de lta yin na ci zhig grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na ci zhig grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what is established?

original: de'i phyir / re zhig ngo bo nyid gcig la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / re zhig ngo bo nyid gcig la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain that, he says, ‚ÄúFirst, even if they are the same entity,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid yin yang gcig la rkyen du mas khyad par nyid du khyab pa yin pa de'i tshe kho bo'i phyogs grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid yin yang gcig la rkyen du mas khyad par nyid du khyab pa yin pa de'i tshe kho bo'i phyogs grub pa ma yin te /
translated: When even if they are the same entity, one is pervaded by many conditions, at that time my position is not established.

original: de'i phyir kho bo 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag ngo bo nyid gcig tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ha cang 'bad de ci rung /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo 'jim pa dang dbyibs dag ngo bo nyid gcig tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ha cang 'bad de ci rung /
translated: Therefore, what is the point of my exerting myself too much to prove that clay and shape are the same entity?

original: gal te rung ba nyid la brten na yang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid gcig pa la yang rkyen du mas khyad par nyid du bya bar 'grub pas rdzas dang yon tan du smra bas gsal ba 'dir cung zad kyang mi dgos te /
analyzed: gal te rung ba nyid la brten na yang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid gcig pa la yang rkyen du mas khyad par nyid du bya bar 'grub pas rdzas dang yon tan du smra bas gsal ba 'dir cung zad kyang mi dgos te /
translated: Even if it were suitable, since it is established that a single entity of an effect is made distinct by many conditions, the proponents of substance and quality do not need to do anything at all in this context.

original: de ni gzhan nas bsal ba byas zin pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //üîΩde ltar 'bras bu gcig la rgyu rnam gnyis nye ngar sbyar ba tha dad pa nyid @128b du bsgrubs nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni gzhan nas bsal ba byas zin pa kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o // de ltar 'bras bu gcig la rgyu rnam gnyis nye ngar sbyar ba tha dad pa nyid @128b du bsgrubs nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: This is because it has already been refuted elsewhere.üîΩHaving thus established that the two causes of a single effect are applied in close proximity, in order to summarize this, he says:

original: des na dngos su 'bras bu ngo bo nyid gcig yin yang lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na dngos su 'bras bu ngo bo nyid gcig yin yang lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, even though the entity of the effect is one, it is called coemergent.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rkyen rnams kyis byed pa'i yul tha dad par bsgrub pa'i rgyu des na dngos su 'bras bu ngo bo nyid gcig yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rkyen rnams kyis byed pa'i yul tha dad par bsgrub pa'i rgyu des na dngos su 'bras bu ngo bo nyid gcig yin mod kyi /
translated: Because of that reason, the object of activity of the conditions is established as distinct. Therefore, although the effect is actually of a single nature,

original: 'on kyang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi nye bar sbyor ba'i yul gcig ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi nye bar sbyor ba'i yul gcig ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: nevertheless, it is not the case that the object of activity of the assembled co-arisen conditions is one. Thus, it is established.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i ngang tshul can dag ni byed pa dag go //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i ngang tshul can dag ni byed pa dag go //
translated: Those that have the nature of co-arisen conditions are the agents.

original: 'di dag nye bar sbyor ba'i yul gcig pa yod pas 'di dag ni nye bar sbyor ba'i yul gcig pa can no //
analyzed: 'di dag nye bar sbyor ba'i yul gcig pa yod pas 'di dag ni nye bar sbyor ba'i yul gcig pa can no //
translated: Since the object of activity of their assembly exists, they are those that have the object of activity of the assembly.

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'o //
translated: The negation is ‚Äúnot.‚Äù

original: dngos su zhes bya ba ni don dam par rdzas su na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos su zhes bya ba ni don dam par rdzas su na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúActually‚Äù means ultimately, substantially, that is the meaning.

original: de ltar phyi'i dngos po dag la rgyu rnams nye bar sbyor ba'i yul tha dad par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i dngos po dag la rgyu rnams nye bar sbyor ba'i yul tha dad par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that the object of activity of the assembled causes is distinct in regard to external things,

original: nang gi dag dang mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nang gi dag dang mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that they are similar in regard to internal things, he says:

original: ji ltar 'dir rgyu tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir rgyu tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúHere, the different causes . . . ‚Äù

original: ji ltar dpe la rgyu tha dad pa rnams khyad par tha dad pa dag la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa dag ma yin pa de bzhin du mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa skyed pa la yang 'bras bu tha dad pa dag tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dpe la rgyu tha dad pa rnams khyad par tha dad pa dag la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa dag ma yin pa de bzhin du mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa skyed pa la yang 'bras bu tha dad pa dag tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as in the example, the different causes are not the same effect because they are applied to different differences. In the same way, eye, form, light, and attention, and the consciousness that arises from them, should be seen as different effects.

original: nye bar sbyor ba'i yul tha dad pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba'i yul tha dad pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the different objects of application are just that,

original: 'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThus, from the similar and immediately antecedent condition . . . ‚Äù

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis ni rnam par shes pa rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du byed do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis ni rnam par shes pa rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du byed do //
translated: The similar and immediately antecedent condition makes the consciousness the nature of conceptualization.

original: mig gi dbang pos ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo gzugs 'dzin du rung ba nyid du nges par byed do //
analyzed: mig gi dbang pos ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo gzugs 'dzin du rung ba nyid du nges par byed do //
translated: The eye faculty makes the nature of conceptualization suitable to apprehend form.

original: yul gyis ni bdag gi ngo bo dang 'dra bar byed do //
analyzed: yul gyis ni bdag gi ngo bo dang 'dra bar byed do //
translated: The object determines the nature of the self.

original: rgyu rkyen gyis ni dge ba la sogs pa nyid du nges par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen gyis ni dge ba la sogs pa nyid du nges par byed do //
translated: Causes and conditions determine the self as virtuous and so on.

original: gzugs la 'dzin par rung ba nyid ni gzugs 'dzin du rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la 'dzin par rung ba nyid ni gzugs 'dzin du rung ba nyid do //
translated: The suitability of apprehending form is the suitability of apprehending form.

original: der so sor nges pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: der so sor nges pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the determination of that.

original: 'di la de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo yod pas 'di ni de dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo can no ;
