translated: The term ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúeffect.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba /
translated: The Proponents of the Tenets say,

original: dam ba ltar co 'dri ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dam ba ltar co 'dri ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause you are just making noise,üîΩyou are not refuting our position.‚ÄùüîΩIn response to that, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúIf you say that

original: 'di yang yod bde na na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩkye bden na khyod kyang 'di skad du gang gis na rtag par 'dod pa'i rgyu de dag 'bras bu skyed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i rkyen mtha' dag dang ldan pa'i rgyu de rnams 'bras bu mi bskyed par btang snyoms
analyzed: 'di yang yod bde na na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / kye bden na khyod kyang 'di skad du gang gis na rtag par 'dod pa'i rgyu de dag 'bras bu skyed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i rkyen mtha' dag dang ldan pa'i rgyu de rnams 'bras bu mi bskyed par btang snyoms
translated: they exist, etc.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúOh, if you say that they exist, then you should say that the nature of theüîΩcauses that you maintain to be permanent is to give rise to effects.  But youüîΩsay that they are indifferent to giving rise to effects, even though they are

original: su 'khod do zhes smra ba /
analyzed: su 'khod do zhes smra ba /
translated: endowed with all the conditions other than that!‚Äù

original: btang snyoms su khyod pa ni gyi na 'dug pa bsten pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms su khyod pa ni gyi na 'dug pa bsten pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIndifference‚Äù means that you are just sitting there.

original: khyod kyis de skad brjod pas phan pa mang po mtshar btags mod kyi /
analyzed: khyod kyis de skad brjod pas phan pa mang po mtshar btags mod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúYou say that, but you have not said anything useful!‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúWell, then, you should ask just this much: ‚ÄòWhy don‚Äôt they give rise to

original: 'on kyang ci de dag gi mi sdod par skyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di tsam zhig ni dri bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ci de dag gi mi sdod par skyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di tsam zhig ni dri bar bya dgos te /
translated: effects all the time?‚Äô‚Äù

original: rtag par 'dod pa'i rgyu de dag gi mi sdod par bskyed pa'i chos can gyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni tha ma'i gnas skabs de kho na'i tshe 'byung ngam /
analyzed: rtag par 'dod pa'i rgyu de dag gi mi sdod par bskyed pa'i chos can gyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni tha ma'i gnas skabs de kho na'i tshe 'byung ngam /
translated: The nature of those causes that are asserted to be permanent is that which generates without abiding. Does that occur only at the time of the final state?

original: 'on te sngon yang yod /
analyzed: 'on te sngon yang yod /
translated: Or does it also exist previously?

original: 'di la mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di la mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it has the nature of generating without abiding‚Äù should be applied here.

original: bshol ba med par bskyed pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bshol ba med par bskyed pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwithout delay‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúhaving the nature of generating without abiding.‚Äù

original: pha rol pos khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol pos khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the opponent asserts that,

original: yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that ‚Äúit exists.‚Äù

original: de 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid de ni sngon yang yod do //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid de ni sngon yang yod do //
translated: That nature exists previously as well.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su mnyams ma byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su mnyams ma byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, the reason is stated: ‚Äúbecause it does not arise anew.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir dngos po gang dag la nyams pa yang cung zad kyang med /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po gang dag la nyams pa yang cung zad kyang med /
translated: Because there is not the slightest deterioration in any thing,

original: 'byung ba yang med pa brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid can de dag la ni rnams kyang ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di 'gal ba de'i phyir sngon yang yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba yang med pa brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid can de dag la ni rnams kyang ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di 'gal ba de'i phyir sngon yang yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and they are also not arising, they are not established as having any nature at all.

original: nyams pa dang byung ba ni nyams pa dang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nyams pa dang byung ba ni nyams pa dang 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDestruction and arising‚Äù means destruction and arising.

original: de dgag pa ni ma nyams pa ma byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dgag pa ni ma nyams pa ma byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The negation of that is ‚Äúnon-destruction and non-arising.‚Äù

original: gang dag la mnyams ma byung ba brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid yod pa de dag ni mnyams ma byung ba brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid can rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag la mnyams ma byung ba brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid yod pa de dag ni mnyams ma byung ba brtan pa gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid can rnams so //
translated: Those that have non-destruction and non-arising, which are the nature of a single, stable entity, are ‚Äúthose that have non-destruction and non-arising, which are the nature of a single, stable entity.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa rnams la yang skad cig ma gcig la nyams pa dang byung ba nyid med pas /
analyzed: mi rtag pa rnams la yang skad cig ma gcig la nyams pa dang byung ba nyid med pas /
translated: Since impermanent things do not have destruction and arising in a single moment,

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the word ‚Äústable‚Äù is stated.

original: rgyun gyis kyang brtan pa nyid du rtogs pas de'i phyir gcig pu zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyun gyis kyang brtan pa nyid du rtogs pas de'i phyir gcig pu zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since it is understood that they are stable by way of continuum, therefore the word ‚Äúsingle‚Äù is stated.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ni ci dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ni ci dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Proponent of the Tenets says, ‚ÄúWhat is that?‚Äù

original: mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid sngon yang yod la skyed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba @134b khyod kyi tshig 'di ni ma yang yin la /
analyzed: mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid sngon yang yod la skyed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba @134b khyod kyi tshig 'di ni ma yang yin la /
translated: It is not tenable to say that the entity of that which is not enduring is that which is generated, but it is not generated.

original: mo gsham yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mo gsham yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di dang 'dra'o //
translated: Your statement is like saying ‚ÄúIt is a mother, but she is barren.‚Äù

original: de la 'di snyam du 'di ni de dang 'dra ba ma yin no snyam de sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'di ni de dang 'dra ba ma yin no snyam de sems na /
translated: If you think that this is not similar to that,

original: de'i phyir / mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the response is, ‚ÄúThe entity of that which is not enduring is that which is generated,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te 'di de dang 'dra ba ma yin na de'i tsho mi sdod par skyed par zhes bya ba 'di'i don ci yin pa dang mi skyed do zhes bya ba 'di'i don yang ci yin par brjod dgos so //üîΩpha rol po'i gzhung gi dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gal te 'di de dang 'dra ba ma yin na de'i tsho mi sdod par skyed par zhes bya ba 'di'i don ci yin pa dang mi skyed do zhes bya ba 'di'i don yang ci yin par brjod dgos so // pha rol po'i gzhung gi dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: If this is not similar to that, then you must explain what the meaning is of ‚Äúthat which is generated, but not enduring,‚Äù and what the meaning is of ‚Äúnot generated.‚Äù

original: gal te de'i ngo bo nyid ni lhan cig pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te de'i ngo bo nyid ni lhan cig pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to the opponent‚Äôs position, it is said, ‚ÄúIf its entity is simultaneous,‚Äù and so on.

original: mi sdod par 'bras bu skyed pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang lhan cig pa yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: mi sdod par 'bras bu skyed pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang lhan cig pa yin par 'dod kyi /
translated: But it is maintained that the cause that generates the effect without remaining is simultaneous with the condition that is a cooperative condition.

original: de dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not separate from that.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: 'on na ni 'ba' zhig kyang gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs smos te /
analyzed: 'on na ni 'ba' zhig kyang gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs smos te /
translated: But if it is simultaneous with that, it is also simultaneous with something else, etc.

original: gal te de'i ngo bo nyid lhan cig pa yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ni /
analyzed: gal te de'i ngo bo nyid lhan cig pa yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no // 'o na ni /
translated: If the nature of that cause is simultaneous with the effect, it is not alone.üîΩBut if it is simultaneous with something else,

original: bye ma 'ba' zhig kyang gzhan la lhan cig pa yang gzhan no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bye ma 'ba' zhig kyang gzhan la lhan cig pa yang gzhan no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: it is also simultaneous with something else.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe definition of a different thing, etc.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa ni thams cad du ngo bo nyid sna tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni thams cad du ngo bo nyid sna tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Difference is defined as having a variety of natures.

original: yang tshul gzhan gyis dus thams cad du 'bras bu skyed par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang tshul gzhan gyis dus thams cad du 'bras bu skyed par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to demonstrate that it follows that the cause would always generate the effect, he says,

original: lhan cig ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lhan cig ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is simultaneous with that, etc.

original: dngos po lhan cig byed pa dang lhan cig pa yin na yang rang gi ngo bo kho nas byed kyi /
analyzed: dngos po lhan cig byed pa dang lhan cig pa yin na yang rang gi ngo bo kho nas byed kyi /
translated: Even though the thing is simultaneous with the co-operating causes, it produces only by its own nature,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin la /
translated: not by the nature of another.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo ni sngon yang de kho nar zad do //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo ni sngon yang de kho nar zad do //
translated: And the nature of the thing is just what it was before.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar nes 'ga' skyed pa dang 'bras bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar nes 'ga' skyed pa dang 'bras bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, how could it ever produce anything?

original: ngo bo nyid da lta bu dang ldan pa ni dus thams cad du 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid da lta bu dang ldan pa ni dus thams cad du 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that that which possesses a nature like that will always produce an effect.

original: pha rol pos mtshungs pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /üîΩgang gi dngos po skad cig ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pha rol pos mtshungs pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir / gang gi dngos po skad cig ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opponent says that the example is the same as the case in question.üîΩIn response, the master says, ‚ÄúEven for those who say that things are momentary,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po skad cig ma yin par smra ba'i ltar na yang /
analyzed: dngos po skad cig ma yin par smra ba'i ltar na yang /
translated: Even for those who say that things are momentary,

original: ji ste 'ba' zhig gis mi skyed /
analyzed: ji ste 'ba' zhig gis mi skyed /
translated: if it does not produce by itself,üîΩthen it will not produce even when it is together with the co-operating causes.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the tenets says,

original: gal te yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is the case that it does not produce by itself,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te 'ba' zhig yin par 'gyur na 'ba' zhig gis kyang 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'ba' zhig yin par 'gyur na 'ba' zhig gis kyang 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to exist as a single thing, then even a single thing would generate an effect.

original: pha rol pos ci ste ma yin /
analyzed: pha rol pos ci ste ma yin /
translated: Why wouldn‚Äôt it be?

original: @135a * // ci'i phyir 'ba' zhig ma yin pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: @135a * // ci'i phyir 'ba' zhig ma yin pa brjod dgos so //
translated: Why must it be said that it is not a single thing?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩ'di'i lhan cig byed pa dang ldan cig pa'i rang gi ngo bo skad cig ma gang yin pa de nyid 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / 'di'i lhan cig byed pa dang ldan cig pa'i rang gi ngo bo skad cig ma gang yin pa de nyid 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is momentary.‚ÄùüîΩThe nature of this thing that possesses its assemblage of causes and conditions is momentary.

original: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo'i skad cig ma dang po yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo'i skad cig ma dang po yin no //
translated: That very thing is the first moment of its own nature.

original: de'i phyir / rang gi ngo bo skad cig mar nges pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rang gi ngo bo skad cig mar nges pa yin /
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that its nature is momentary.

original: ji ltar 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: How could it be a single thing?

original: de la 'di snyam du dngos po skad cig ma gcig la 'byung ba can 'bras bu skyed do zhes bya ba 'di yang sgrub dgos so snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du dngos po skad cig ma gcig la 'byung ba can 'bras bu skyed do zhes bya ba 'di yang sgrub dgos so snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it must be established that an effect is generated by a single momentary thing,

original: de'i phyir / ji lta bu zhig skyed pa ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ji lta bu zhig skyed pa ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúHow it generates is explained.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma gcig tu gnas pa ji ltar 'bras bu skyed pa de ltar gong du de dag kyang sngon yang med phyis kyang med /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig tu gnas pa ji ltar 'bras bu skyed pa de ltar gong du de dag kyang sngon yang med phyis kyang med /
translated: Just as it is that which endures for one moment generates an effect, so too, they also do not exist before or after,üîΩand they do not have a different nature.

original: tha dad pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i gar skabs der bshad zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i gar skabs der bshad zin pa nyid do //
translated: This is explained in the section that states, ‚ÄúThey do not have a different nature.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe de ltar yin pa de'i tshe dngos po nus pa dang ldan pa chod pa med par 'bras bu skyed pa skad cig ma gcig la 'byung ba'i chos can de ji ltar sngon nam phyis sam tha da par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar yin pa de'i tshe dngos po nus pa dang ldan pa chod pa med par 'bras bu skyed pa skad cig ma gcig la 'byung ba'i chos can de ji ltar sngon nam phyis sam tha da par 'gyur /
translated: When it is like that, then how could an entity that possesses the ability to generate an effect, which arises in one moment without obstruction, be prior, subsequent, or different?

original: 'di la skad cig ma gcig kho na las byung ba'i ngang tshul yod pas skad cig ma gcig la 'byung ba can no //
analyzed: 'di la skad cig ma gcig kho na las byung ba'i ngang tshul yod pas skad cig ma gcig la 'byung ba can no //
translated: Since it has a nature that arises from only one moment, it arises in one moment.

original: glegs bam la la las ni skad cig ma de la 'byung ba can zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: glegs bam la la las ni skad cig ma de la 'byung ba can zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In some texts, it reads, ‚Äúthat which arises in that moment.‚Äù

original: de ni 'di skad ci 'di la mngon par 'dod pa'i skad cig ma de kho na la 'byung ba'i ngang tshul yod pas sdang cig ma de la 'byung ba can zhes tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad ci 'di la mngon par 'dod pa'i skad cig ma de kho na la 'byung ba'i ngang tshul yod pas sdang cig ma de la 'byung ba can zhes tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: That is to be construed as follows: ‚ÄúThat which has the mode of existence of arising in just that moment that is desired is one that arises in that moment.‚Äù

original: sngon dang phyis dang so so ni 'dir gzhan du 'gyur pa'i sgrar bshad do //
analyzed: sngon dang phyis dang so so ni 'dir gzhan du 'gyur pa'i sgrar bshad do //
translated: Here, ‚Äúprior,‚Äù ‚Äúsubsequent,‚Äù and ‚Äúindividually‚Äù are explained as terms for ‚Äúother.‚Äù

original: de la 'di snyam du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs bar ma gyur pa rnams sngon yod pa dang tshogs pa las bkar te so so dang phyis yod pa zhes bya ba gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba kho na'i snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs bar ma gyur pa rnams sngon yod pa dang tshogs pa las bkar te so so dang phyis yod pa zhes bya ba gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba kho na'i snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the collection of seeds, etc., which has not yet come into existence, is prior, and that which is distinguished from the collection is subsequent, and that which is individually distinguished is individually existent, and that only that which is seen as other is a transformation,

original: de'i phyir / gang zhig 'gyur ba de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang zhig 'gyur ba de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this point: That which transforms is not that which is produced without obstruction.

original: tshogs par ma gyur pa gang yin pa dang tshogs pa las bkar te /
analyzed: tshogs par ma gyur pa gang yin pa dang tshogs pa las bkar te /
translated: That which is not in a collection and that which is distinguished from a collection

original: so sor byed pa gang yin pa de ni mi thogs par skyed pa'i chos can de nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor byed pa gang yin pa de ni mi thogs par skyed pa'i chos can de nyid ma yin no //
translated: and that which is individually distinguished is not that which has the property of producing without obstruction.

original: de'i phyir dngos po skad cig ma ci ste 'ba' zhig mi skyed ci ste 'ba' zhig ma yin zhes thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po skad cig ma ci ste 'ba' zhig mi skyed ci ste 'ba' zhig ma yin zhes thal bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, why would a thing not generate only a momentary effect? Why would it not generate only a non-momentary effect?

original: ba smras ba gang yin pa @135b de bsal bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ba smras ba gang yin pa @135b de bsal bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The consequence that you have stated should be understood as refuted.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su /
translated: Here, in order to state the reason, he says,

original: byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äúof the active and non-active,‚Äù and so on.

original: byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan kho na yin gyi /
translated: The nature of the active is one thing,

original: byed pa po ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan yin la /
translated: the nature of the non-active is another,

original: rgyu yang byed pa po'i yang gzhan kho na yin la byed pa po ma yin pa'i yang gzhan kho na yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yang byed pa po'i yang gzhan kho na yin la byed pa po ma yin pa'i yang gzhan kho na yin no //
translated: and the cause of the active is one thing, the cause of the non-active is another.

original: de la byed pa po ni skad cig ma tha ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la byed pa po ni skad cig ma tha ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, the active is the final moment.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa ni nye ba'i tha ma pa'i skad cig ma la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa ni nye ba'i tha ma pa'i skad cig ma la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The non-active is the penultimate moment and so on.

original: de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga la brten yang tha dad pa brjod par 'dod pa med par gcig pa nyid du bshad la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga la brten yang tha dad pa brjod par 'dod pa med par gcig pa nyid du bshad la /
translated: The nature of that itself is explained as being the same, without the desire to express a difference, even though it is based on both.

original: de bzhin du de gnyis kyi rgyu gang yin pa de yang snga ma bzhin gcig pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du de gnyis kyi rgyu gang yin pa de yang snga ma bzhin gcig pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: In the same way, the cause of those two is explained as being the same, as before.

original: ngo bo nyid dang de'i rgyu ni ngo bo nyi dang de'i rgyu dag ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang de'i rgyu ni ngo bo nyi dang de'i rgyu dag ste /
translated: The nature and its cause are the nature and its cause.

original: byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa dag gi ngo bo nyid dag kyang 'gal ba'i phyir la byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa dag gi rgyu dag kyang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa dag gi ngo bo nyid dag kyang 'gal ba'i phyir la byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa dag gi rgyu dag kyang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The natures of the agent and non-agent are also contradictory, and the causes of the agent and non-agent are also contradictory.üîΩThis is what it means.

original: 'di skad du byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid tha ma gang yin pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid kho nas mug thogs su 'bras bu skyed par byed la /
analyzed: 'di skad du byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid tha ma gang yin pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid kho nas mug thogs su 'bras bu skyed par byed la /
translated: This is said: The final nature of the agent produces the effect immediately after it, by that very nature.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid nye ba'i tha ma la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang de nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma tha ma bzhin du mi sdod par bya ba byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid nye ba'i tha ma la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang de nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma tha ma bzhin du mi sdod par bya ba byed pa ma yin no //
translated: And that which is not an agent by nature, such as the final moment of consciousness, does not perform its function, like the final moment of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu de nyid chos can gcig la 'gal bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu de nyid chos can gcig la 'gal bas /
translated: Therefore, since such things are mutually exclusive with respect to a single basis,

original: ci ste 'ba' zhig gis mi skyed ces bya ba'i thal ba 'di bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: ci ste 'ba' zhig gis mi skyed ces bya ba'i thal ba 'di bsal ba yin no //
translated: the reductio argument ‚ÄúIf it does not give rise to itself, how could it give rise to others?‚Äù is resolved.

original: de bzhin du de'i rgyu dag kyang byed pa po skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni byed pa po skyed par byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rgyu dag kyang byed pa po skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni byed pa po skyed par byed la /
translated: In the same way, the causes of that which is an agent are also of two types: that which is the nature of giving rise to an agent gives rise to an agent,

original: byed pa po ma yin pa skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de yang cig shos skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de yang cig shos skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: and that which is the nature of giving rise to a nonagent gives rise to the other.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu dag chos can gcig la 'gal bas ci ste 'ba' zhig ma yin zhes bya ba'i thal ba 'di yang bsal to zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu dag chos can gcig la 'gal bas ci ste 'ba' zhig ma yin zhes bya ba'i thal ba 'di yang bsal to zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since such things are mutually exclusive with respect to a single basis, the reductio argument ‚ÄúIf it does not give rise to itself, how could it give rise to others?‚Äù is resolved.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: Anticipating the qualms of others, he says:

original: gang zhig de'i ngo bo nyid de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig de'i ngo bo nyid de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is its very essence‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gang la la zhig 'di snyam du dngos po rtag par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos can kho na yin pas /
analyzed: gang la la zhig 'di snyam du dngos po rtag par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos can kho na yin pas /
translated: Someone might think, ‚ÄúWhatever is the essence of a permanent thing is itself the nature of what is produced without delay.

original: de ni nam yang lhan cig pa nyid la mi ltos so //üîΩ'bras @136a * //
analyzed: de ni nam yang lhan cig pa nyid la mi ltos so // 'bras @136a * //
translated: Therefore, it never relies on simultaneity.

original: bu gang yin pa de ni rkyen gzhan dag la ltos pas de las gzhan pa dang lhan cig pa dag kho na las skye'i /
analyzed: bu gang yin pa de ni rkyen gzhan dag la ltos pas de las gzhan pa dang lhan cig pa dag kho na las skye'i /
translated: Whatever is the result is dependent on other conditions. Therefore, it is produced only from what is different from it and simultaneous with it.

original: rtag pa 'ba' zhig kho na las mi ma yin no snyam du sems na ste /
analyzed: rtag pa 'ba' zhig kho na las mi ma yin no snyam du sems na ste /
translated: It is not produced from a permanent thing alone.‚Äù

original: 'di la mi sdod par bshol ba med par skyed ba'i chos yod pas 'di ni mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'di la mi sdod par bshol ba med par skyed ba'i chos yod pas 'di ni mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos can no //
translated: Here, since it has the nature of what is produced without delay, it is the nature of what is produced without delay.

original: lhan cig ba'i ngo bo ni lhan cig pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhan cig ba'i ngo bo ni lhan cig pa nyid do //
translated: Simultaneous essence is simultaneity.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the tenets says,

original: de ltar na yang ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúEven so, how could it be produced from what is simultaneous?‚Äù

original: de skad du smra ba de'i ltar na yang ji ltar rtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po de 'ba' zhig gis kyang 'bras bu gdon mi za bar skye la ;
analyzed: de skad du smra ba de'i ltar na yang ji ltar rtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po de 'ba' zhig gis kyang 'bras bu gdon mi za bar skye la ;
translated: According to those who speak in that way, how could a thing that is asserted to be permanent give rise to an effect without fail?

original: 'bras bu yang mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu de las mi skye /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu de las mi skye /
translated: And how could an effect arise from a cause that is not asserted to be a cause?

original: gang zhig mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos can yin pa des ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu bskyed dgos so //
analyzed: gang zhig mi sdod par skyed pa'i chos can yin pa des ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu bskyed dgos so //
translated: That which has the nature of giving rise to something without delay must give rise to an effect without fail.

original: gal te gdon mi za bar 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te gdon mi za bar 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin na ni /
translated: If it does not give rise to an effect without fail,

original: ji ltar mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
translated: how could it be said to have the nature of giving rise to something without delay?

original: gnas skabs de ni 'gal lo //üîΩgzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gnas skabs de ni 'gal lo // gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu bar /
translated: That state is contradictory.

original: gal te 'ba' zhig gis skyed pa kho na ni ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te 'ba' zhig gis skyed pa kho na ni ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To anticipate an objection by others, he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that it does not give rise to an effect by itself alone . . .‚Äù

original: gdon mi za bar 'ba' zhig gis skyed do zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di kho bo khas mi len to zhe na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'ba' zhig gis skyed do zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di kho bo khas mi len to zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWe do not accept that it gives rise to an effect by itself alone without fail,‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: the proponent of the thesis says,üîΩ‚ÄúIf it gives rise to an effect by itself alone,

original: de ni ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That is the response, ‚ÄúIf it is only that which is able to generate, then how could it be the nature of that which generates without delay?‚Äù

original: gal te 'ba' zhig gis gdon mi za bar mi skyed na ji ltar na bshol ba med par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin /
analyzed: gal te 'ba' zhig gis gdon mi za bar mi skyed na ji ltar na bshol ba med par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin /
translated: If it is only that which is able to generate, then how could it be the nature of that which generates without delay?

original: mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes smras pa gdon mi za bar skyed do zhes de skad du yongs su bstan pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes smras pa gdon mi za bar skyed do zhes de skad du yongs su bstan pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is said that it is the nature of that which generates without delay, but it is not taught that it is that which generates without fail.

original: 'di ltar gdon mi za bar skyed pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gdon mi za bar skyed pa /
translated: Thus, that which generates without fail

original: skyed pa kho na bshol ba med par skyed pa /
analyzed: skyed pa kho na bshol ba med par skyed pa /
translated: is only that which generates,

original: mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam grangs dag yin no //
analyzed: mi sdod par skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam grangs dag yin no //
translated: and that which generates without delay is the nature of that which generates without delay.

original: de la 'di snyam du de 'ba' zhig gis kyang nus na yid mi rten par gzhan la ltos pa gang yin pa 'di ni 'bras bu kho na'i nyes pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du de 'ba' zhig gis kyang nus na yid mi rten par gzhan la ltos pa gang yin pa 'di ni 'bras bu kho na'i nyes pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that if it is only that which is able to generate, then the reliance on another without relying on itself is the fault of the effect alone,

original: de'i phyir / 'di 'ba' zhig gis kyang nus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di 'ba' zhig gis kyang nus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: If it is only that which is able to generate, then what is the purpose of another?

original: gal te mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'ba' zhig gis kyang nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de'i tshe 'bras bu gzhan la ltos nas yang ci ste btang snyoms su 'jog / ci ste @136b btang snyoms su mi 'jog pa yin yang ci zhig byar yod ce
analyzed: gal te mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'ba' zhig gis kyang nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de'i tshe 'bras bu gzhan la ltos nas yang ci ste btang snyoms su 'jog / ci ste @136b btang snyoms su mi 'jog pa yin yang ci zhig byar yod ce
translated: If it is not generated, then what can be done?

original: na / de'i phyir /üîΩgzhan la mi 'chol bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: na / de'i phyir / gzhan la mi 'chol bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩIt is not dependent on another.

original: gzhan 'dod 'bod kyang mi 'chol bar 'bras bu na na gyis skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan 'dod 'bod kyang mi 'chol bar 'bras bu na na gyis skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The effect is generated by the cause alone, without depending on another.üîΩIf that is so, what is the benefit?

original: de lta yin na yon tan ci zhig yod ce na /üîΩde lta na 'dis bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta yin na yon tan ci zhig yod ce na / de lta na 'dis bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is said:üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.

original: gal te 'bras bu gzhan la ltos na yang nan gyis 'ba' zhig gis skyed na de lta na des rang gi nus pa bsal bar byas pa yin gyi /üîΩde lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu gzhan la ltos na yang nan gyis 'ba' zhig gis skyed na de lta na des rang gi nus pa bsal bar byas pa yin gyi / de lta ma yin te /
translated: If the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf the effect is generated by the cause alone, then it is not dependent on another.

original: mthu med pa lta bu'am /üîΩbrnyas pa lta bu zhig tu gyur na ji ltar nus par 'gyur /
analyzed: mthu med pa lta bu'am /üîΩbrnyas pa lta bu zhig tu gyur na ji ltar nus par 'gyur /
translated: If the effect is generated

original: de ltar na mi sdod skyed par byed pa ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu skyed par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mi sdod skyed par byed pa ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu skyed par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that that which generates without abiding certainly generates an effect.

original: de ni phan tshun 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni phan tshun 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that these two are mutually contradictory,

original: 'bras bu gzhan la ltos so zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan la ltos so zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the effect depends on other conditions,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'bras bu rkyen gzhan la ltos so zhes smras bas ni rtag par 'dod pa de 'ba' zhig las mi skye bar smras pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu rkyen gzhan la ltos so zhes smras bas ni rtag par 'dod pa de 'ba' zhig las mi skye bar smras pa yin la /
translated: By saying that the effect depends on other conditions, you say that it does not arise from that which is asserted to be permanent.

original: rtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po de 'ba' zhig gis kyang nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes smras pas ni de las skye bar smras ba yin na /
analyzed: rtag par 'dod pa'i dngos po de 'ba' zhig gis kyang nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes smras pas ni de las skye bar smras ba yin na /
translated: By saying that the entity that is asserted to be permanent has the nature of being potent, you say that it arises from that.

original: skye ba dang mi skye ba 'di dag dngos po gcig la ji ltar srid bar 'gyur /üîΩpha rol bo las mjug bsdu ba sngon du 'gro ba'i co 'dri bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang mi skye ba 'di dag dngos po gcig la ji ltar srid bar 'gyur / pha rol bo las mjug bsdu ba sngon du 'gro ba'i co 'dri bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: How could arising and nonarising be possible for a single entity?

original: de lta bas na phrag dog gis zug rngus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na phrag dog gis zug rngus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to ridicule the opponent, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, you are like someone who is tormented by the pain of jealousy,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gcig la skye ba dang mi skye ba dag 'gal ba ma yin yang smra ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gcig la skye ba dang mi skye ba dag 'gal ba ma yin yang smra ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because in this way, arising and non-arising are not contradictory in one thing,

original: phrag dog gi zug rngus gnad du drag rab tu brgyab pa can 'di 'chal zhing 'khang par zad pas btang snyoms su dor bar rigs so //
analyzed: phrag dog gi zug rngus gnad du drag rab tu brgyab pa can 'di 'chal zhing 'khang par zad pas btang snyoms su dor bar rigs so //
translated: therefore, this one who speaks is a person who is severely pierced by the sharp pain of jealousy, and is just confused and angry. Thus, it is fitting to let him go and be indifferent to him.

original: kha nang du bltas ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha nang du bltas ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the reason for the suffering of looking inward,

original: phrag dog nyid zug rngu ste /
analyzed: phrag dog nyid zug rngu ste /
translated: jealousy itself is a sharp pain.

original: 'di la gnang du brgyab pa yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la gnang du brgyab pa yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Since it is pierced by this, the phrase ‚Äúpierced by this‚Äù is to be applied.

original: 'chal zhes bya ba ni cal col dang 'khrugs pa dang ltag 'og ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'chal zhes bya ba ni cal col dang 'khrugs pa dang ltag 'og ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúConfused‚Äù means incoherent, agitated, and without a proper sequence.

original: dkyus ma'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dkyus ma'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the main point,

original: de lta bas na gcig skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gcig skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, when one arises,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin ba de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid gcig skyed pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa gang yin pa de ni dngos @137a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin ba de'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid gcig skyed pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa gang yin pa de ni dngos @137a * //
translated: Because that is so, the explanation that the characteristic of a single cause is to generate a single effect is refuted.üîΩ

original: po skad cig pa rnams kho na'i yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: po skad cig pa rnams kho na'i yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: Since this is so, therefore, that which is explained as the characteristic of generating a single effect is to be understood as belonging only to momentary things.

original: gang dag so so na yod pa can skad cig pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no /
analyzed: gang dag so so na yod pa can skad cig pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no /
translated: It does not belong to those that are not momentary and exist individually.

original: gang dag la so so na yod pa srid pa de dag gi so so na yod pa srid ba can rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag la so so na yod pa srid pa de dag gi so so na yod pa srid ba can rnams so //
translated: Those that exist individually are momentary.

original: yang ci'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid 'di skad cig pa ma yin pa rnams kyi yang yin par mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir lhan cig byed pa nyid 'di skad cig pa ma yin pa rnams kyi yang yin par mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it not accepted that this co-existent cause belongs to those that are not momentary?

original: de'i phyir / so sor skyed srid pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / so sor skyed srid pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúsince the production of each is possible,‚Äù etc.

original: gang dag so sor yang skyed pa srid pa de dag ni lhan cig byed pa nyid du nges par ga la rung ste /
analyzed: gang dag so sor yang skyed pa srid pa de dag ni lhan cig byed pa nyid du nges par ga la rung ste /
translated: How could those that are possible to produce individually be ascertained as co-existent causes?

original: lhan cig kho nar byed pa ni lhan cig byed pa nyid du kho na yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig kho nar byed pa ni lhan cig byed pa nyid du kho na yin no //
translated: Only that which produces an effect simultaneously is a co-existent cause.

original: de ltar na re zhig lhan cig byed pa nyid ni don gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig lhan cig byed pa nyid ni don gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the characteristic of having the same object has been taught as the characteristic of the cooperative cause.

original: phan tshun las khyad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun las khyad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The characteristic of the special cause is taught:

original: gang du rgyun gyi phan 'dogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang du rgyun gyi phan 'dogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen there is assistance through a continuum, the special cause is established as a cooperative cause.‚Äù

original: gang du rgyun gyi sgo nas phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa'i dngos po rnams rgyu yin pa der ni rgyun du la brten nas khyad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rkyen rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa rnam par gzhag gi rdzas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du rgyun gyi sgo nas phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa'i dngos po rnams rgyu yin pa der ni rgyun du la brten nas khyad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rkyen rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa rnam par gzhag gi rdzas ni ma yin no //
translated: When things are causes through assistance by way of a continuum, in that case, the cooperative cause is established as a condition that has the characteristic of a special cause arising in dependence on a continuum, but not as a substance.

original: 'dir dper bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir dper bshad pa ni /
translated: An example is given here:

original: dper na 'bras thug po che dag las 'bras chan 'byung ba la me dang chu la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams la rgyun la brten nas 'bras thug po che rnams kyi khyad par 'byung gi //
analyzed: dper na 'bras thug po che dag las 'bras chan 'byung ba la me dang chu la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams la rgyun la brten nas 'bras thug po che rnams kyi khyad par 'byung gi //
translated: For example, when rice porridge arises from rice, the special cause of the rice is established as a cooperative condition such as fire and water that assists through a continuum.

original: rdzas la brten nas ni ma yin pa lta bu dang / dper na sa bon la myu gu skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //üîΩ'bras thug po che dang sa bon la sogs ba zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdzas la brten nas ni ma yin pa lta bu dang / dper na sa bon la myu gu skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o // 'bras thug po che dang sa bon la sogs ba zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: and like the statement ‚Äúa sprout arises from a seed.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúrice, barley, seeds, etc.‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: 'bras chan dang myu gu la sogs pa de skad ces bshad de /
analyzed: 'bras chan dang myu gu la sogs pa de skad ces bshad de /
translated: Rice, barley, sprouts, etc. are so called because they are produced.

original: de dag skye ba la de skad ces bshad do //
analyzed: de dag skye ba la de skad ces bshad do //
translated: They are called that because they are produced.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su /
translated: Here, the reason is stated:

original: rdzas skad cig ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩrdzas grub pa skad cig ma gcig tu gnas pa la ni khyad par du bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: rdzas skad cig ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rdzas grub pa skad cig ma gcig tu gnas pa la ni khyad par du bya bar mi nus te /
translated: ‚Äúbecause a substance is momentary, etc.‚Äù

original: khyad par bya ba'i dus su mi sdod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par bya ba'i dus su mi sdod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A substance that is established and endures for one moment cannot be made different because it does not remain at the time it is made different.

original: 'dir rgyun gyi sgo nas phan 'dogs so zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'dir rgyun gyi sgo nas phan 'dogs so zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: Here, it is said that it is helpful in terms of a continuum. How is this?

original: de'i phyir / 'bras thug po che la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'bras thug po che la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúrice, barley, seeds, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te 'bras thug po che rnams dang me dang @137b chu dang zangs bu la sogs pa rim gyis ngo bo nyid khyab par du gyur pa zhig mi skyed par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'bras thug po che rnams dang me dang @137b chu dang zangs bu la sogs pa rim gyis ngo bo nyid khyab par du gyur pa zhig mi skyed par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the rice, fire, water, copper pot, etc. do not gradually produce a distinctive essential nature, then

original: tshe rabs brgyad kyang 'bras chan du mi 'grub la /
analyzed: tshe rabs brgyad kyang 'bras chan du mi 'grub la /
translated: even after eight years the rice will not be cooked.

original: gal te yang sa dang chu dang rlung la sogs pas rim gyis sa bon khyad par du mi byed na /
analyzed: gal te yang sa dang chu dang rlung la sogs pas rim gyis sa bon khyad par du mi byed na /
translated: And if earth, water, fire, etc. do not gradually transform the seed,

original: de'i tshe sa bon log brgyar btab kyang myu gur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sa bon log brgyar btab kyang myu gur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then even if the seed is planted a hundred times, it will not become a sprout.

original: de bzhin du gal te gang zhig snang ba nas mun khung du zhugs pa de'i dbang po la rang gi phan 'dogs pa dag gis phan mi 'dogs na de'i mig gnyis kyis bsgrims te bor yang nam yang don rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te gang zhig snang ba nas mun khung du zhugs pa de'i dbang po la rang gi phan 'dogs pa dag gis phan mi 'dogs na de'i mig gnyis kyis bsgrims te bor yang nam yang don rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, if the sense faculty of someone who has gone from light into darkness is not assisted by its own benefactors, then even if the eyes are tightly closed and then opened, the object will never be perceived.

original: phyi dang nang gi bye brag gis dpe gnyis yin no //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi bye brag gis dpe gnyis yin no //
translated: The two examples are distinguished by the terms external and internal.

original: de la 'di snyam su ji ltar skad cig ma gzhan dag la lhan cig byed pa rnams phan tshun las khyad par 'byung ba de bzhin du mi sdod par skyed pa rnams la yang ci ste mi 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam su ji ltar skad cig ma gzhan dag la lhan cig byed pa rnams phan tshun las khyad par 'byung ba de bzhin du mi sdod par skyed pa rnams la yang ci ste mi 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that just as the co-producing factors arise with a difference from each other in other moments, so too why don‚Äôt they arise with a difference in the case of those that are produced without delay?

original: de'i phyir / thogs pa med par bskyed pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / thogs pa med par bskyed pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, Candrakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúThe faculties that produce without delay,‚Äù and so on.

original: dbang po la sogs pa bshol ba med par bskyed pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun las khyad par mi skye ste /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa bshol ba med par bskyed pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun las khyad par mi skye ste /
translated: Those faculties and so on that produce without delay do not arise with a difference from each other,

original: gong du skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: gong du skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: because they are momentary, as has been explained above.

original: gal te de'i tshe khyad par 'byung bar khas mi len na /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe khyad par 'byung bar khas mi len na /
translated: If you do not accept that a difference arises at that time,

original: 'o na ji ltar de dag shes pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de dag shes pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: then how can they be the cause of cognition?

original: de'i phyir / der ni phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rkyen bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rkyen rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / der ni phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rkyen bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rkyen rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore Candrakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúThe conditions such as mutual approach,‚Äù and so on.

original: phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa gang gi bdag nyid kyi rkyen gang dag yin pa rnams kyi te gang gi phyir de lta bu dag gis dbang po la sogs pa rung ba'i yul la sogs par gnas pa can skyes pa de
analyzed: phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa gang gi bdag nyid kyi rkyen gang dag yin pa rnams kyi te gang gi phyir de lta bu dag gis dbang po la sogs pa rung ba'i yul la sogs par gnas pa can skyes pa de
translated: Those conditions that are the basis for mutual approach and so on, that is, those that cause the sense faculties and so on to arise in a suitable place, and so on,

original: khyad par 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no arising of a particular effect.

original: phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba ni gcig la gcig phrad pa ste ;

analyzed: rung ba'i yul la sogs par 'jog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A suitable place is the meaning of ‚Äúand so on.‚Äù

analyzed: phan tshun nye ba 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which is the basis for mutual approach and so on is called that.

original: rten ni 'dir rgyu'o //
analyzed: rten ni 'dir rgyu'o //
translated: Here, a basis is a cause.

analyzed: de rnams kyi skye pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gsum @138a * //

analyzed: pa ste ; de dag rgyur byas nas skyes pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúhaving arisen from those causes‚Äù is that the effect is produced from those causes.

analyzed: gang dag la rung ba'i yul la sogs par gnas pa de dag ni /

analyzed: lhan cig ngo bo nyid grub pa ni rang gi ngo bo tsam mo //
translated: The simultaneous establishment of the effect and the cause is merely their own nature.

analyzed: yang khyad par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi lhan cig byed ba nyid ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /

translated: Wherever co-emergent factors are mutually distinctive conditions, there the continuum obtains a distinctive identity.üîΩ

analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gzhan dag la ltos pa yin no //
translated: In some cases, the co-operating causes are conditions in the sense of being reciprocal modifiers. In that case, the continuum is dependent on other co-operating conditions in order to obtain a special nature.

analyzed: de'i phyir de dag las mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: skad cig ma brgyud pas ngo bo nyid gzhan mthun pa dang chod mthun pa dang / ches cher mthun pa 'thob bo zhes bya ste /

analyzed: dper na skad cig ma tha ma lta bu'o // de ltar na thams cad du skad cig ma gcig gi dbang du byas nas don gcig byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni /

original: lhan cig pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in all cases, co-existence should be understood as the characteristic of performing a single function in terms of a single moment.

analyzed: de'i phyir / de la rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: gnyis pa las gsum pa ches nye ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The third would arise from the second, and the fourth would arise from the third.

translated: This is the process of the
