translated: The coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩWhat is the reason?üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩWhat is the reason?üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩWhat is the reason?üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩWhat is the reason?üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩWhat is the reason?üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩWhat is the reason?üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩWhat is the reason?üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩWhat is the reason?üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.üîΩThe coemergent causes are not always coemergent.

original: gang dag la de skyed par rung bar gnas pa yod pa de dag ni 'bras bu skyes @139b ba dang mthun pa'i khyad par bskyed par rung ba gnas pa can no //
analyzed: gang dag la de skyed par rung bar gnas pa yod pa de dag ni 'bras bu skyes @139b ba dang mthun pa'i khyad par bskyed par rung ba gnas pa can no //
translated: Those that are suitable to generate that are those that possess the capacity to generate a specific result that is suitable to arise.

original: ci'i phyir lhan cig byed pa dag da lta bu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lhan cig byed pa dag da lta bu ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are co-producing causes not always present?

original: de'i phyir / de med pa dang yod pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de med pa dang yod pa dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: To answer that, he says, ‚ÄúWhen they are absent or present,‚Äù and so on.

original: lhan cig byed pa gang dag yod de nye na ni 'bras bu gsal ba mthong ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa gang dag yod de nye na ni 'bras bu gsal ba mthong ba'i phyir la /
translated: When co-producing causes are present and near, a clear result is seen.

original: med de bral na ni 'bras bu bral ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di skad du gal te lhan cig byed pa rnams dus thams cad du phan tshun nas 'bras bu skye ba dang mthun pa'i khyad par bskyed par rung ba gnas pa dag yin na ci'i phyir res 'ga' ni 'bras bu skye la /
analyzed: med de bral na ni 'bras bu bral ba mthong ba'i phyir ro // 'di skad du gal te lhan cig byed pa rnams dus thams cad du phan tshun nas 'bras bu skye ba dang mthun pa'i khyad par bskyed par rung ba gnas pa dag yin na ci'i phyir res 'ga' ni 'bras bu skye la /
translated: When they are absent and separated, a separated result is seen.

original: res 'ga' ni bral bar 'gyur zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni bral bar 'gyur zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: This is saying, ‚ÄúIf co-producing causes are always present and suitable to generate a specific result that is suitable to arise, why is it that sometimes a result arises and sometimes it is separated?‚Äù

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa dus thams cad du de lta bu ma yin du chug na yang des na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa dus thams cad du de lta bu ma yin du chug na yang des na ci zhe na /
translated: But even if it is not so that the coemergent causes are always like that, then what?

original: de'i phyir / des na khyad par dang po zhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / des na khyad par dang po zhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, Candrakƒ±ÃÑrti says, ‚ÄúTherefore, the first difference is destroyed,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar lhan cig byed pa rnams rtag tu de lta ma yin pa'i rgyu des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar lhan cig byed pa rnams rtag tu de lta ma yin pa'i rgyu des na /
translated: Since the coemergent causes are not always like that,

original: khyad par dang po tshogs pa'i 'og skad cig ma gnyis pa la skye ba gang yin pa de ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis phan ma btags pa yin par mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par dang po tshogs pa'i 'og skad cig ma gnyis pa la skye ba gang yin pa de ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis phan ma btags pa yin par mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not tenable that the first difference, that is, that which arises in the second moment after the assembly of the causes, is not helped by the coemergent causes.

original: de med pa yin na ni skad cig ma gnyis pa'i khyad par yang med la /
analyzed: de med pa yin na ni skad cig ma gnyis pa'i khyad par yang med la /
translated: If it does not exist, then the difference of the second moment would not exist.

original: de bzhin du tha ma dang nye ba'i skad cig ma'i khyad par gyi bar du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du tha ma dang nye ba'i skad cig ma'i khyad par gyi bar du med pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, up to the difference of the last moment would not exist.

original: ji ltar skad cig ma tha ma ba nus pa skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar skad cig ma tha ma ba nus pa skye bar 'gyur /
translated: How could the last moment arise with the potential?

original: de yang med na ni ji ltar tshogs pa dag las mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skye zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang med na ni ji ltar tshogs pa dag las mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skye zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i dogs pa yin no //
translated: If that is not so, then how could the effect that is desired arise from the assembly?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /üîΩzur gyis mtho btsams pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas / zur gyis mtho btsams pa'i phyir /
translated: The one who advocates the tenetsüîΩsays,

original: kho bo ni yang dang yang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kho bo ni yang dang yang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf I were to say it again and again,

original: gal te yang dang yang brjod na yang 'jig rten gyis rig pa go ba lta na lan brgyar yang smra'i /
analyzed: gal te yang dang yang brjod na yang 'jig rten gyis rig pa go ba lta na lan brgyar yang smra'i /
translated: even though I say it again and again, if the world understands, I will say it a hundred times.

original: lan gcig gam gnyis smra brjod lta zhig su zhig 'dra ste /
analyzed: lan gcig gam gnyis smra brjod lta zhig su zhig 'dra ste /
translated: Who would say it once or twice?

original: pha rol gyi don la zhus pa kho bo ni de lta bu la brjod pa la nam yang skyo ba med do //
analyzed: pha rol gyi don la zhus pa kho bo ni de lta bu la brjod pa la nam yang skyo ba med do //
translated: I am never tired of saying this to those who ask about the meaning of the other side.

original: kye gal te skyo ba med na /
analyzed: kye gal te skyo ba med na /
translated: ‚ÄúOh, if you are not tired,

original: 'o na smros shig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na smros shig ce na /
translated: then say it.‚Äù

original: lhan cig byed pa rnams ni gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa rnams ni gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe co-arisen are those by which,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gis na de dag phan tshun nas 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis na de dag phan tshun nas 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: By which they are not mutually established.

original: khyad par dang po bskyed par bya ba la lhan cig byed pa dag nyid du mi 'gyur pa phan tshun nas khyad par bskyed pa'i @140a * //
analyzed: khyad par dang po bskyed par bya ba la lhan cig byed pa dag nyid du mi 'gyur pa phan tshun nas khyad par bskyed pa'i @140a * //
translated: In particular, the conditions that generate the first moment of a sprout are not co-operating conditions, because they generate a difference from each other.

original: mtshan nyid kho na ni lhan cig byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kho na ni lhan cig byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The mere characteristic of generating a difference is not co-operating.

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu gcig sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu gcig sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: However, co-operating conditions are those that establish a single effect.

original: 'di ltar tshogs pa'i skad cig ma dang blo 'byung ba'i lhan cig byed pa de dag thams cad ni 'dus nas skad cig ma gnyis pa la khyad par zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu bskyed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshogs pa'i skad cig ma dang blo 'byung ba'i lhan cig byed pa de dag thams cad ni 'dus nas skad cig ma gnyis pa la khyad par zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu bskyed de /
translated: Thus, the co-operating conditions of the arising of a moment of consciousness in the collection are all those that, having assembled, generate the effect called a difference in the second moment.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gi lhan cig byed pa nyid ni de'i rgyu can yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gi lhan cig byed pa nyid ni de'i rgyu can yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, their co-operation is due to that.

original: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dgos pa bsu bar /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs kyi dgos pa bsu bar /
translated: In order to provide an opportunity for the words of others,

original: gal te phan tshun nas khyad par med pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun nas khyad par med pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the co-operating conditions of those that are not mutually different . . .‚Äù

original: don gcig byed pa lhan cig byed pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang phan tshun nas khyad par med pa'i lhan cig byed pa rnams la med do //
analyzed: don gcig byed pa lhan cig byed pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang phan tshun nas khyad par med pa'i lhan cig byed pa rnams la med do //
translated: That which is asserted as the characteristic of co-operating factors in the performance of a single function does not exist for co-operating factors that are not mutually distinct.

original: gal te yod na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it does exist, what is the fault?

original: de'i phyir / 'on te yod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'on te yod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Hence he says: ‚ÄúIf it does exist, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te khyad par med pa rnams la yang don gcig byed pa yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par med pa rnams la yang don gcig byed pa yod par gyur na /
translated: If the performance of a single function exists even in those that are not distinct,

original: de'i tshe so sor la yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe so sor la yang 'gyur te /
translated: then it would exist in each individual case.

original: so sor khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu de skyed par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: so sor khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu de skyed par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that the effect characterized by distinctness would be produced in each individual case.

original: de lta yin na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta yin na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault if that is the case?

original: de'i phyir / de lta ni khyad par de las 'byung ba can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / de lta ni khyad par de las 'byung ba can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: Hence he says: ‚ÄúIn that case, the distinctness of the co-operating factors would be meaningless,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe so sor yang khyad par skyed pa de ltar yin pa de'i tshe khyad par dang po'i brgyud pa las 'byung ba'i 'bras bu yang 'ba' zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe so sor yang khyad par skyed pa de ltar yin pa de'i tshe khyad par dang po'i brgyud pa las 'byung ba'i 'bras bu yang 'ba' zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to generate a specific difference, then the effect that arises from the continuum of the first specific difference would arise from a single cause.

original: 'di ni de yang yin la khyad par yang yin pas khyad par de'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de yang yin la khyad par yang yin pas khyad par de'o //
translated: This is a specific difference, because it is that and it is a specific difference.

original: 'di la de las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul yod pas 'di ni khyad par de las 'byung ba can no //
analyzed: 'di la de las 'byung ba'i ngang tshul yod pas 'di ni khyad par de las 'byung ba can no //
translated: This has the nature of arising from that, therefore it arises from that specific difference.

original: 'di skad du gal te so sor bye brag skyed na /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te so sor bye brag skyed na /
translated: This is what the opponent means when he says: If it generates a specific difference,

original: myu gu la sogs pa mngon par 'dod ba'i ' ras bu yang ci ste mi skyed ces bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa mngon par 'dod ba'i ' ras bu yang ci ste mi skyed ces bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'i bsams pa yin no //
translated: why does it not generate the sprout that is the desired effect?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the thesis says:

original: sngar bshad pa dran par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa dran par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remind one of what was previously explained,

original: thams cad bshad zin to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad bshad zin to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAll of this has been explained,‚Äù and so on.

original: rkyen tshogs pa gzhan dag gzhan dag gis ji ltar rgyu'i rgyun la skad cig skad cig la khyad par skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: rkyen tshogs pa gzhan dag gzhan dag gis ji ltar rgyu'i rgyun la skad cig skad cig la khyad par skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar gong du bshad zin to //
translated: The other conditions that are assembled in the causal continuum are the causes of the arising of the differences in each instant, as has been explained above.

original: skad cig de re rkyen gzhan dang gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhung zlos par @140b byed pa ste /üîΩ'di ni 'du byed rgyud ma gzhan dang gzhan gyi rkyen dang ldan skad cig ma re re la nus pa tha dad pa dag ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: skad cig de re rkyen gzhan dang gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhung zlos par @140b byed pa ste / 'di ni 'du byed rgyud ma gzhan dang gzhan gyi rkyen dang ldan skad cig ma re re la nus pa tha dad pa dag ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúeach instant‚Äù and so on are a repetition of the text.

original: 'ga' zhig kho na 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyu gzhung 'dis lan btab zin to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kho na 'ga' zhig gi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyu gzhung 'dis lan btab zin to //
translated: This is the reply to the question, ‚ÄúAre the different potencies of the continuum of formations, which are endowed with the conditions of other and other, in each instant, the causes of each other?‚Äù

original: 'dis ni 'di skad di //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad di //
translated: This is what is being said:

original: tshogs pa'i skad cig ma dang po la lhan cig byed pa rnams phan tshun nas khyad par 'byung ba med mod kyi /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i skad cig ma dang po la lhan cig byed pa rnams phan tshun nas khyad par 'byung ba med mod kyi /
translated: In the first instant of the assembly, the co-operating causes do not mutually produce differences.

original: 'on kyang rang rang gi rgyu dag gis khyad par can kho nar bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang rang gi rgyu dag gis khyad par can kho nar bskyed pa yin te /
translated: However, they are produced by their own causes as having differences.

original: de'i phyir / khyad par med pa rnams la de yang med do zhes gang smras pa de bas la ba yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / khyad par med pa rnams la de yang med do zhes gang smras pa de bas la ba yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that what was said, ‚Äúthat is also absent where there is no difference,‚Äù is not so.

original: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa skye bar rung ba'i yul na rnam par gnas pa rnams dang / chod pa med pa rnams dang / tshogs pa'i rkyen rnams mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed ba yin pa de ltar yang ci rigs par yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa skye bar rung ba'i yul na rnam par gnas pa rnams dang / chod pa med pa rnams dang / tshogs pa'i rkyen rnams mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed ba yin pa de ltar yang ci rigs par yang bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained how the object that is present in front of consciousness, that is not obstructed, and that has the conditions of assembly produces the effect that is desired.

original: 'di dag la rnam par shes pa skye bar rung ba'i yul yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di dag la rnam par shes pa skye bar rung ba'i yul yod pas zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhere there is an object that is suitable for the arising of consciousness‚Äù should be supplied.

original: de dag gi ngo bo ni yul rung ba can nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo ni yul rung ba can nyid do //
translated: The nature of these is that they are suitable as objects.

original: de la sogs pa rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gang dag yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gang dag yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what is meant by ‚Äúthat state which is capable of producing consciousness.‚Äù

original: rkyen gang dag la yul rung ba can nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag yod pa de dag ni yul rung ba can nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag dag ste /
analyzed: rkyen gang dag la yul rung ba can nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag yod pa de dag ni yul rung ba can nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag dag ste /
translated: Those conditions that have the specific states of being suitable objects and so on are the specific states of being suitable objects and so on.

original: 'di yang de la gzugs dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshigs yul chod ba med pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa can gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di bshad zin to ;
analyzed: 'di yang de la gzugs dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshigs yul chod ba med pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa can gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di bshad zin to ;
translated: This also explains that the eye sense faculty and so on that possess the state of being suitable objects and so on are the causes that are able to generate consciousness.

original: /'dis kyang ji ltar phan tshun nas khyad par du gyur pa ma skyes pa dag las khyad par 'byung ba de bzhin du 'bras bu yang 'gyur te zhes smras pa gang yin pa de bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: /'dis kyang ji ltar phan tshun nas khyad par du gyur pa ma skyes pa dag las khyad par 'byung ba de bzhin du 'bras bu yang 'gyur te zhes smras pa gang yin pa de bsal ba yin te /
translated: This also refutes the assertion that just as a specific state arises from unarisen specific states, so too an effect would arise.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu ni phan tshun btags pa'i lhan cig byed pa las rab tu skye ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu ni phan tshun btags pa'i lhan cig byed pa las rab tu skye ba yin la /
translated: Because an effect arises from the assembly of mutually imputed coemergent causes.

original: khyad par dang po ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang po ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: The first specific state is not like that.

original: 'bras bu skyed pa'i rkyen de dag kyang gang las skyes pa de yang de dag phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten rkyen gyi khyad par gang yin pa de ni de'i rgyu bskyed par nus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar skabs 'dir bshad zinüîΩto ; so sor 'bras bu bskyed par @141a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa'i rkyen de dag kyang gang las skyes pa de yang de dag phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rten rkyen gyi khyad par gang yin pa de ni de'i rgyu bskyed par nus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar skabs 'dir bshad zin to ; so sor 'bras bu bskyed par @141a * //
translated: Also, the conditions that generate the effect arise from that which generates them, and the specific conditions that are the basis for their mutual approach and so on are capable of generating the cause of that effect.üîΩThis has already been explained above.

original: nus pa yin yang ji ltar 'ba' zhig dag gis mi skyed pa de yang bshad zin te /
analyzed: nus pa yin yang ji ltar 'ba' zhig dag gis mi skyed pa de yang bshad zin te /
translated: Even though they are capable of individually generating the effect, it has already been explained how they do not generate it alone.üîΩThis is because the specific agent does not exist individually.

original: de ni byed pa po'i khyad par so so na yod pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis phyogs gcig bzlas pa dran par byed de /
analyzed: de ni byed pa po'i khyad par so so na yod pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis phyogs gcig bzlas pa dran par byed de /
translated: This is a repetition of the previous point, which is recalled here.

original: gong du de dag kyang sngon yang med phyis kyang med so so nas yang med pas nus kyang sngon dang phyis dang so so na yod pa las 'byung ba'i nyes pa dag gis mi gos so zhes bya ba'i bar skabs 'dir bshad zin to //
analyzed: gong du de dag kyang sngon yang med phyis kyang med so so nas yang med pas nus kyang sngon dang phyis dang so so na yod pa las 'byung ba'i nyes pa dag gis mi gos so zhes bya ba'i bar skabs 'dir bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained above, from ‚ÄúThey do not exist before, they do not exist after, and they do not exist individually. Therefore, even though they are capable, they are not tainted by the faults that arise from existing before, after, and individually.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir khyad par de las 'byung ba can gyi 'bras bu yang 'ba' zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par de las 'byung ba can gyi 'bras bu yang 'ba' zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin te ;
translated: Therefore, the response that the effect arises from just that specific condition is refuted.

original: skad cig ma de lta bu ni 'byung ba 'am 'byung bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: skad cig ma de lta bu ni 'byung ba 'am 'byung bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Such a moment does not arise or will not arise,

original: 'di'i skad cig byed pa rnams so sor bya bar yang mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di'i skad cig byed pa rnams so sor bya bar yang mi nus so //
translated: and its moments cannot be individually performed.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'bras bu cung zad cig ni lhan cig byed pa phan tshun phan btags pa'i rang gi ngo bo dag gis bskyed do //
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'bras bu cung zad cig ni lhan cig byed pa phan tshun phan btags pa'i rang gi ngo bo dag gis bskyed do //
translated: If you think that some effects are generated by the mutual assistance of coemergent conditions,

original: cung zad cig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i 'dod rgyal 'di ga las snyam du sems na /üîΩde'i phyir / 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i 'dod rgyal 'di ga las snyam du sems na / de'i phyir / 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: but some are not, then where is this capriciousness?üîΩTo respond, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩThe effect has two aspects.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis la 'bras bu ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis bskyed pa'i khyad par brgyud pa las 'byung ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis la 'bras bu ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis bskyed pa'i khyad par brgyud pa las 'byung ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'i chos can yin te /
translated: The effect has two aspects: the effect that arises from the specific continuum generated by the coemergent conditions is called ‚Äúarisen.‚Äù

original: dper na myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a sprout, etc.

original: la la ni lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par la mi ldog par yud tsam kho nas skye ba yin te /
analyzed: la la ni lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par la mi ldog par yud tsam kho nas skye ba yin te /
translated: Some are produced by the special cause of the assemblage of conditions, but are not produced for a long time, but are produced in an instant.

original: dper na mi sdod par skyed pa'i dbang po rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi sdod par skyed pa'i dbang po rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the faculties, consciousness, etc., which are produced without delay.

original: lhan cig byed pa dag gis bskyed pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa dag gis bskyed pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúproduced by the assemblage of conditions‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: de dag ni lhan cig byed pas bskyed pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni lhan cig byed pas bskyed pa yang yin la /
translated: They are produced by the assemblage of conditions,

original: khyad par yang yin pas zhes bsdu'o //üîΩde dag brgyud pa la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par yang yin pas zhes bsdu'o // de dag brgyud pa la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: and they are special, thus the compound is resolved.üîΩThey are called ‚Äúproduced by the assemblage of conditions‚Äù because they are produced by the assemblage of conditions.

original: 'di la de las 'byung ba'i chos yod pas 'di ni lhan cig byed pas bskyed pa'i brgyud pa'i khyad par las 'byung pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'di la de las 'byung ba'i chos yod pas 'di ni lhan cig byed pas bskyed pa'i brgyud pa'i khyad par las 'byung pa'i chos can no //
translated: They are called ‚Äúspecial‚Äù because they are produced by the assemblage of conditions.

original: mi sdod par skyed pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni sdod pa med par bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mi sdod par skyed pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni sdod pa med par bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The faculties, consciousness, etc., which are produced without delay are the consciousness, etc., which are produced without delay.

original: mi sdod pa smos pa ni snang ba nas mun khung du zhugs pa'i phan btags pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi sdod pa smos pa ni snang ba nas mun khung du zhugs pa'i phan btags pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúnot remaining‚Äù is to exclude the sense consciousness that benefits by entering from light into darkness.

original: dbang po ni 'dir yid la @141b byed pa la sogs pa mtshon pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni 'dir yid la @141b byed pa la sogs pa mtshon pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the sense faculty should be understood as illustrated by the mental faculty.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'bras bu de rnam pa gnyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'bras bu de rnam pa gnyis yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the result twofold?

original: de'i phyir / 'bras bu dang rgyu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'bras bu dang rgyu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúthe result is different in nature from the cause.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu kho na la /
analyzed: 'bras bu kho na la /
translated: The result is only the result of the cause.

original: la la ni rgyu dang skyen tshogs pa tsam kho na las mi skye'i /
analyzed: la la ni rgyu dang skyen tshogs pa tsam kho na las mi skye'i /
translated: Some do not arise from the mere assembly of causes and conditions.
